name: Roadside Ambush
prompt: In the central marches, the road narrows between thorn and stone. A snap of brush, then men with patched mail and watchful eyes step out with blades drawn.

outcomes.title: Break Their Line
outcomes.desc: Meet violence with violence, hit hard enough that the rest lose heart.

success.text: You crash into them like a hammer into wet wood. The first bandit goes down with a sound that quiets the rest, and the survivors scatter into the brush.

fail.text: You commit to the charge, and pay for it. A hidden blade finds the gap at your ribs, and pain flares.

outcomes.title: Fight Dirty
outcomes.desc: Win fast, use whatever the road gives you and let morality limp behind.

success.text: You throw sand, pull a cloak, break a knee, anything that ends it before it begins. When the last one runs, you take what they took from others: a purse, a ring, a folded scrap with names on it.

fail.text: Your trick goes wrong at the worst moment. Someone sees the ugly part, the knife in the back, the panic in the eyes, and the tale reaches the wrong ears.

outcomes.title: Bargain for Passage
outcomes.desc: Put your hands up, your voice steady, and make the violence feel expensive.

success.text: You speak like a person who will be missed. Coin changes hands with a practiced sigh, and the bandits let you go as if you’re merely another toll.

fail.text: They laugh at your words and count your purse with their eyes. You pay more than you meant to, and the humiliation gnaws at you long after they’ve melted back into the brush.

outcomes.title: Hold the Rear, Save the Pack
outcomes.desc: Buy time. Keep them busy. Let what matters get away.

success.text: You don’t try to win; you try to last. You trade ground for seconds, and when you finally peel away, your pack is lighter but intact.

fail.text: You hold too long. The straps tear, a bundle spills, and the bandits take what they can before you wrench free.

name: Duel at Dawn
prompt: In the central marches, a careless word becomes a careful threat. At first light, your rival waits in the dew-silver grass with witnesses who pretend they’re impartial.

outcomes.title: Answer the Challenge
outcomes.desc: Stand in the open and let steel decide what words could not.

success.text: You step in on the first exchange and end the question cleanly. The witnesses exhale as one; no one wants a long duel when blood is real.

fail.text: Your rival is faster than their smile suggested. Pain blooms, hot and immediate, and the world narrows to keeping your feet under you.

outcomes.title: Win with a Feint
outcomes.desc: Let them commit first, then punish the mistake.

success.text: You sell a stumble, draw their lunge, and answer with a cut that ends the performance. The onlookers clap because they don’t understand what they saw, only that you’re standing.

fail.text: Your trick reads like cowardice the moment it falters. You take a shallow wound and a deeper insult as the witnesses murmur into their sleeves.

outcomes.title: Dissect the Claim
outcomes.desc: Turn the duel into a debate, make their ‘honor’ look like theater.

success.text: You name the custom, the precedent, the exact clause that makes their challenge improper. The witnesses shift; the rival’s confidence cracks in public.

fail.text: You reach for law and find only air, your words turn clever and then desperate. The rival laughs, the witnesses smirk, and you feel the room decide what sort of person you are.

outcomes.title: Refuse and Endure
outcomes.desc: Do not play their game. Accept the whispers and keep walking.

success.text: You don’t give them the scene they want. Some will call it weakness, others will call it restraint, and restraint travels farther than bravado.

fail.text: You refuse, and the story becomes theirs. By sundown, you’ve been painted as a coward by people who weren’t willing to stand where you stood.

name: Siege Fire
prompt: In the central marches, a town’s edge is on fire, roof-thatch and tar running like oil. Raiders move in the smoke, half seen and fully cruel.

outcomes.title: Lead a Sortie
outcomes.desc: Cut through the smoke, hit their flank, and buy the town a breath.

success.text: You rally a handful of the brave and the scared and turn them into a blade. The raiders don’t expect resistance that moves toward them, and they break.

fail.text: Smoke eats your sight and screams eat your focus. You find the raiders, too late, and the clash is messy and close.

outcomes.title: Plan the Defenses
outcomes.desc: Buckets, barricades, rotations, turn panic into a pattern people can follow.

success.text: You point, assign, repeat, simple orders that stop people from freezing. Water lines form, alleys are blocked, and the raiders find fewer soft targets than they wanted.

fail.text: You try to build order out of terror and find that terror has its own logic. People ignore you, or misunderstand you, or run when you need them steady.

outcomes.title: Sabotage the Raiders
outcomes.desc: A knife in the dark, a rope cut, a cart overturned, quiet work with loud results.

success.text: You vanish into smoke and return with small disasters in your wake: a dropped lantern among their own wagons, a commander’s pouch missing, a signal horn smashed. The town is saved by a thousand little choices made in time.

fail.text: Your shadow-work is noticed at the worst moment. A raider’s hand clamps your wrist; a voice hisses your description to others.

outcomes.title: Hold Morale Together
outcomes.desc: Keep people moving. Keep them from turning on each other when fear runs out of targets.

success.text: You speak into the smoke like a bell, clear, steady, impossible to ignore. Hands stop shaking long enough to do what needs doing, and the worst impulses stay caged.

fail.text: Your words land wrong, too late, too sharp, too much like command. Someone shouts back, someone else throws a punch, and the crowd decides you’re another problem to solve.

name: Mercenary Offer
prompt: In a shipyard port’s shipyards, a mercenary captain sits easy by their cookfire, armor oiled and boots muddy. They offer you a contract with the smile of someone who has sold loyalty a hundred times and never once believed in it.

outcomes.title: Hire Them
outcomes.desc: Coin for blades, professional, immediate, and never truly free.

success.text: You speak terms; you speak payment, and the captain nods like a merchant closing a bargain. Their soldiers fall in behind you with practiced quiet, and people notice you travel with teeth.

fail.text: You pay, and you realize too late what else you agreed to. A favor is mentioned like an afterthought, then repeated like a rule.

outcomes.title: Train with Them
outcomes.desc: Put pride aside and learn the kind of skill that survives ugly fights.

success.text: You take bruises where lessons live. The mercenaries don’t flatter you, they correct you, again and again, until your stance stops lying.

fail.text: Sparring turns rough when someone decides to ‘test’ you. You walk away with a minor injury and a sour taste in your mouth, like you paid in pain for a lesson you didn’t get to finish.

outcomes.title: Cheat the Captain
outcomes.desc: Promise payment you don’t intend to deliver, and keep your smile steady.

success.text: You let them believe you’re richer than you are and more backed than you’re willing to admit. The captain signs, the company moves, and you pocket what would’ve been their share.

fail.text: The captain’s eyes don’t blink when you speak. They’ve heard your trick in three cities and two wars.

outcomes.title: Decline Politely
outcomes.desc: No deal, no debt, just distance and an exit before the offer sours.

success.text: You refuse without insult, and the captain respects the shape of your boundaries. Word travels that you can say ‘no’ without flinching, which is rarer than people admit.

fail.text: Your refusal lands like judgment. The captain’s smile thins, and a few nearby listeners decide you think you’re too good for honest work.

name: Missing Purse
prompt: In a banking city, you reach for your coin and find only cloth. The crowd is thick, the air smells of spice and sweat, and someone nearby is suddenly walking very fast.

outcomes.title: Catch the Thief
outcomes.desc: Make the chase obvious. Make the grab undeniable.

success.text: You shove through the crowd, hook an arm, and slam the thief into a stall hard enough to rattle pots. Your purse hits the ground and a few extra coins spill out with it, someone else’s, maybe.

fail.text: You catch up, and a friend of the thief catches you. Something sharp glances off your shoulder in the press, and the crowd turns into a wall.

outcomes.title: Spot the Trick
outcomes.desc: Don’t chase the runner. Watch who benefits from the distraction.

success.text: You trace the motion like a puzzle: the bump, the apology, the hand that lingered a heartbeat too long. You reclaim your purse, plus a glimpse of how the crew works, who signals whom, and where they vanish.

fail.text: You’re sure you saw it… and you’re wrong. The crowd shifts, the moment passes, and you’re left with the cold fact of being lighter than you were.

outcomes.title: Set a Bait
outcomes.desc: Make your purse an invitation, and your patience a trap.

success.text: You let the thief take it again, then close the circle with a nod to a stall-keeper and a foot in the right place. When you retrieve your coin, there’s more in the purse than before—either a ‘fee’ for the trouble or a mistake you don’t correct.

fail.text: Your trap looks like extortion when the wrong eyes notice. Someone shouts for guards, and suddenly you’re the one being pointed at.

outcomes.title: Appeal to the Crowd
outcomes.desc: Turn your loss into a performance, make theft unpopular for a minute.

success.text: You raise your voice and make the theft everyone’s concern: honor, safety, the kind of city people want to live in. The crowd shifts, a few hands grab at the runner, and your purse returns with an awkward apology and averted eyes.

fail.text: You speak, and the crowd decides you’re simply noisy. Someone laughs, someone mimics you, and the thief is gone by the time your words find purchase.

name: Whispered Allegation
prompt: In the central marches, you hear it in the pauses between greetings: a rumor about you, polished and ready, spreading too quickly to be chance. Someone is feeding it, quietly, carefully, like a fire they want to look accidental.

outcomes.title: Confront the Source
outcomes.desc: Drag the whisper into daylight and make someone own it.

success.text: You corner the loudest mouth in front of people who matter and ask for names, dates, proof. They falter, and the room tastes their fear.

fail.text: You push too hard and look guilty doing it. The source smiles, the crowd leans in, and your anger becomes fuel for the tale.

outcomes.title: Follow the Trail
outcomes.desc: Treat it like a puzzle: who started it, who repeats it, who profits.

success.text: You listen more than you speak. Patterns emerge: the same phrasing, the same pauses, the same careful omissions.

fail.text: You chase threads until they knot. Every lead becomes another conversation, another late walk, another sleepless hour.

outcomes.title: Spread a Counter-Rumor
outcomes.desc: If they’re writing a story about you, pick up the pen and stain it.

success.text: You seed a sweeter lie in the right ears, one that flatters the listeners for believing it. The original rumor still exists, but now it has competition, and people love choosing whichever story makes them feel clever.

fail.text: Your counter-rumor spreads… with your fingerprints on it. Someone notices how eagerly you’ve tried to redirect the flow, and they decide you must have something to hide.

outcomes.title: Say Nothing
outcomes.desc: Let the lie starve. Keep your face calm until the city finds a new meal.

success.text: You refuse to chase shadows. Without your reaction, the rumor loses its sport, and the gossips drift to fresher prey.

fail.text: Silence reads as confession to the sort of people who enjoy certainty. The rumor thickens while you hold still, and you feel your standing slip in small, invisible ways.

name: Counterfeit Seal
prompt: In a banking city, a packet of papers crosses your hands, clean vellum, expensive ink, and a seal that is almost perfect. Almost.

outcomes.title: Report It to a Proper Clerk
outcomes.desc: Bring the fraud into daylight, where liars hate to stand.

success.text: You present the flaw with calm certainty: the pressure line, the wax blend, the angle of the crest. The clerk pales, then nods, this matters.

fail.text: Your warning lands poorly. Someone in the office goes still, too still, and later you feel eyes on you in the street.

outcomes.title: Use the Seal Once
outcomes.desc: A false mark opens real doors, briefly.

success.text: You choose a door that will not ask questions and a moment when no one wants to be the one who delays an ‘official’ matter. The seal does its work.

fail.text: The wrong person examines the wax. Their eyes narrow.

outcomes.title: Study the Hand Behind It
outcomes.desc: Learn the lie well enough to recognize its siblings.

success.text: You take your time, fingerprints in wax, micro-scratches on the stamp, tiny habits a craftsman can’t help leaving behind. It’s a language of fraud, and you’ve learned a few words of it.

fail.text: Hours pass in tense concentration. In the end you’ve gained only suspicion and a headache, and you feel as though the document has stared back at you the whole time.

outcomes.title: Burn It Quietly
outcomes.desc: Destroy the evidence before it destroys you.

success.text: You feed the papers to flame until only ash remains. You’ve chosen caution over advantage.

fail.text: Someone sees the smoke at the wrong time. No accusation is spoken aloud, but you feel the shift: a small, private attention settling onto you like dust.

name: Backroom Auction
prompt: In a toll city, a dozen quiet people pretend they’re strangers. Forbidden goods sit on a cloth like offerings: a reliquary shard, a sealed letter, a knife that looks too honest.

outcomes.title: Bid for the Prize
outcomes.desc: Spend coin to buy advantage, and accept that the room will remember your face.

success.text: You bid like you belong there, and people believe you because you sound like you do. The prize comes wrapped in plain cloth, heavier than it should be, and a few eyes follow it all the way to your hands.

fail.text: You pay, and then someone laughs, too softly, and the bidding turns against you like a tide. Your coin is taken, your pride is dented, and when you stand to leave, the room’s silence feels judgmental.

outcomes.title: Steal It
outcomes.desc: Take what you want and trust your legs to solve the rest.

success.text: A candle gutters at the right moment, and you become a rumor instead of a person. The prize slips into your coat with the clean satisfaction of theft done well.

fail.text: Your hand closes on the prize, and another hand closes on your wrist like a shackle. The door slams, voices sharpen, and you bolt through a side passage with your heart in your throat.

outcomes.title: Identify the Buyers
outcomes.desc: Don’t chase objects. Chase names.

success.text: You watch hands and rings, note who nods to whom, count which bids are signals rather than prices. The goods are less important than the network buying them.

fail.text: Everyone in the room is practiced at looking like no one. You chase false tells until your thoughts fray, and you realize you’ve learned only that you’re outmatched here.

outcomes.title: Walk Away
outcomes.desc: Leave your hands clean, your purse closed, and your curiosity unsatisfied.

success.text: You take one last look, then decide the cost isn’t worth the story. No one stops you; no one needs to.

fail.text: You turn to go, and a familiar face notices you noticing. Later, a door closes more slowly for you, a conversation ends when you approach.

name: Petition Day
prompt: In the capital’s court, the hall is packed with people who have practiced their suffering in front of mirrors. A farmer with cracked hands.

outcomes.title: Back the Commoners
outcomes.desc: Side with the small voices, even if the large ones take note.

success.text: You speak plainly, without flourish, and the room understands that you mean it. The commoners don’t cheer, this isn’t a play, but their posture changes, and so do a few guarded looks from the benches up front.

fail.text: Your support lands awkwardly, too loud, too naïve, too easy to caricature. A noble laughs at the wrong moment and the room follows their lead.

outcomes.title: Back the Lords
outcomes.desc: Choose stability and patronage over fairness and applause.

success.text: You align yourself with power as if it were simple prudence. The lords nod; the steward relaxes; the hall moves on.

fail.text: You pick the powerful side, and still manage to offend them, which is a special kind of mistake. The petitioners glare, the lords bristle, and you leave having bought no one’s gratitude.

outcomes.title: Investigate the Claim
outcomes.desc: Slow the rush to judgment and look for what the room is hiding from itself.

success.text: You ask the questions that make liars swallow. Dates.

fail.text: You pull threads until the whole hearing snarls. People get impatient with complexity, especially when it threatens their preferred outcome.

outcomes.title: Profit Quietly
outcomes.desc: While everyone argues in public, you make your arrangements in private.

success.text: You sell little promises to people too angry to notice they’re being handled. A coin here, a coin there, nothing dramatic, nothing traceable.

fail.text: You try to skim from the chaos and someone catches the shape of your hands moving. A rumor begins in the same breath as your ‘bargain,’ and it spreads faster than you can deny it.

name: Feast of Favors
prompt: In the capital’s court, the table groans with roasted meat and sugared fruit, but the real weight in the room is invisible. Every toast is a trade.

outcomes.title: Toast the Host
outcomes.desc: Give the room a story where you play your part perfectly.

success.text: You rise at the right moment, neither too eager nor too late, and your words land like a well-placed hand on a shoulder. The host smiles—genuinely, or at least convincingly—and you feel doors click open in your direction.

fail.text: You misjudge the tone, praise that sounds like mockery, warmth that sounds like grasping. The host’s smile holds, but the room notices the crack.

outcomes.title: Listen for Advantage
outcomes.desc: Eat little, listen much, and collect what others forget they’ve said.

success.text: You drift from cluster to cluster, letting other people’s vanity do the work. A careless admission.

fail.text: You lean in one time too many, ask one question too sharp, and someone’s gaze lingers on you like a needle finding fabric. You still hear things, but now you also feel it: you’ve been noticed, and not with kindness.

outcomes.title: Win the Debate
outcomes.desc: Outshine a rival in the open, where everyone can pretend it’s about ‘ideas.’

success.text: You take their argument apart with a smile, leaving them nowhere to stand without looking foolish. The room rewards you with laughter and attention, the only applause court allows itself.

fail.text: You reach for a clever point and find the floor drops away. The rival twists your words, the room follows the spin, and suddenly you’re the joke.

outcomes.title: Keep Your Limits
outcomes.desc: Refuse the extra cups, the dares, the ‘one more’ that makes people sloppy.

success.text: You sip; you pace yourself; you step away when the room grows loud. While others spend themselves on bravado, you keep your mind intact.

fail.text: You try to hold the line and still get dragged into the night’s current. Too many cups, too many conversations, too many little performances.

name: Herald's Challenge
prompt: In the capital’s court, a herald’s voice rings out over the square: contests of arms, riddles, and wagers. People gather for spectacle, but the true audience is the one that counts reputations like coin.

outcomes.title: Enter the Lists
outcomes.desc: Put your body where your pride is and trust your steel under the eyes of the crowd.

success.text: You take a hit that would rattle lesser bones and answer with one that ends the bout cleanly. The crowd roars, the herald repeats your name, and a shower of small bets turns into real money in your hands.

fail.text: You step into the lists and learn that glory is sharp on both sides. Something goes wrong, a footing, a timing, a breath, and pain explodes through you.

outcomes.title: Solve the Riddle
outcomes.desc: Win without bruises, make your mind the weapon everyone watches.

success.text: You listen; you pause; you let the crowd get impatient, and then you answer as if the solution was always obvious. The herald blinks, impressed despite themselves.

fail.text: You commit to an answer and feel the moment it turns wrong in your mouth. The crowd laughs, not cruelly, but enough.

outcomes.title: Sponsor a Contender
outcomes.desc: Put coin behind someone stronger and let their victory become your investment.

success.text: You choose well, and you speak to the contender in a way that makes them believe you’re the start of a better future. They win, and they point at you when the crowd asks who backed them.

fail.text: Your sponsored champion loses quickly and publicly. The crowd forgets them by the next bout, but not your coin changing hands for nothing.

outcomes.title: Fix the Wager
outcomes.desc: Make sure chance favors you, by replacing chance with planning.

success.text: You whisper to the right person and the ‘right person’ whispers to someone with a loose grip on integrity. The bout goes exactly as you needed it to.

fail.text: The fix breaks in the open. A shout, a finger pointed, a guard stepping forward with the enthusiasm of someone who loves simple villains.

name: Tax Collector's Audit
prompt: At an oasis court’s oasis court, a clerk arrives with ledgers and a practiced frown, accompanied by a guard who looks bored in the way only armed men can. They lay stamped papers on your table as if setting down a verdict.

outcomes.title: Pay What’s Due
outcomes.desc: Swallow the bitterness, count the coin, and be done with it.

success.text: You pay without argument. The clerk’s disappointment is visible for a heartbeat; they’d hoped for advantage, not compliance.

fail.text: You try to pay and discover you’ve miscounted what you can afford, pride included. The clerk’s smile is small and satisfied as they add a ‘processing fee’ and a note that will follow you.

outcomes.title: Argue Exemptions
outcomes.desc: Find a lawful crack in their certainty and wedge it open with ink.

success.text: You cite the right charter, the right season, the right clause that makes their demand less absolute than they’d like. The clerk grudgingly adjusts the total and, more importantly, marks you as someone who reads before they pay.

fail.text: They let you speak, then dismantle your argument with the patience of someone paid by the hour. By the end, the demand feels heavier, not lighter.

outcomes.title: Bribe the Clerk
outcomes.desc: Turn public duty into private profit, quietly, efficiently, and without witnesses.

success.text: You slide coin like it’s accidental, and the clerk’s hand covers it like it’s natural. Their pen scratches a kinder story into the ledger.

fail.text: The clerk goes stiff. The guard’s boredom evaporates.

outcomes.title: Rally the Town
outcomes.desc: Make the audit costly by turning it into a public scene the clerk can’t control.

success.text: You don’t shout, shouting is for the powerless. You speak, and people gather, and the clerk finds themselves explaining numbers to faces that look angry and hungry.

fail.text: The crowd doesn’t follow your lead; it follows its own frustration. The clerk stands back and lets the mob make you look like the instigator.

name: River Crossing
prompt: In a toll city, the river runs high and fast, carrying branches like thrown spears. The far bank is close enough to want, far enough to punish impatience.

outcomes.title: Force the Ford
outcomes.desc: Wade in and trust your strength to out-argue the current.

success.text: You hit the water like you mean it. Cold bites your legs, the current shoves, and you shove back.

fail.text: The river takes more than it gives. You fight it until your lungs burn and your muscles turn to rope.

outcomes.title: Build a Raft
outcomes.desc: Make safety out of wood, rope, and careful thinking.

success.text: You choose the right logs, bind them well, and test before you trust. The raft dips and sways, but it holds.

fail.text: The knot slips. The raft yaws.

outcomes.title: Pay the Ferryman
outcomes.desc: Coin buys dry boots, if the boat doesn’t leak and the man doesn’t lie.

success.text: The ferryman takes your coin with the solemnity of a priest receiving tithe. The crossing is uneventful, mercifully so.

fail.text: He takes your coin and then charges you again in ‘fees’ you can’t argue while sitting in his boat. By the time you’re across, you’re poorer than you planned—and missing a bit of your provisions as well.

outcomes.title: Cross at Night
outcomes.desc: Avoid eyes on the bridge and gamble that darkness will be kinder than law.

success.text: You find a narrow place and you move when the world is half asleep. On the far side you discover why the bridge is watched: the crossing is a seam in someone else’s quiet business.

fail.text: A lantern flares. A shout rises.

name: Swamp Detour
prompt: At a high pass, the road sinks into swamp like a bad promise. Mosquitoes rise in clouds, and the ground argues with every step.

outcomes.title: Push Through
outcomes.desc: Put your head down and endure the wet, the biting, and the slow grind.

success.text: You refuse to bargain with the swamp. You move steadily, never stopping long enough for doubt to settle in your bones.

fail.text: The swamp wins in inches. Your boots soak through, your skin breaks out, your throat turns raw with bad air.

outcomes.title: Find High Ground
outcomes.desc: Read the land and take the longer path that doesn’t try to swallow you.

success.text: You spot reeds that mean shallows and trees that mean roots you can trust. The route is slower, but safer.

fail.text: You choose what looks like solid ground, and it isn’t. You backtrack; you detour; you slog.

outcomes.title: Hire a Guide
outcomes.desc: Pay someone who grew up on this mire to lead you through its moods.

success.text: A local takes your coin and then takes you by a route you would never have dared alone—half hidden trails, half superstition, all effective. You arrive with more provisions than you expected, and a new contact who expects a favor later.

fail.text: The guide leads you through, yes, but makes sure you understand it wasn’t charity. The coin is taken, and afterward comes the ‘favor,’ spoken softly like a shared secret.

outcomes.title: Cut Corners
outcomes.desc: Slip and try to come out ahead.

success.text: You move light and fast, stepping where you shouldn’t and trusting instincts over maps. You find a stash, left by smugglers or a desperate traveler, and pocket both goods and a telling detail about who uses these marsh paths—and when.

fail.text: You gamble on speed and the swamp calls it arrogance. You get turned around, fight leeches and sucking mud, and claw your way out with nothing gained but fatigue that sits in your limbs like lead.

name: Broken Compass
prompt: At a high pass, your compass needle spins like a frightened animal. North, south, meaningless.

outcomes.title: Read the Stars
outcomes.desc: Trust old knowledge and a steady sky, if the clouds allow it.

success.text: You wait for the sky to clear enough to speak, then listen to it like a seasoned sailor. The patterns line up, and the world becomes legible again.

fail.text: The haze refuses to lift, and your certainty erodes into guesswork. You wander, backtrack, and pay for every wrong turn in food and time.

outcomes.title: Follow the River
outcomes.desc: Water leads somewhere, eventually. The question is whether you can afford ‘eventually.’

success.text: You pick a direction and commit, letting the river’s logic replace your compass. It takes longer than you’d like, and it costs you supplies, but it also gives you something useful: momentum.

fail.text: The river bends, doubles back, disappears into reeds, then returns as if mocking you. You keep moving anyway until your body makes its opinion known.

outcomes.title: Ask the Locals
outcomes.desc: Put pride away and seek directions from people who belong to this land.

success.text: You approach with respect instead of demands, and the locals respond like you’ve treated them as people rather than scenery. They point you true, warn you about a bad stretch ahead, and in doing so, tie a small, useful obligation to your name.

fail.text: Your request comes out wrong, too entitled, too suspicious, too desperate. The locals stiffen, answer curtly, and you leave with directions that feel like a dismissal.

outcomes.title: Steal a Map
outcomes.desc: If you can’t find the way, take it from someone who already has.

success.text: A satchel left unattended is an invitation, and you accept it with quiet hands. The map inside is better than you hoped: marked routes, private shortcuts, and a note about a patrol schedule that feels very much like advantage.

fail.text: A shout catches you mid-step. Someone grabs at your sleeve, and the whole village seems to sprout eyes.

name: The Hungry Year
prompt: In a hard-bitten town, the roads are thin with travelers and thick with staring eyes. Markets sell emptier sacks for higher prices.

outcomes.title: Ration Strictly
outcomes.desc: Count every bite. Treat appetite like an enemy that must be managed.

success.text: You make rules and follow them even when your stomach argues. The pack shrinks, but it doesn’t vanish.

fail.text: Discipline breaks in tiny moments: an extra mouthful here, a ‘just this once’ there. Then one day you look in the pack and see too much cloth and not enough food.

outcomes.title: Buy Grain
outcomes.desc: Pay now, eat later, if the seller isn’t lying and the road doesn’t steal it.

success.text: You swallow the unfair price and buy enough grain to make the next weeks feel survivable. The sack is heavy, comforting in its own blunt way.

fail.text: You pay the price and still don’t get what you wanted, shorted measures, damp grain, promises that rot by morning. It helps, but not enough, and the sting of being cheated sits beside the fear of running out.

outcomes.title: Take What You Need
outcomes.desc: When the world refuses you bread, you refuse the world’s rules.

success.text: You make it quick—no cruelty, no speeches—just a hard decision carried out with hard hands. You get enough to keep moving, but you also earn what all theft earns in lean times: eyes that remember, and mouths that whisper.

fail.text: Someone resists, someone screams, and suddenly it’s not a desperate act, it’s a public crime. The chase is immediate.

outcomes.title: Work for Your Meal
outcomes.desc: Trade sweat for bread and accept that survival can be humiliating.

success.text: You haul sacks, mend fences, dig ditches, whatever the day demands. It’s not glorious, but it’s honest work in a dishonest season.

fail.text: You push too hard and your body pushes back. A wrong lift, a long day, a night without enough rest, then the exhaustion settles in deep.

name: The Ruined Watchtower
prompt: Along the storm coast, the watchtower’s bones still stand, though the roof is long gone and rain has eaten the mortar into soft grit. Birds nest where sentries once paced.

outcomes.title: Search Carefully
outcomes.desc: Go slow, listen for the tower’s small warnings, and let patience earn the find.

success.text: You test each beam before you trust it, shift stones with a stick instead of your hands, and pause when the tower creaks as if remembering how to fall. Under a loose flagstone you find a small cache: a few coins and a sealed letter.

fail.text: You pick your way through damp rubble and stale droppings, breathing more dust than you should. The find is there, some coin, a trinket, but so is the consequence.

outcomes.title: Force the Door
outcomes.desc: Make entry a simple problem with a simple solution: strength.

success.text: You shoulder the warped door until the rusted hinge gives with a scream of metal. Inside, you tear through debris like you’re chasing an enemy.

fail.text: The door gives, but not cleanly. A splintered plank snaps back, or a hidden nail catches flesh, or the frame collapses just enough to bite.

outcomes.title: Look for Traps
outcomes.desc: Assume someone clever expected someone greedy, and try to be neither.

success.text: You find the signs, scratched stone a broken jar of old pitch used to mark paths in the dark. The ‘treasure’ was bait, but the structure of the bait is the real reward.

fail.text: You’re careful, just not careful enough. Something clatters, something shifts, and a sound carries farther than it should in open country.

outcomes.title: Leave It Be
outcomes.desc: Refuse the tower’s invitation and walk away with your luck intact.

success.text: You turn away, not because you’re uninterested, but because you can smell the trouble on the air. Down the road you help a traveler who’s stuck in the mud, or you share a word with a local who appreciates restraint. It buys you nothing now, but it leaves you unmarked.

fail.text: You walk away… but you keep looking back. The tower sits in your mind like an itch, and the indecision nags at you.

name: Forbidden Folio
prompt: In a scholar's town, the folio is wrapped in oilcloth like contraband. The ink is old, the margins dense with a second hand arguing the first.

outcomes.title: Study in Secret
outcomes.desc: Read enough to benefit, before it can bite.

success.text: You copy the key passage into memory and stop before obsession can take hold. The work is brilliant in the way a knife is brilliant: honest about what it does.

fail.text: You read too long, too greedily. Sleep comes thin.

outcomes.title: Fence It Quietly
outcomes.desc: Turn dangerous knowledge into safer coin.

success.text: A collector receives it with shaking hands and too many questions you do not answer. You leave with heavy purse and heavier suspicions about who will read it next.

fail.text: The handoff draws notice. Someone follows you long enough to learn your gait, your habits, the places you think are private.

outcomes.title: Hide It for a Time
outcomes.desc: Keep it close, but not “too” close.

success.text: You stash it where damp and eyes are unlikely to find it. You tell yourself it’s prudence.

fail.text: The hiding place is not as clever as you thought. Later, you catch someone looking at you like they know a secret you don’t.

outcomes.title: Offer It to a Shrine
outcomes.desc: Let piety take custody of what you shouldn’t own.

success.text: You place it in careful hands and accept the quiet gratitude of those who keep dangerous things locked away.

fail.text: They accept your gift with polite distance, as if you’ve brought rot into a clean place. Word leaks anyway, never with full detail, always with enough to sting.

name: Village Relic
prompt: At a hillside abbey, a village meets you at the edge of the road as if they’ve been rehearsing the plea. Their relic is gone, wood and metal, worn smooth by hands that needed something to hold onto.

outcomes.title: Recover It
outcomes.desc: Go after the thief and bring the relic back the hard way: by force and endurance.

success.text: You track the culprit by the simple signs desperate people miss, mud on a boot, a snapped twig, a hurried path that tries to pretend it’s not hurried. When you catch them, they don’t fold gracefully.

fail.text: You find the thief, or what the thief left behind, and the encounter turns messy. A blow lands wrong.

outcomes.title: Research Its History
outcomes.desc: Learn who took it, and why, by treating the relic as a story, not a trinket.

success.text: You ask about old feuds, note who looks away when certain names are spoken, and read the village’s records with the patience of someone who expects lies. The relic isn’t ‘just’ a relic; its history points to a missing chapter in local politics.

fail.text: You dig too deep in a place that survives by keeping things simple. People bristle at your questions; old resentments flare; your search becomes a day-long slog through half-truths.

outcomes.title: Swap It for a Fake
outcomes.desc: Give them comfort, keep the value, make the story true enough to live with.

success.text: You ‘recover’ something that looks right in the lamplight and feels right to hopeful hands. The village embraces it like a miracle, and you walk away with the original tucked safely away and profit weighing heavy in your pocket.

fail.text: Someone notices. A grandmother who’s touched the relic a thousand times, a child who remembers the nick on the edge, a priest who knows the weight in their palm.

outcomes.title: Offer a Blessing
outcomes.desc: You can’t fight every battle, but you can leave people steadier than you found them.

success.text: You speak to them like their grief deserves dignity, not dismissal. You help repair the shrine, light a candle, say the right small words, more comfort than ceremony.

fail.text: Your attempt lands wrong, too formal, too hollow, too much like a traveler pretending to care. They nod politely and you leave, but the village keeps its hurt.

name: Old Stone Circle
prompt: In a scholar's town, ancient stones stand in a ring like teeth around a silent mouth. Lichen maps their surfaces in pale greens, and shallow carvings run beneath the growth, lines that look like writing until you stare too long.

outcomes.title: Camp Within the Ring
outcomes.desc: Rest and see what kind of sleep the old stones allow.

success.text: You set your bedroll inside the circle and keep the fire low. The night is quiet in a way that feels deliberate.

fail.text: Sleep doesn’t come gently. The wind moves even when the trees don’t.

outcomes.title: Take a Rubbing
outcomes.desc: Record the symbols like a scholar, not a pilgrim, proof matters later.

success.text: You press charcoal to paper and let the carvings reveal themselves in negative space. The pattern isn’t random, it repeats, shifts, hides a structure.

fail.text: The damp air and the circle’s chill sink into you while you work. Your fingers go numb, your breath turns shallow, and you find yourself coughing as if you’ve inhaled the age of the stones.

outcomes.title: Carve Your Mark
outcomes.desc: Leave proof you were here, bold enough that the world can’t pretend you were small.

success.text: You choose a stone and cut your sign into it with deliberate strokes. It’s not vandalism in your mind, it’s a claim: I stood here; I endured the feeling; I left something of myself behind.

fail.text: The stone resists the blade, and your courage turns into awkward persistence. A slip, a crack, a sound like laughter carried on wind.

outcomes.title: Loot the Offerings
outcomes.desc: If coins sit unattended, they are simply waiting for a more practical owner.

success.text: You pocket the offerings quickly, coins, a bit of dried food, a flask half-full. It feels easy, almost ridiculous that people would leave wealth to stones.

fail.text: Your hand closes on cold coin and the air inside the circle turns sharper, like the world inhaled. Whether it’s superstition or something real doesn’t matter, your nerves decide it’s real.

name: Tavern Brawl
prompt: In the central marches, the tavern is loud in the way that makes mistakes feel like inevitability. Someone says something cheap.

outcomes.title: Drop the Loudest One
outcomes.desc: End it fast: remove the spark before it becomes a fire.

success.text: You pick the one driving the chaos, the mouth that keeps provoking, the hands that keep swinging, and you put them down with a single decisive blow. The room hesitates.

fail.text: You commit to ending it quickly and instead become the center of it. Someone cheap-shots you from the side, a bottle breaks, and pain floods bright and immediate.

outcomes.title: Win With Positioning
outcomes.desc: Let the room do the work, tables, doorways, and timing are weapons too.

success.text: You keep your back to a wall, steer attackers into each other, and use the furniture like a chessboard. People fall where you intend them to.

fail.text: You try to be clever, but chaos doesn’t always respect clever. A misstep, a stumble, a moment too long calculating, and suddenly you’re burning through energy just to stay upright.

outcomes.title: Turn It Into a Shakedown
outcomes.desc: If everyone’s frightened already, profit is just a matter of aim.

success.text: You grab someone by the collar, bark a threat that sounds like authority, and ‘confiscate’ their purse in the name of ‘keeping them safe.’ Others see it and decide not to argue. In the scramble you learn a useful name whispered between punches.

fail.text: You try to squeeze coin from panic and discover someone in the room has sharper instincts than you. A hand clamps your wrist, a voice calls you out, and suddenly the brawl has a new target: the ‘thief’ in their midst.

outcomes.title: Calm the Room
outcomes.desc: Stop the riot with a voice steadier than the fear driving it.

success.text: You step between bodies and speak like someone who belongs there. Not louder, clearer.

fail.text: Your words get swallowed by the noise. Worse, someone interprets your attempt as taking a side.

name: Arrow From the Treeline
prompt: In Stonewold, an arrow thuds into the dirt beside your boot, close enough to be deliberate. The treeline is still.

outcomes.title: Charge the Line
outcomes.desc: If you let them keep distance, you die by distance.

success.text: You close fast, violent and certain. Whoever watched you decides you’re not an easy kill today.

fail.text: You sprint into angles you cannot see. The second arrow finds you where confidence becomes exposure.

outcomes.title: Read the Terrain
outcomes.desc: Find the nest by thinking like a hunter.

success.text: Broken twigs, a scraped bark, the faintest footprint. You don’t catch them, but you learn enough to avoid the kill zone, and to remember the pattern.

fail.text: You circle, hesitate, double back. The day stretches into nerves and sweat until you’re too tired to keep being clever.

outcomes.title: Vanish Into Cover
outcomes.desc: Give them nothing to shoot at.

success.text: You become a rumor in your own wake, footprints broken, silhouette swallowed. If they pursue, they do it blind.

fail.text: A snapped branch, a flash of movement, a third heartbeat you didn’t account for. You escape, but now you’re the one being tracked.

outcomes.title: Call for Parley
outcomes.desc: Turn a threat into information, if they’ll speak.

success.text: You speak as if you have options. After a long pause, a voice answers, thin, controlled, afraid of being named.

fail.text: Your words drift into silence. The reply is another arrow, closer.

name: Hunt Gone Wrong
prompt: In Stonewold, the hunt was meant to be routine: track, stalk, kill, eat. Instead, the woods shift and the air turns sharp.

outcomes.title: Bring It Down
outcomes.desc: End the threat decisively and claim the meat like you meant to from the start.

success.text: You commit, no hesitation, no bargaining with fear. The creature charges and you meet it, turning the encounter into a brutal argument your body is willing to win.

fail.text: You strike; you wrestle; you scramble, and the beast makes contact in the way beasts do: sudden, total, indifferent. Pain flares as it catches you, and you escape only by giving ground and blood.

outcomes.title: Outthink the Beast
outcomes.desc: Make the terrain your ally: angles, choke points, and timing instead of brute force.

success.text: You pull it toward mud that slows it, toward branches that snag, toward a slope that steals its momentum. When it commits, you punish the commitment.

fail.text: Your plan is good, but the wilderness doesn’t care about good plans. The beast moves in a way you didn’t predict, and you spend the fight running, climbing, and praying your feet stay under you.

outcomes.title: Lay a Dirty Trap
outcomes.desc: Win in a way you won’t boast about: cruel, clever, and effective.

success.text: You bait it with blood, set it and use the kind of trick hunters don’t admit to in company. The beast dies ugly and fast.

fail.text: The trap works, on you. You cut corners, handle foul bait, and end up with a sickness that settles in after the adrenaline fades.

outcomes.title: Back Away Slowly
outcomes.desc: Choose survival over pride. Live to hunt something less interested in killing you.

success.text: You control your breathing, keep your posture calm, and retreat without turning it into a chase. The forest lets you go.

fail.text: You try to disengage and the woods punish hesitation. You lose time, lose ground, and end up burning through supplies to make up for the detour and the fear.

name: Guard Captain’s Suspicion
prompt: Outside a frontier keep, a guard captain steps into your path with the easy confidence of someone backed by steel and writs. Their hand rests near the hilt, not gripping, just reminding.

outcomes.title: Stand Tall
outcomes.desc: Make your presence an argument: posture, certainty, and the implication you belong.

success.text: You meet the captain’s eyes without flinching and speak like someone accustomed to being answered. You don’t over-explain; you don’t apologize.

fail.text: You try to project authority and it comes out as arrogance. The captain’s mouth tightens.

outcomes.title: Explain Precisely
outcomes.desc: Offer details that withstand inspection, dates, names, and a story that doesn’t wobble.

success.text: You answer the captain’s questions before they fully ask them. The rhythm of your explanation sounds practiced, believable.

fail.text: You provide details, and the details become a net. One inconsistency, one stutter, one forgotten name, suddenly every question multiplies.

outcomes.title: Slip Past the Net
outcomes.desc: Be gone before questions become chains, quiet feet, hidden angles, no second chances.

success.text: You vanish into the crowd’s blind spots, move when they blink, and pass the checkpoint as if you were never meant to stop there. Behind you, the captain’s voice rises in irritation, but it’s too late—you’re already across the line.

fail.text: You make your move and someone notices the shape of it. A shout goes up.

outcomes.title: Break and Run
outcomes.desc: If they won’t listen, outrun them, make distance the only argument.

success.text: You explode into motion, shoulder through a gap, and turn the checkpoint into a chase. For a few frantic moments, it’s you versus the city.

fail.text: You run, and the captain runs too, along with men trained to catch runners. A baton catches ribs, a fall scrapes skin, a blade kisses you where it shouldn’t.

name: Stolen Correspondence
prompt: In a toll city, a bundle of letters falls into your hands, sealed, scented, and written with the reckless confidence of people who assume servants are deaf and walls are loyal. Names appear often enough to matter.

outcomes.title: Sell Them Quietly
outcomes.desc: Let someone else swing the blade. You keep the coin.

success.text: A discreet buyer pays fast and asks no questions, because they already know the answers.

fail.text: You choose the wrong intermediary. Your ‘discretion’ becomes evidence.

outcomes.title: Use Them for Advantage
outcomes.desc: A quiet threat can move a loud world.

success.text: You never raise your voice. You don’t have to.

fail.text: Your hint lands wrong. Someone decides you’re either bluffing or dangerous, either way, they want you watched.

outcomes.title: Decode the Pattern
outcomes.desc: Read between lines, find the real message.

success.text: Dates, routes, payments, this is not romance. It’s routes and coin.

fail.text: You spend the day chasing implications until your eyes ache.

outcomes.title: Burn Them
outcomes.desc: Refuse the hunger for advantage.

success.text: The ash feels strangely light in your palm.

fail.text: Someone notices the smoke and asks what you’re hiding.

name: Rumor Mill
prompt: In the city, truth is only one ingredient. The rest is tone, timing, and who repeats the story first.

outcomes.title: Plant a Favorable Tale
outcomes.desc: Feed the gossip something sweet, so your name tastes better than your rivals'.

success.text: You choose the right mouths—barmaids, scribes, guards with loose lips—and you give them a story that sounds like they discovered it themselves. Within days, your name is spoken with a slightly different slant.

fail.text: You push too hard, or the tale is too polished, too convenient. People smell the manipulation and resent being handled.

outcomes.title: Spook Your Rivals
outcomes.desc: Let them feel watched, because being watched makes people make mistakes.

success.text: A message left half-visible. A conversation interrupted at the perfect moment.

fail.text: Your ‘spooking’ looks a lot like harassment to the wrong witness. A guard takes an interest.

outcomes.title: Verify What’s True
outcomes.desc: Separate malice from fact, because only one of them can be cleanly dealt with.

success.text: You follow the rumor the way you’d follow a trail: backward, step by step, through the hands that passed it along. You find the break where truth becomes performance.

fail.text: You chase the rumor through alleys of half-truth and spite. Every source points to another source, every certainty dissolves into ‘I heard.’ By the time you stop, you’ve spent a day wrestling smoke, and the rumor is no closer to dying.

outcomes.title: Ignore It Entirely
outcomes.desc: Refuse to feed the fire. Sometimes starved rumors die. Sometimes they learn to hunt.

success.text: You keep your routines, keep your face calm, and never give the whisperers the satisfaction of a reaction. Without fuel, the story struggles to stay interesting.

fail.text: Your silence is interpreted the way crowds love to interpret silence: as an admission. The rumor hardens while you stand still, and by the time you notice the damage, your name has already been bent into a joke people enjoy repeating.

name: Hidden Safehouse
prompt: In a banking city, a hooded figure offers you a safehouse: a quiet room above a shop, a cellar with a second door, a place where questions don’t arrive with daylight. The offer smells of generosity, and hooks.

outcomes.title: Accept Shelter
outcomes.desc: Rest now. Untangle the cost later.

success.text: You sleep without listening for boots. For a few days, the city feels less sharp.

fail.text: The door locks a little too easily behind you. The kindness comes with terms you didn’t agree to, at least, not out loud.

outcomes.title: Inspect for Traps
outcomes.desc: Assume every gift is bait.

success.text: You find the pressure points: who owns the building, who has keys, who watches the alley.

fail.text: You hesitate too long and lose the chance to vanish cleanly.

outcomes.title: Use It as a Decoy
outcomes.desc: If someone set bait, let them choke on it.

success.text: You turn their generosity into your advantage and leave with profit and an intact exit.

fail.text: Your play is noticed. The city gets smaller around you.

outcomes.title: Refuse and Relocate
outcomes.desc: Keep independence, pay in fatigue.

success.text: You find another roof through your own network and keep your name clean.

fail.text: You spend the night walking and listening and never truly resting.

name: Smuggler’s Choice
prompt: In a banking city, a smuggler offers you work under moonlight. They don’t say ‘crime.’ They say ‘opportunity.’ A crate can be ‘goods.’ A hooded figure can be ‘cargo.’ The same boat carries both, and the same silence buys both.

outcomes.title: Move Goods
outcomes.desc: Fast coin for quiet labor.

success.text: You deliver the crate without asking what it is. You’re paid like someone who understands how to keep breathing.

fail.text: A lantern turns. A shout follows.

outcomes.title: Move a Person
outcomes.desc: A life delivered buys heavier favors than coin.

success.text: You get them through without panic. They never forget the hand that didn’t shake.

fail.text: They arrive, but frightened, injured, or late. The smuggler smiles like you now owe interest.

outcomes.title: Negotiate a Better Cut
outcomes.desc: Respect is currency. Take your share in it.

success.text: You speak as if you can walk away. They believe you, and pay to keep you.

fail.text: They decide you’re arrogant, not valuable. The insult sticks longer than the coin would have.

outcomes.title: Turn Them In
outcomes.desc: Make the law do your violence for you.

success.text: You give the guards the right detail at the right moment. Someone else is in chains by dawn.

fail.text: The smugglers smell betrayal before the guards arrive. The docks become less safe for a while.

name: Disputed Inheritance
prompt: At an oasis court’s oasis court, two claimants corner you with smiles that don’t reach their eyes. One has paper.

outcomes.title: Back the Lawful Claim
outcomes.desc: Let documents outweigh threats, out loud.

success.text: You make the case cleanly. The room leans toward order.

fail.text: Your argument becomes ‘interference.’ The powerful laugh, and the lawful glare.

outcomes.title: Back the Powerful Claim
outcomes.desc: Bet on the winner the hall has already chosen.

success.text: You align with force and gain access that feels like safety.

fail.text: The weaker claimant leaves in humiliation, and spends the next weeks trying to make you feel some of it.

outcomes.title: Forge a Compromise
outcomes.desc: Split the prize. Absorb the blame.

success.text: You hammer out a peace that satisfies no one and prevents bloodshed anyway.

fail.text: You spend hours negotiating and end with nothing but fatigue and resentment.

outcomes.title: Profit in the Shadows
outcomes.desc: Sell your support twice and call it ‘cunning.’

success.text: You take payment from both sides and keep your smile steady.

fail.text: Someone compares notes. Suddenly you’re not clever, you’re criminal.

name: Trial of a Friend
prompt: At an oasis court’s oasis court, and old authority. Your friend stands trying not to look at you too much.

outcomes.title: Speak for Them
outcomes.desc: Put your name behind theirs and make the room feel your conviction.

success.text: You speak clearly, not begging but insisting, on context, on character, on the gap between accusation and proof. You make the court imagine itself as fair again.

fail.text: Your defense becomes the spectacle the court wanted—just not in the way you intended. A misstep is seized, a phrase is twisted, and suddenly you are not a defender of fairness but an accomplice in the crowd’s eyes.

outcomes.title: Find Exonerating Detail
outcomes.desc: Dig for the one fact that flips the story, dates, witnesses, contradictions.

success.text: You scour the record, talk to the right clerk, follow a detail that doesn’t fit. Somewhere in the writs is a seam, an impossible timeline, a forged mark, a witness who wasn’t where they claimed.

fail.text: You chase leads through dust and clerkwork until your eyes ache. Everything is ‘missing,’ ‘misfiled,’ or ‘pending.’ Whether by incompetence or design, the truth stays buried.

outcomes.title: Bribe the Clerk
outcomes.desc: Make the record say what you need. A little ink can change a life.

success.text: You find the clerk who values coin more than conscience and speak in the universal language of payment. A page goes missing.

fail.text: The clerk recoils, offended or frightened, and the attempt becomes evidence all its own. Word slips sideways through the court, and suddenly your ‘help’ looks like corruption.

outcomes.title: Let the Law Run
outcomes.desc: Stay silent, watch carefully, and learn how judgment is actually made.

success.text: You keep your face steady and your voice absent. You watch who speaks, who flinches, and who looks relieved at certain testimony.

fail.text: Your silence is read as betrayal by the only person you meant to protect. And the crowd reads it too: as cowardice, as calculation, as proof you care only when it’s safe.

name: A Patron’s Request
prompt: In the capital’s court, a patron smiles as if you belong to their success. They ask for a ‘small service’ in a tone that makes it clear the service is only small to “them”.

outcomes.title: Accept Dutifully
outcomes.desc: Do the work, take the reward, swallow the taste.

success.text: You comply without complaint. They like that.

fail.text: You stumble, or hesitate, or disappoint. The smile stays.

outcomes.title: Set Terms
outcomes.desc: Make the price explicit so the debt is measurable.

success.text: You negotiate as an equal. They humor you, and pay.

fail.text: They decide you’ve forgotten your place.

outcomes.title: Investigate Motives
outcomes.desc: Find the knife hidden inside the gift.

success.text: You learn who the request harms, and why that matters.

fail.text: Your questions get noticed. Not punished, just watched.

outcomes.title: Decline Publicly
outcomes.desc: Keep your conscience. Pay in access.

success.text: The hall hears your refusal and calls it courage. The patron calls it inconvenient.

fail.text: You misstep, and the refusal becomes humiliation, yours.

name: Matchmaker’s Whisper
prompt: In the capital’s court, a matron with excellent memory and sharper etiquette draws you into a polite corner. She speaks of "a most suitable match", names never quite said, intentions never quite confirmed.

outcomes.title: Smile and Let It Spread
outcomes.desc: Treat it as flattering. A little attention can be useful, if you keep it on your terms.

success.text: You accept the insinuation with practiced ease, neither confirming nor denying, just letting the room imagine what it wants. Doors open when people believe you’re being "considered." You leave the feast with options you didn’t have an hour ago.

fail.text: You push too hard, or smile too widely, and the room reads desperation where you meant poise. The whispers don’t stop, they sharpen.

outcomes.title: Find Who Benefits
outcomes.desc: A rumor this clean was polished by someone. Trace the hands that polished it.

success.text: You follow the small tells: who repeats the rumor, who corrects it, who waits to see your reaction. The trail leads to a petty faction’s advantage play, harmless on the surface, sharp beneath.

fail.text: The more you watch, the more you become watched. You spend the evening counting smiles and measuring pauses until your nerves feel raw.

outcomes.title: Refuse With Grace
outcomes.desc: Decline without insult. In a court, "no" is an art form.

success.text: You offer a refusal that sounds like principle instead of fear, calm, final, and impossible to argue with without looking small. The rumor loses oxygen.

fail.text: You say the right words in the wrong tone, or the wrong words at the wrong moment. The matron’s smile tightens.

outcomes.title: Make It Someone Else’s Problem
outcomes.desc: Redirect the attention. If the hall wants a story, give it a better target than you.

success.text: You laugh softly, offer a carefully chosen compliment about someone else, and let the matchmaker’s instincts do the rest. Within minutes the room is chewing on a new narrative—one that keeps your name out of the target’s mouth.

fail.text: Your redirection is noticed. The matron’s eyes narrow, not angry, just assessing.

name: Broken Wheel
prompt: Outside a frontier keep, the failure is sudden and final: a crack like a snapped bone, then the sickening tilt of your cart, or the sag of a pack rig, dumping weight into the mud. The sun is already dropping, and the road ahead is the kind that grows teeth after dusk.

outcomes.title: Fix It Yourself
outcomes.desc: Kneel in the dirt, take stock of the damage, and make something hold with wood, rope, and stubborn focus.

success.text: You strip the rig down to its essentials and rebuild it into something uglier but functional. The repair won’t impress anyone, but it will carry you.

fail.text: The break is worse than it looked. A peg splinters, a knot slips, and each failed attempt costs you more rope, more patience, more daylight.

outcomes.title: Muscle Through
outcomes.desc: Abandon comfort and carry what you can. If the road won’t take the weight, your body will.

success.text: You lash what remains into a crude harness and haul it forward step by step. It’s brutal, but it works.

fail.text: You try to brute-force the road into obedience and it answers with pain. A strap bites, a load shifts, and you take a hard twist or a crushing stumble.

outcomes.title: Borrow What You Need
outcomes.desc: Find a nearby traveler or homestead and ask as if it’s reasonable, because sometimes confidence is half the bargain.

success.text: You speak plainly, offer a promise that sounds like it will be kept, and make your need feel shared rather than begged. A wheelwright’s scrap, a spare peg, a length of cord, small mercies, but enough.

fail.text: Your request lands wrong: too bold, too needy, too entitled. Doors close, faces tighten, and you feel the social temperature drop.

outcomes.title: Steal a Replacement
outcomes.desc: If it’s unattended, it’s yours. Survival is a better excuse than pride.

success.text: You find what you need behind a shed or beside a sleeping wagon: a spare wheel, a usable yoke, a bundle of cordage. You take it quickly and leave nothing but absence.

fail.text: A lantern swings. Someone wakes.

name: Snowed-In Pass
prompt: At a high pass, the pass disappears under fresh snowfall as if the mountain has decided you don’t deserve to cross. Wind cuts the breath out of you.

outcomes.title: Climb Through
outcomes.desc: Force your way over the teeth of the mountain. No delay. No retreat.

success.text: You lead yourself like a stubborn animal: step, breath, step. You find footholds where none should exist and refuse to let the cold bargain with you.

fail.text: The mountain takes payment. You stumble through drifts that swallow your legs, fight wind that steals your warmth, and keep moving long after you should have stopped.

outcomes.title: Chart a Detour
outcomes.desc: Accept the delay and choose the route that kills you slower.

success.text: You read the land the way you read a page, looking for the parts that repeat and the parts that lie. You find a longer route that stays lower and calmer.

fail.text: Your ‘detour’ becomes a slow trap: false turns, dead ends, and exposed stretches where the wind punishes every mistake. By the time you find anything like a workable path, you’ve eaten through far more than you planned.

outcomes.title: Sneak Into a Lodge
outcomes.desc: Warmth stolen is still warmth. Slip inside, take what you need, leave before dawn.

success.text: You find the lodge by smoke and silhouette. A window latch gives, a door yields, and you tuck yourself into borrowed heat.

fail.text: A board creaks like a shout. A dog barks.

outcomes.title: Treat With Locals
outcomes.desc: Pay for a roof and a bowl. Let hospitality be bought instead of stolen.

success.text: You approach openly, offer coin without posturing, and speak like a person who understands that winter is everyone’s enemy. They take you in, not lovingly, but pragmatically.

fail.text: Your offer is taken as insult or suspicion. Maybe you smell like trouble.

name: Campfire Visitors
prompt: Outside a frontier keep, and beacons draw ships, sometimes wrecks. Footsteps approach beyond the light’s edge.

outcomes.title: Share the Fire
outcomes.desc: Offer warmth, a little food, and the dignity of being treated like human beings. Trust is a gamble, sometimes it pays.

success.text: You make space and set clear boundaries, firm, but not cruel. The strangers relax, and the conversation becomes ordinary: roads, weather, warnings.

fail.text: Hospitality invites appetite. While you look at one face, another hand drifts toward your pack.

outcomes.title: Question Them Carefully
outcomes.desc: Keep them talking. People reveal themselves when you ask the right thing at the right time.

success.text: You ask about landmarks that don’t exist, villages that burned years ago, a bridge that was never built, and watch the answers. The lies come out uneven, and the truth shows through the cracks.

fail.text: The conversation drags. They dodge, you probe; they probe back.

outcomes.title: Send Them Away
outcomes.desc: Draw a line and hold it. Make it clear the fire is not communal.

success.text: You rise, square your shoulders, and make your refusal unmistakable. The strangers weigh you and decide this camp isn’t worth the trouble.

fail.text: Your refusal becomes the spark. One of them steps too close, and suddenly it’s hands and knives in firelight.

outcomes.title: Slip Away First
outcomes.desc: Leave no trace, no target. Let them find an empty fire and nothing else.

success.text: You douse the coals, pack quickly, and vanish into the dark before they’re close enough to commit. You learn a useful truth about the road—how quickly danger forms around comfort—and you carry that lesson like a warmed stone.

fail.text: In your hurry, you lose time and gear. A strap snaps, a bundle spills, footsteps quicken behind you.

name: The Toll Road
prompt: In a toll city, a crude gate, and a man with a ledger that looks a little too clean for the mud around him. He claims official authority, names a lord you’ve heard of, and flashes papers that are plausible at a glance and suspicious on the second look.

outcomes.title: Pay and Pass
outcomes.desc: Sometimes you buy peace. Hand over coin and move on before it becomes a conversation.

success.text: You pay without drama and keep your eyes forward. The tollkeeper grins like a man who has won, but you keep your life uncomplicated.

fail.text: You pay, and still they take something from the exchange. A sneer, a comment meant to belittle, a moment where bystanders see you ‘comply’ and file it away as weakness.

outcomes.title: Demand Proof
outcomes.desc: Make them show their hand. Real officials don’t mind scrutiny, fake ones hate it.

success.text: You ask the right questions: which office issued the writ, what the seal should look like up close, what the toll is ‘supposed’ to fund. The tollkeeper stumbles, and the assistants shift in a way that answers you before anyone speaks.

fail.text: You argue until your breath fogs and your patience frays. They don’t crack; they simply waste your time with practiced certainty and vague threats.

outcomes.title: Threaten the Fraud
outcomes.desc: Force the gate with reputation and steel. Make them believe this is the wrong road to die on.

success.text: You step close enough that they have to measure you honestly. Your voice carries the promise of consequence, and your posture suggests you’ve delivered on worse promises before.

fail.text: The tollkeeper’s assistants are waiting for someone to be brave. When you push, they push back.

outcomes.title: Forge Your Own Pass
outcomes.desc: Meet fraud with fraud. Give them writs that makes their writs irrelevant.

success.text: You produce a document that looks official enough to intimidate a liar, names, dates, the right kind of confidence. For a heartbeat, the tollkeeper doubts themselves, and doubt is all you need.

fail.text: They recognize the bluff, or decide to treat any bluff as an excuse for violence. Your ‘pass’ becomes evidence, and their attention sharpens into a kind of pursuit that doesn’t require proof to be dangerous.

name: Crumbling Shrine
prompt: At a hillside abbey, a roadside shrine leans like an old man who refuses to sit. Weather has gnawed the carvings smooth.

outcomes.title: Restore It
outcomes.desc: Set stones back into place, clear the ruin, and leave the shrine better than you found it, if only by a little.

success.text: You work with patient hands: stacking stones, sweeping debris, righting what can be righted. It isn’t grand, but it’s real.

fail.text: The work takes more out of you than expected. Cold stone, stiff joints, and the slow grind of effort without immediate reward.

outcomes.title: Study the Carvings
outcomes.desc: Trace the worn symbols and old prayers. Faith leaves patterns, even when people forget why.

success.text: You find meaning in the weathered lines: a regional mark, a half-erased name, a devotional phrase tied to a larger tradition. The shrine isn’t just a broken roadside trinket, it’s connected.

fail.text: You linger too long in damp air and cold stone shadow. Whether it’s chill, mold, or bad luck, something settles into your lungs and bones.

outcomes.title: Take the Offerings
outcomes.desc: Need makes thieves of saints. If the world won’t provide, you’ll provide for yourself.

success.text: You lift the coins and the small usable items with practiced speed, telling yourself it’s only metal and food and nobody will miss it. The gain is immediate and practical.

fail.text: A passerby sees you with your hand in the bowl. Or you fumble, making noise where there should be reverence.

outcomes.title: Leave It Alone
outcomes.desc: Walk on without touching what isn’t yours. Let the shrine keep whatever dignity it has left.

success.text: You offer nothing but restraint, and sometimes that’s the cleanest gift. You move on with your conscience quieter than it might have been, and the road feels a little less heavy.

fail.text: You leave it behind. The world does not reward you for it, at least not today.

name: An Old Veteran’s Tale
prompt: In the central marches, a scarred veteran speaks like someone who has stopped pretending the world is fair. They offer lessons, for coin, for respect, or for a favor you won’t understand until later.

outcomes.title: Pay for Lessons
outcomes.desc: Spend coin to buy hard-earned clarity.

success.text: You leave with a handful of tricks and a quieter fear of the obvious.

fail.text: You pay and learn less than you hoped. The disappointment follows you home.

outcomes.title: Earn It in Sparring
outcomes.desc: Prove you’re worth the time.

success.text: You take bruises and turn them into respect.

fail.text: You take the wrong bruise. The lesson arrives in pain.

outcomes.title: Ask What He Won’t Brag About
outcomes.desc: Get the truths hidden between the heroic parts.

success.text: He gives you names, dates, and the quiet shape of old betrayals.

fail.text: He resents the questions and makes you feel it.

outcomes.title: Flatter Him Into Talking
outcomes.desc: Let pride loosen the locked parts of the story.

success.text: He boasts. You listen.

fail.text: He sees through it and decides you’re the kind of person who’d sell a friend’s name.

name: Sealed Coffer
prompt: In a scholar's town, you find a sealed coffer with no crest and no explanation. It doesn’t hum with magic.

outcomes.title: Pick the Lock
outcomes.desc: Quiet hands, quick answers.

success.text: You open it without breaking the seal. Inside: coin and a hint of the story it belonged to.

fail.text: You fumble and leave evidence. Someone will know the coffer was touched.

outcomes.title: Break It Open
outcomes.desc: Noise now. Profit now.

success.text: Splinters fly. The contents spill.

fail.text: The lid gives way badly. You cut yourself and draw the wrong kind of attention.

outcomes.title: Deliver It for a Fee
outcomes.desc: Let honesty be a service you sell.

success.text: You return it to someone who looks relieved and annoyed in equal measure. They pay you to leave quickly.

fail.text: They accept it, and treat you like part of the problem that delivered it.

outcomes.title: Hide It Briefly
outcomes.desc: Keep it for a moment when you need advantage.

success.text: You stash it somewhere safe enough to calm your nerves, unsafe enough to keep you thinking about it.

fail.text: You pick the wrong place, or someone picks you. The coffer becomes a spotlight.

name: Scribe’s Error
prompt: In a banking city, a mistake in ink can ruin you as thoroughly as a blade. Somewhere in a ledger, your name has been placed a debt that isn’t yours.

outcomes.title: Correct the Record
outcomes.desc: Fix it properly, in daylight. Bring evidence, endure the clerks, and make the ink obey reality.

success.text: You gather proof, chase stamps, and corner the right clerk at the right hour. The correction is slow, but it lands.

fail.text: The office resists you with a thousand small refusals: ‘come back tomorrow,’ ‘wrong counter,’ ‘missing seal.’ Whether incompetence or malice, it eats your day and leaves you drained, with nothing resolved.

outcomes.title: Pay to Make It Go Away
outcomes.desc: Coin buys silence and stamps. It’s unfair, but it’s fast.

success.text: You pay the ‘fee’ that isn’t written anywhere official and watch the clerk’s attitude soften instantly. The record doesn’t become righteous, it becomes quiet.

fail.text: You pay, and the office still finds a way to take more. The mistake remains half-alive, and now you’ve also spent coin you couldn’t spare.

outcomes.title: Alter It Quietly
outcomes.desc: A little ink, a big change. If the system lies about you, lie back, better.

success.text: You pick a moment when the office is distracted and the right ledger is unattended. A careful smudge, a rewritten line, a number that becomes a different number.

fail.text: Someone sees the movement of your hand or notices the wrong kind of confidence in your posture. The ledger snaps shut like a trap, and suspicion attaches itself to you.

outcomes.title: Endure the Consequences
outcomes.desc: Take the hit and outlast the record. Survive the writs long enough to fix it later.

success.text: You absorb the indignity, keep your head down when needed, and refuse to let the mistake define you. People see you endure and keep functioning anyway, and that stubborn steadiness becomes its own kind of respect.

fail.text: The consequences compound faster than your patience. A missed payment becomes a penalty; a penalty becomes a demand; a demand becomes a threat.

name: Border Toll
prompt: In the central marches, a rope barrier and a bored sergeant stop the road. A ledger is opened, a hand is held out.

outcomes.title: Pay Without Fuss
outcomes.desc: Pay and move on before questions become inspections.

success.text: You pay the posted rate. The sergeant barely looks up, and the rope lifts as if it were never there.

fail.text: The sergeant 'misreads' the fee. You pay more than you should, but arguing would cost more than coin.

outcomes.title: Find the Right Stamp
outcomes.desc: Produce the right paper, or make it look right.

success.text: You point to a clause, a seal, a date. The sergeant grunts and waves you through.

fail.text: You cite the wrong ordinance. Laughter ripples down the line; the sergeant makes a show of correcting you.

outcomes.title: Slip Through the Side Path
outcomes.desc: There’s a goat track. There’s also brush that hides patrols.

success.text: You leave the road, take the track, and rejoin the highway beyond the rope. You keep your coin, and learn how porous law really is.

fail.text: A patrol steps out where you thought there was only shadow. Their looks say you were expected.

outcomes.title: Turn It Into a Favor
outcomes.desc: Offer help the guards actually want: a message carried, a name remembered.

success.text: You volunteer for a small errand and they remember your face as useful, not suspect.

fail.text: You wait too long, talk too much, and end up doing menial work in the cold. You pass through, but tired.

name: Wet Wood, Cold Fire
prompt: In the central marches, rain turns the world into a gray sheet. Your tinder is damp, your fingers numb.

outcomes.title: Spend Supplies
outcomes.desc: Burn what you must to keep warmth and morale.

success.text: You sacrifice a little now to avoid losing much later. The fire holds, small but stubborn.

fail.text: You burn more than you meant. The night is survivable, but your pack is thinner.

outcomes.title: Build a Better Shelter
outcomes.desc: Work the problem: windbreak, drainage, dry core.

success.text: Your shelter stays dry enough to save your tinder. In the morning you even find usable kindling.

fail.text: You labor until your shoulders ache, but the rain still finds its way in. You wake sore and short-tempered.

outcomes.title: Steal a Merchant’s Charcoal
outcomes.desc: A cart nearby is covered, but not locked.

success.text: You take a pouch of charcoal and leave no trace. The fire catches fast, and the guilt catches slower.

fail.text: A shout cuts the rain. Someone saw your hand disappear under canvas.

outcomes.title: Endure It Unwarmed
outcomes.desc: Bear the cold. Let it pass through you.

success.text: You keep watch through the worst of it. Others sleep because you didn’t.

fail.text: By dawn your joints burn and your throat is raw. The cold took its due while you pretended it couldn’t.

name: Broken Cart Axle
prompt: In a shipyard port’s shipyards, a small cart lies cockeyed in the ditch, axle snapped. The driver looks at you like you’re either salvation or another spectator.

outcomes.title: Lift and Haul
outcomes.desc: Put your back into it and set it right.

success.text: Wood groans, wheels roll, and the cart finds level ground again. Gratitude travels faster than wagons.

fail.text: You strain until your breath tastes like metal. The cart moves, but you pay in fatigue.

outcomes.title: Jury-Rig the Axle
outcomes.desc: Splints, lashings, and patience.

success.text: Your fix is ugly but functional. The driver presses coin into your palm like it’s a secret.

fail.text: The lashings slip on the first test. You lose time and materials before conceding.

outcomes.title: Offer Quiet Extortion
outcomes.desc: Help… for a price high enough to sting.

success.text: You name a fee. They pay, bitterly.

fail.text: They shout your greed to the roadside. Bystanders remember.

outcomes.title: Call in a Favor
outcomes.desc: Use Influence, find someone who owes you, or pretend they do.

success.text: A nearby foreman recognizes your authority, or your audacity. Hands are found, and the cart is righted with minimal fuss.

fail.text: No one bites. You spend an hour trying to look important.

name: The Lonely Shrine
prompt: At a hillside abbey, a roadside shrine, stone bowl, faded icon, a stub of candle. Someone has left a tiny offering: bread, a copper, a ribbon.

outcomes.title: Leave an Offering
outcomes.desc: Give something small. Buy goodwill from whatever listens.

success.text: You leave coin and a quiet promise. The act steadies you more than you expected.

fail.text: You fumble the ritual and feel silly for it. Still, an offering is an offering.

outcomes.title: Study the Iconography
outcomes.desc: Read the weathered marks for meaning.

success.text: Under grime and moss, you find a symbol that doesn’t belong. Someone repurposed this shrine for something else.

fail.text: You learn only that stone erodes and stories blur. Nothing more.

outcomes.title: Take the Copper
outcomes.desc: If no one is watching, is it theft or just… redistribution?

success.text: You pocket the copper and walk away. The road feels colder behind you.

fail.text: As you touch the offering, your skin prickles. Something in the air shifts, like a breath held too long.

outcomes.title: Repair the Shrine
outcomes.desc: Stack stones, clear weeds, relight a candle.
