success.text: You leave it better than you found it. Travelers will notice, and some will ask who did it.

fail.text: You do what you can, but the rain takes it back before you’re even gone.

name: Night Camp Whispers
prompt: Outside a frontier keep, your fire is low. Nearby travelers speak in murmurs, plans, names, the sound of coin.

outcomes.title: Keep Watch
outcomes.desc: Stay awake and let the night pass on your terms.

success.text: Nothing happens. That’s a victory the cautious understand.

fail.text: Your eyes blur. You jerk awake to find your pack lighter.

outcomes.title: Join Their Talk
outcomes.desc: Make yourself part of the circle before you become a target.

success.text: You trade stories and keep your questions gentle. By the end, you have a contact and a shared joke.

fail.text: You say one thing too sharp. The murmurs stop.

outcomes.title: Eavesdrop Quietly
outcomes.desc: Listen. Gather. Keep your hands clean.

success.text: You catch a name and a destination. It could be advantage.

fail.text: A voice calls you out. The word 'spy' is said loud enough to travel.

outcomes.title: Pick a Pocket
outcomes.desc: Quick fingers, quick exit.

success.text: A purse disappears. You’re gone before suspicion turns into certainty.

fail.text: A blade flashes in the firelight. You escape with blood on your sleeve and anger in their eyes.

name: Petitioners' Hall
prompt: In the capital’s court, a hall of waiting faces: farmers with caps in hands, merchants with ledgers, guards with bored eyes. Somewhere beyond a curtain, decisions are made.

outcomes.title: Speak for the Smallfolk
outcomes.desc: Use your voice to lend theirs weight.

success.text: You speak plainly and without flourish. People nod.

fail.text: You are interrupted, corrected, dismissed. The crowd’s sympathy turns into pity.

outcomes.title: Draft a Proper Petition
outcomes.desc: Words, format, precedent, make it unignorable.

success.text: You turn grievances into something the court can’t pretend it doesn’t understand.

fail.text: You miss a required seal and the clerk sends you away with a sigh.

outcomes.title: Whisper the Right Name
outcomes.desc: A hint of patronage can open doors, or shut them.

success.text: You name someone with power. The guard’s posture changes.

fail.text: You name the wrong person. A guard’s hand settles on their baton, slow and certain.

outcomes.title: Wait Patiently
outcomes.desc: Sometimes the safest move is to be forgettable.

success.text: Hours pass. Eventually your turn arrives, and you are neither favored nor punished.

fail.text: The hall closes early. You’ve lost a day and gained only stiffness.

name: A Rumor at Table
prompt: In the capital’s court, a laugh behind a goblet. A name spoken softly.

outcomes.title: Deflect with Grace
outcomes.desc: Turn gossip into nothing.

success.text: You smile, change the topic, and leave the rumor to rot on the tablecloth.

fail.text: Your deflection is too sharp; someone thinks you’re hiding something.

outcomes.title: Verify Quietly
outcomes.desc: Ask questions that don’t look like questions.

success.text: By dessert you know what’s true, what’s false, and who wants you to repeat it.

fail.text: You chase the rumor in circles. You learn only that someone is enjoying the chase.

outcomes.title: Trade a Secret
outcomes.desc: Give a little to get a lot.

success.text: You pay in whispers and receive something sharper in return.

fail.text: You give more than you get. The room feels smaller afterward.

outcomes.title: Call It Out
outcomes.desc: Put a torch to the rumor and see who flinches.

success.text: Someone pales. Someone excuses themselves.

fail.text: The court laughs at you instead. The rumor grows teeth and finds your name.

name: The Herald’s Notice
prompt: At an oasis court’s oasis court, a herald reads proclamations until words lose meaning, then your ears catch one: new restrictions, new taxes, new punishments.

outcomes.title: Learn the Letter of It
outcomes.desc: Understand what has actually changed.

success.text: You parse the language and find the loophole hidden in plain sight.

fail.text: The wording is slippery. You leave with half a truth and a full headache.

outcomes.title: Publicly Support It
outcomes.desc: Align yourself with authority.

success.text: You nod at the right moment. The herald’s eyes remember you.

fail.text: Someone hisses 'bootlicker'. The crowd’s mood turns against you.

outcomes.title: Sow Doubt
outcomes.desc: Quietly encourage resistance.

success.text: You plant questions like seeds. People carry them away in their pockets.

fail.text: A guard hears your tone. Their stare lingers too long.

outcomes.title: Leave Before It Matters
outcomes.desc: Avoid being seen reacting at all.

success.text: You slip out. No one remembers your face, and that’s sometimes the point.

fail.text: You hesitate and get jostled. Nothing happens, except you’re now part of the crowd’s memory.

name: The Masked Benefactor
prompt: At an oasis court’s oasis court, a figure in a half-mask requests a private word. They offer assistance, coin, introductions, protection, in exchange for a future promise.

outcomes.title: Accept the Patronage
outcomes.desc: Take the hand offered and worry later.

success.text: You agree. The promise feels light, until it isn’t.

fail.text: They decide you’re too risky. The offer evaporates with a polite bow.

outcomes.title: Negotiate Terms
outcomes.desc: Make the promise narrower. Make it survivable.

success.text: You rewrite the future in careful clauses. They smile, sharp approval.

fail.text: They tire of your caution and move on.

outcomes.title: Investigate the Mask
outcomes.desc: Who is this, really?

success.text: You notice the accent, the ring, the perfume. Pieces of identity fall into place.

fail.text: Your probing is noticed. Their guard steps between you like a door closing.

outcomes.title: Refuse Cleanly
outcomes.desc: Decline without insult. Keep your freedom.

success.text: You walk away unbought. Someone sees it and admires the spine.

fail.text: You offend them despite your care. A subtle pressure follows you afterward.

name: The Auditor’s Quill
prompt: In the capital’s court, an auditor’s clerk asks to see accounts, papers, receipts. Their quill pauses at your name like it has been waiting for it.

outcomes.title: Produce Clean Records
outcomes.desc: If you’re innocent, prove it.

success.text: You hand over neat papers. The clerk’s interest fades, disappointed.

fail.text: You can’t find a document. The pause becomes a note in the margin.

outcomes.title: Bribe for Expedience
outcomes.desc: Buy speed. Buy silence.

success.text: Coin slides under parchment. The clerk’s quill resumes like nothing happened.

fail.text: The clerk looks offended, then interested. Your bribe becomes advantage.

outcomes.title: Forge a Missing Receipt
outcomes.desc: Make the paper say what it must.

success.text: Ink dries. The ledger closes.

fail.text: The clerk’s finger smears the ink. Their eyes sharpen.

outcomes.title: Turn Tables With Questions
outcomes.desc: Ask what they’re really looking for.

success.text: The clerk reveals, by accident, the target of the audit. Useful knowledge travels upward.

fail.text: You overplay it. The clerk writes something you wish they hadn’t.

name: A Stolen Seal
prompt: In a back room, a thief shows you a wax seal still attached to a strip of parchment. ‘Worth more than coin,’ they whisper.

outcomes.title: Buy It
outcomes.desc: Pay now. Use later.

success.text: You pay, and the thief disappears. The seal is warm in your pocket like a living thing.

fail.text: You reach for coin and meet a blade’s tip. You pay anyway, more than agreed.

outcomes.title: Test Its Origin
outcomes.desc: Confirm whose it is before you touch fate.

success.text: You identify the house by a tiny flaw in the imprint. The seal has a story, and enemies.

fail.text: You can’t place it. A seal without context is just wax.

outcomes.title: Steal It
outcomes.desc: Take it and run. Let the underworld chase your shadow.

success.text: You snatch the seal and vanish into alleys. The thief’s shout becomes a bounty.

fail.text: You get the seal, but not cleanly. Blood marks your trail.

outcomes.title: Refuse and Leave
outcomes.desc: Some offers are traps with velvet lining.

success.text: You walk away. The thief’s smile curdles.

fail.text: They mock your caution loudly. The room turns eyes on you.

name: Street Dice
prompt: In the central marches, a ring of onlookers cheers as dice clatter on a crate. The stakes climb faster than sense.

outcomes.title: Play Straight
outcomes.desc: Trust luck, and your read of people.

success.text: You win small, leave early, and keep your smile private.

fail.text: Luck turns. You lose, and the crowd forgets you immediately.

outcomes.title: Cheat Better
outcomes.desc: If they’re cheating, you’re just… competing.

success.text: You palm the die, swap the throw. The hustler’s eyes narrow, respect or threat, you can’t tell.

fail.text: A hand grabs your wrist. ‘Thief,’ someone says, and suddenly everyone agrees.

outcomes.title: Break the Game
outcomes.desc: Flip the crate, scatter the dice, end it.

success.text: People scramble. The hustler curses.

fail.text: A bottle clips your head. You leave, hurt and hated.

outcomes.title: Watch and Learn
outcomes.desc: Stand back. Study the pattern.

success.text: You see the trick. You also see who pays the hustler to keep the game running.

fail.text: You linger too long and draw attention. You slip away, tired and annoyed.

name: A Ciphered Note
prompt: In a banking city, a folded note is slipped into your hand in the crowd. The symbols aren’t words, until you look at them sideways.

outcomes.title: Crack It Yourself
outcomes.desc: Break the cipher with patience and pattern.

success.text: The message resolves into names and dates. Someone is moving coin, and bodies.

fail.text: You waste hours. The meaning stays just out of reach.

outcomes.title: Hand It to an Expert
outcomes.desc: Find a scribe who owes you, or can be bought.

success.text: The expert translates and looks worried. They charge extra for the worry.

fail.text: The expert refuses. Some knowledge burns to hold.

outcomes.title: Use It as Bait
outcomes.desc: Let the sender think you understood, and see who comes.

success.text: A meeting is arranged. You learn who’s connected to whom.

fail.text: The wrong eyes spot you with the note. The city suddenly has sharper corners.

outcomes.title: Burn It
outcomes.desc: Destroy the note before it can be used against you. No questions, no leverage.

success.text: Flame eats ink. You walk away from a story that wanted you inside it.

fail.text: You hesitate, and someone notices. You leave, but the note’s existence is no longer yours alone.

name: Hidden Alcove
prompt: In the central marches, you find an alcove: a small pouch, a ring, a list of names. Someone meant to return.

outcomes.title: Take Only Coin
outcomes.desc: Leave the list. Keep the simple sin.

success.text: You take coin and leave the rest. Your luck feels… watched.

fail.text: As you pull the pouch free, something snaps, a thread, a ward, a sense.

outcomes.title: Take the List
outcomes.desc: Names are power. Names are danger.

success.text: You copy the list. It’s a map of hidden obligations.

fail.text: Footsteps. You leave in haste, and your panic is remembered.

outcomes.title: Set a Trap
outcomes.desc: Return the stone, watch from shadow.

success.text: You see who returns. The face is valuable knowledge.

fail.text: You wait too long. The night steals your strength.

outcomes.title: Report It
outcomes.desc: Bring it to authority, if you trust them.

success.text: A captain takes the evidence and nods slowly. You’ve chosen a side.

fail.text: They suspect you planted it. Your good deed becomes your stain.

name: Debt Collector’s Knock
prompt: In a shipyard port’s shipyards, a hard knock at an inconvenient hour. A collector with polite eyes and strong friends asks about money you may or may not owe.

outcomes.title: Pay Something
outcomes.desc: Make the problem smaller.

success.text: You pay enough to buy time. The collector notes it carefully.

fail.text: You pay, but they insist the remainder is still due, soon.

outcomes.title: Prove You Don’t Owe
outcomes.desc: Paper beats threats, sometimes.

success.text: You show the receipt. The collector’s smile thins.

fail.text: Your records don’t convince. The collector makes sure others hear you’re a dodger.

outcomes.title: Threaten Them Back
outcomes.desc: Make it clear this doorstep is expensive.

success.text: They step back. Respect is fear with better clothing.

fail.text: Their friends arrive. The city reminds you who it belongs to.

outcomes.title: Bribe for Erasure
outcomes.desc: Pay to make your name disappear from the ledger.

success.text: Coin changes hands. The debt becomes a rumor instead of a sentence.

fail.text: They take your coin and keep the ledger. You’ve bought nothing but contempt.

name: Practice Yard Duel
prompt: In the practice yard, a challenger steps forward with blunted steel. Their grin says they want an audience.

outcomes.title: Win Clean
outcomes.desc: Technique, timing, and restraint.

success.text: You land the telling blow. The yard cheers, and your name rises with the noise.

fail.text: A clumsy strike catches your arm. It’s not deadly, just humiliating and painful.

outcomes.title: Outthink Them
outcomes.desc: Feints, footwork, and reading intent.

success.text: You bait their overreach and punish it. Even the veterans nod.

fail.text: Your plan is sound, but your timing isn’t. The bout ends in a messy tie.

outcomes.title: Fight Dirty
outcomes.desc: A knee, a shove, a lesson.

success.text: You win fast. The challenger’s grin dies.

fail.text: They call you out mid-bout. The crowd turns on you like a tide.

outcomes.title: Refuse the Bout
outcomes.desc: Decline with calm. Let them swing at air.

success.text: You deny them the spectacle. A trainer respects your discipline.

fail.text: Your refusal reads as fear. Someone laughs too loud.

name: Tavern Brawl
prompt: In the central marches, becomes a shove, becomes a room full of fists. Chairs scrape.

outcomes.title: End It Fast
outcomes.desc: Put the loudest down and let the rest reconsider.

success.text: A single decisive blow changes the room’s math. The brawl collapses into mutters.

fail.text: You swing, and eat a bottle for it. Blood and laughter mix.

outcomes.title: Talk Them Down
outcomes.desc: Find the one person everyone listens to.

success.text: Your voice cuts through the noise. People pause, remember consequences, and start backing away.

fail.text: They shout over you. Your attempt becomes the joke.

outcomes.title: Slip Out the Back
outcomes.desc: Let fools break each other while you vanish.

success.text: You leave before anyone decides you’re responsible for anything.

fail.text: A hand catches your cloak and shakes you down on the way out.

outcomes.title: Protect Someone
outcomes.desc: Shield the weak, whether they deserve it or not.

success.text: You drag a terrified patron behind the bar. Someone thanks you later, quietly and sincerely.

fail.text: You take too many hits meant for others. You walk out upright, but drained.

name: Militia Muster
prompt: In the central marches, a captain calls for able hands. Bandits, wolves, raiders, something has townsfolk scared enough to pay for spears.

outcomes.title: Volunteer
outcomes.desc: Join the line. Earn respect the hard way.

success.text: You return with scratches and stories. The captain pays and recommends you.

fail.text: The skirmish goes bad. You return alive, but hurt in a way that lingers.

outcomes.title: Train Them
outcomes.desc: Teach farmers to hold a line.

success.text: They fumble at first, then they brace, then they hold. By sundown, the line looks like it might survive.

fail.text: They don’t take you seriously. You waste a day and leave frustrated.

outcomes.title: Take the Contract Quietly
outcomes.desc: Offer to handle it yourself, no witnesses, no questions.

success.text: You solve the problem in a way the town can deny knowing about. Payment comes in a plain pouch.

fail.text: Someone sees too much. The captain’s eyes become suspicious.

outcomes.title: Decline and Move On
outcomes.desc: Keep your skin and your schedule.

success.text: You pass through untouched.

fail.text: The town notices your refusal. Cowardice is an easy story to tell.

name: Guarded Caravan
prompt: In a shipyard port’s shipyards, a merchant caravan offers you temporary work: one road, one payout. They warn you the last caravan lost two guards and all its spice.

outcomes.title: Take the Work
outcomes.desc: Be steel on the road, for coin.

success.text: You earn your pay and keep wagons moving. The merchant pays without argument.

fail.text: Trouble finds you. You keep the caravan safe enough, but not yourself.

outcomes.title: Negotiate Better Pay
outcomes.desc: Make your risk worth it.

success.text: You name a price and the merchant accepts, annoyed but pragmatic.

fail.text: They call you greedy in front of others. Your advantage evaporates.

outcomes.title: Scout Ahead
outcomes.desc: Avoid fights by spotting them first.

success.text: You find a safer route and a cache of usable gear left by someone else’s misfortune.

fail.text: You walk too far, too fast. Nothing happens, except fatigue.

outcomes.title: Skim the Cargo
outcomes.desc: A pinch of spice won’t be missed, will it?

success.text: You take a small fortune’s worth of 'samples'.

fail.text: A merchant’s son counts crates obsessively. Your hand is discovered.

name: Hunt Gone Wrong
prompt: In the central marches, a hunt meant for sport turns sharp. The boar doesn’t flee; it charges.

outcomes.title: Face the Beast
outcomes.desc: Stand your ground.

success.text: You meet tusk with steel. The boar falls, and so does the fear in everyone’s eyes.

fail.text: The boar catches you hard. You survive, but pain becomes a companion.

outcomes.title: Coordinate the Hunters
outcomes.desc: Turn chaos into a plan.

success.text: You direct spears, call angles, and the beast is trapped and killed with minimal blood.

fail.text: Your orders conflict and people stumble. The blame finds you.

outcomes.title: Spook It Away
outcomes.desc: Use noise, scent, and misdirection.

success.text: You drive it off long enough for people to regroup. In the retreat you overhear an argument, useful.

fail.text: It turns on you instead. You escape, scraped and shaken.

outcomes.title: Save an Injured Hunter
outcomes.desc: Forget glory, save a life.

success.text: You bind wounds and carry weight. Someone lives because you chose them over the trophy.

fail.text: You struggle under the burden. You manage, but your body protests for days.

name: An Old Map in the Margins
prompt: Near an archive-fortress’s cliff-carved archives, a book you borrowed for one purpose contains another: a map scribbled in the margins, roads that don’t exist anymore, a mark that might mean treasure, or tragedy.

outcomes.title: Copy the Map
outcomes.desc: Preserve it. Use it later.

success.text: You copy every line. Knowledge becomes something you can carry.

fail.text: Ink blots. You lose a crucial symbol and with it the map’s meaning.

outcomes.title: Ask a Scholar
outcomes.desc: Find someone who recognizes the place names.

success.text: A scholar lights up at the sight. They trade explanation for a small fee.

fail.text: The scholar scoffs and demands more coin than you can justify.

outcomes.title: Keep It Hidden
outcomes.desc: Maps like this create enemies. Keep quiet.

success.text: You tuck the map away and tell no one. It becomes a private door in your mind.

fail.text: You can’t stop yourself from mentioning it. Someone’s interest sparks too quickly.

outcomes.title: Sell the Knowledge
outcomes.desc: Let someone else chase it.

success.text: You sell the secret of the map. The buyer’s smile says you sold more than ink.

fail.text: Word gets around that you traffic in stolen scholarship.

name: Forbidden Marginalia
prompt: In a monastery copy, the margins are filled with a different hand: arguments against doctrine, questions that cut too close, a symbol drawn again and again like a fixation.

outcomes.title: Study It
outcomes.desc: Read the dangerous thoughts carefully.

success.text: You learn an idea that can’t be unlearned. It sticks like burrs.

fail.text: The text makes your head swim. When you look up, you feel oddly watched.

outcomes.title: Report It
outcomes.desc: Bring it to authority. Let them decide.

success.text: They thank you. Quietly.

fail.text: They suspect you wrote it. The question becomes you.

outcomes.title: Copy Only the Symbol
outcomes.desc: Take the key, leave the sermon.

success.text: You copy the symbol on a slip of paper. It feels like a promise made to something you haven’t met.

fail.text: Ink smears. A monk walks in.

outcomes.title: Burn the Page
outcomes.desc: Destroy temptation before it becomes a path.

success.text: Flame eats the margin. You feel lighter, like you dodged a hook.

fail.text: You hesitate and someone sees the scorch mark. You didn’t destroy it, only drew attention.

name: Herbcraft Lesson
prompt: At a hillside abbey, a hedge-healer invites you to identify plants by smell and bitterness. 'The world wants to poison you,' they say.

outcomes.title: Learn Diligently
outcomes.desc: Treat it like a craft worth respect.

success.text: You learn what to chew, what to avoid, and what to sell.

fail.text: You confuse two similar leaves and earn a sharp lecture.

outcomes.title: Barter for Remedies
outcomes.desc: Trade coin for salves and teas.

success.text: You buy small comforts against a harsh world.

fail.text: You overpay, but the remedies are still useful.

outcomes.title: Steal a Pouch
outcomes.desc: Take what you can when they turn away.

success.text: You take a pouch of dried herbs. The healer’s eyes never meet yours again.

fail.text: You’re caught mid-reach. The healer curses you in a low voice that feels heavier than words.

outcomes.title: Test Yourself Harshly
outcomes.desc: Taste, endure, prove you’re not fragile.

success.text: You hold the bitterness and keep your composure. Respect is given sparingly, and you receive it.

fail.text: Your stomach rebels. You spend a day in misery, learning the lesson too well.

name: The Scribe’s Error
prompt: In a scholar's town, a clerk miscopies a name in a register. The mistake is small, until you realize the wrong name is yours.

outcomes.title: Correct It Politely
outcomes.desc: Fix the record without making a scene.

success.text: The clerk corrects it and thanks you for discretion.

fail.text: The clerk shrugs and delays. You leave, unresolved.

outcomes.title: Prove It With Evidence
outcomes.desc: Receipts, witnesses, seals.

success.text: You produce proof. The clerk’s quill scratches reluctantly.

fail.text: The clerk demands a fee for the 'work'.

outcomes.title: Exploit the Error
outcomes.desc: A wrong name can become a shield, or a weapon.

success.text: You let the mistake stand and use it to slip past a small obstacle later.

fail.text: Someone notices you noticing. Suspicion grows where it shouldn’t.

outcomes.title: Destroy the Page
outcomes.desc: No record, no problem, until there is.

success.text: The page is ruined, the record lost. You feel powerful for a heartbeat.

fail.text: Guards arrive faster than you expected. The court loves its writs.

name: An Astral Omen
prompt: Near an archive-fortress’s cliff-carved archives, a clear night reveals a strange alignment, one star blinking red as if embarrassed to be seen. Old folk mutter prayers.

outcomes.title: Treat It as Superstition
outcomes.desc: Don’t let the sky write your life.

success.text: You sleep anyway. In the morning, you feel stubbornly alive.

fail.text: Your defiance feels hollow. The omen sits in your thoughts like grit.

outcomes.title: Seek Interpretation
outcomes.desc: Ask someone who makes meaning for a living.

success.text: You hear a reading that is half wisdom, half theater, and still useful.

fail.text: The interpreter demands more coin, offers less clarity.

outcomes.title: Use It to Move People
outcomes.desc: Omen as rhetoric. Fear as advantage.

success.text: You speak and people listen. The sky gives your words weight.

fail.text: They call you a charlatan. Your performance backfires.

outcomes.title: Mark Yourself
outcomes.desc: Make a small ritual. A vow. A token.

success.text: You complete the ritual. It’s ridiculous, until you feel the world notice you back.

fail.text: The ritual goes wrong. Not disastrously, just enough.

name: The Heir’s Suitors
prompt: In the capital’s court, letters arrive with wax seals and fine hands: offers, insinuations, and ‘helpful’ counsel on whom your heir ought to wed. Each comes with a price, spoken or not.

outcomes.title: Choose the Strongest Alliance
outcomes.desc: Pick the match that brings the most advantage, and accept the obligations that follow.

success.text: You bind your house to a name people recognize. Doors open, and so do accounts you did not know you’d owe.

fail.text: Your choice offends a rival family. The polite smiles harden into rumor, and your household feels suddenly smaller.

outcomes.title: Test Them Quietly
outcomes.desc: Send discreet questions through clerks and servants; learn what isn’t written.

success.text: A whispered inquiry returns with a ledger of vices. Useful, if you know when to stop reading.

fail.text: Someone notices your questions. The wrong ear hears your name paired with ‘blackmail.’.

outcomes.title: Refuse the Game
outcomes.desc: Announce that your heir will choose freely, and dare the court to scoff.

success.text: Your refusal reads as conviction. Some mock you, others respect you more than they admit.

fail.text: Courtiers smile and move on, around you. Favors you once spent now cost more.

outcomes.title: Take a Dowry Up Front
outcomes.desc: Negotiate coin first; let affection come later.

success.text: Coin changes hands. The match remains ‘honorable’, at least on paper.

fail.text: The offer becomes a story, then a song. None of them are kind.

name: The Physician’s Prognosis
prompt: In a hard-bitten town, a physician with careful eyes asks to see your hands, your tongue, the whites of your eyes. Their answer is measured, but it lands like a hammer all the same.

outcomes.title: Follow the Regimen
outcomes.desc: Rest, bitter teas, and fewer late nights, whether you like it or not.

success.text: You keep to the regimen. The days are dull, but you wake with fewer shadows behind your eyes.

fail.text: You keep to the regimen for a day or two, then life pries you loose. The bitterness goes cold, the rest gets stolen, and the illness takes its hold.

outcomes.title: Seek a Second Opinion
outcomes.desc: Find a different healer, one with different books, or different beliefs.

success.text: Another healer offers reassurance, and a name you can invoke later in polite rooms.

fail.text: A ‘remedy’ leaves you worse. The stink of superstition clings to you for weeks.

outcomes.title: Pay for Discretion
outcomes.desc: Make sure this visit never becomes gossip.

success.text: The physician bows. Your frailty remains your own.

fail.text: Coin dulls tongues, but not all tongues. A rumor escapes, limping into court.

outcomes.title: Ignore It
outcomes.desc: Act as if nothing is wrong. If you walk tall enough, perhaps the body will listen.

success.text: You push through pain and make it look like strength. People remember the posture, not the price.

fail.text: Your vision tunnels. The room tilts.

name: Old Debts Resurface
prompt: In a toll city, a face you haven’t seen in years appears in a doorway, older, sharper, and smiling like they already know what you did to survive.

outcomes.title: Pay Them Off
outcomes.desc: Coin is cheaper than consequences, most days.

success.text: They take the coin and vanish. You sleep that night without listening for steps.

fail.text: They take your coin and keep your name. It was never about money.

outcomes.title: Turn the Tables
outcomes.desc: Remind them you have teeth, too.

success.text: You find the thread they’re hiding and pull. Their smile breaks.

fail.text: Your pressure slips, and the snap echoes. Now the law knows there’s a story worth hearing.

outcomes.title: Confess to a Patron
outcomes.desc: Tell a powerful ally first, before the rumor arrives without you.

success.text: A patron absorbs the shock and offers a quiet plan. It costs you pride, but buys you time.

fail.text: Your patron’s face cools. They didn’t buy your loyalty to inherit your scandals.

outcomes.title: Flee the City
outcomes.desc: Leave before the ink dries on any warrant.

success.text: You’re gone before sunrise. The road is cruel, but it doesn’t ask questions.

fail.text: You hesitate, one day too long. Someone recognizes you at the gate.

name: The Slow Road Home
prompt: In a hard-bitten town, the same road you once took in a day now demands two. Every hill feels steeper; every mile asks a price in breath.

outcomes.title: Travel Light
outcomes.desc: Leave comforts behind. Keep only what matters.

success.text: You strip the load to essentials. The pace steadies, and you arrive with something left in you.

fail.text: You discard the wrong thing. A needed tool is gone when you reach for it.

outcomes.title: Hire a Wagon
outcomes.desc: Pay coin to spare your body.

success.text: The wagon rattles, but you endure. Sometimes wisdom is just paying someone else to suffer.

fail.text: The driver takes your coin and your time. You arrive late, and spent.

outcomes.title: Press On Through Pain
outcomes.desc: Refuse to slow. Prove you still can.

success.text: You make the distance. People see the stubbornness and call it strength.

fail.text: Your legs betray you. The cold settles in your bones like a tenant that won’t leave.

outcomes.title: Make Camp Early
outcomes.desc: Stop before the night turns ugly. Eat, rest, and live to travel tomorrow.

success.text: You sleep deeply and rise steadier.

fail.text: Camp is never truly safe. You wake to damp blankets and a dull headache.

name: The Last Muster
prompt: In the central marches, a messenger arrives with a muster order. The realm calls bodies to a banner, and your name is on the list, as if time never touched you.

outcomes.title: Attend as a Captain
outcomes.desc: Stand at the front, give orders, and let younger arms do the lifting.

success.text: You organize the line with calm authority. The levy holds, and your words carry further than your blade.

fail.text: The press becomes chaos. A stray blow finds you before you can retreat behind the ranks.

outcomes.title: Buy a Substitute
outcomes.desc: Pay someone to take your place. Cowardice is just another expense.

success.text: The coin buys silence, and a name written in place of yours.

fail.text: Someone sees the exchange. The story spreads faster than the marching drums.

outcomes.title: Report Illness
outcomes.desc: Claim infirmity and dare anyone to challenge it.

success.text: They grumble, but they let you be. The realm has enough corpses without demanding yours early.

fail.text: A clerk demands proof. The scrutiny feels like a trial.

outcomes.title: Fight in the Line
outcomes.desc: Take a weapon and answer the call the old way.

success.text: You hold your place and refuse to fall. Someone will tell this story as long as they have a tongue.

fail.text: Your shoulder screams as steel bites. Pride is light, until you have to carry it home in pieces.

name: Disputed Testament
prompt: In the capital’s court, a distant cousin produces a ‘true’ copy of a testament, and suddenly your house is a table where strangers sit and count your silver.

outcomes.title: Produce the Original
outcomes.desc: Bring forth the seal, the witnesses, the ink that cannot be argued with.

success.text: You present the original with calm precision. The claimant falters, and the court turns their eyes away from you.

fail.text: Your proof is incomplete. The court smells weakness, and the claimant leans in.

outcomes.title: Buy the Judge’s Attention
outcomes.desc: Coin in the right hand is its own evidence.

success.text: The judgment lands in your favor. The court calls it ‘law.’.

fail.text: The bribe is noticed. Worse: it’s documented.

outcomes.title: Settle Quietly
outcomes.desc: Offer a small concession to end the noise before it grows.

success.text: You trade a slice of the pie for silence. It tastes bitter, but the table grows quiet again.

fail.text: They refuse the offer and take the insult to court. Now it’s a spectacle.

outcomes.title: Threaten Their Name
outcomes.desc: Remind them what you know, and what you’re willing to share.

success.text: Their hands shake when you speak. You gain a new secret and an old enemy.

fail.text: They are not afraid. They leave the room smiling, and you realize too late they wanted you to make the threat.

name: Teach the Apprentice
prompt: Near an archive-fortress’s cliff-carved archives, a bright-eyed apprentice begs for lessons: sword forms, ledger tricks, court etiquette, whatever you’re known for. Teaching is a kind of legacy.

outcomes.title: Teach with Patience
outcomes.desc: Give them the boring truths that actually keep people alive.

success.text: They listen. They learn.

fail.text: You try to teach, but the hours drain you. The apprentice leaves grateful; you leave tired.

outcomes.title: Demand Payment
outcomes.desc: Lessons are work. Work costs coin.

success.text: Coin comes in a neat purse. Respect comes with it, sometimes.

fail.text: Word spreads that you ‘charge for breath.’ It’s unfair, yet it sticks.

outcomes.title: Teach Them Secrets
outcomes.desc: Show them the shortcuts, dangerous, effective, unforgettable.

success.text: They learn what others won’t teach. You gain a grateful shadow in the city.

fail.text: They talk. Or they’re followed.

outcomes.title: Refuse
outcomes.desc: Legacy is a trap. Let them find their own way.

success.text: You refuse politely and avoid becoming anyone’s crutch. A patron admires the restraint.

fail.text: They leave offended. In a small world, offended people become loud.

name: A Quiet Blackmail
prompt: In the central marches, a note arrives without signature. It lists three facts only you would know, and ends with a request written as if it’s already agreed upon.

outcomes.title: Pay in Secrets
outcomes.desc: Trade one danger for another. Choose the smaller fire.

success.text: You answer with a secret of your own. The pressure eases, for now.

fail.text: Your secret isn’t good enough. The note returns with a new demand.

outcomes.title: Set a Trap
outcomes.desc: Arrange a meeting. Bring witnesses you trust.

success.text: You catch a courier and follow them back to the source. The name you learn is ugly, but useful.

fail.text: Steel flashes in a narrow alley. You escape, but not unmarked.

outcomes.title: Publicly Denounce It
outcomes.desc: Turn the accusation into theater. If it’s in the open, it can’t control you, right?

success.text: Your outrage convinces the crowd. The blackmailer loses their advantage in the noise.

fail.text: The blackmailer wanted you to shout. Now everyone knows where to aim their curiosity.

outcomes.title: Disappear for a Season
outcomes.desc: Leave town, leave court, leave the story behind.

success.text: You vanish. The rumor starves without you to feed on.

fail.text: You vanish, and someone writes the story for you.

name: Pilgrimage for Rest
prompt: At a hillside abbey, you consider a pilgrimage, not for glory, but for quiet. A road walked slowly can still change you, if you survive it.

outcomes.title: Walk the Long Road
outcomes.desc: Take the honest path, step by step.

success.text: The road strips you down and builds you back up. You return lighter, if poorer.

fail.text: The journey drains you. Your body protests with every cold morning.

outcomes.title: Ride with the Hospice Caravan
outcomes.desc: Travel under holy protection, at a cost in favors.

success.text: They shelter you, and you owe them something you can’t quite name yet.

fail.text: You misunderstand a vow and offend a stern prior. Protection is withdrawn at the worst moment.

outcomes.title: Donate for Absolution
outcomes.desc: Give coin and ask for peace in return.

success.text: Your gift is received with solemn words. You feel, briefly, forgiven.

fail.text: The priest’s eyes linger on your hands as if measuring sin by the nails. You leave uneasy.

outcomes.title: Take the Shortcut
outcomes.desc: A rough track through lonely country. Fewer eyes, more risk.

success.text: You beat the weather and the bandits both. There’s pride in arriving early.

fail.text: A fall on loose stone turns into blood and fever.

name: The Knife in the Dark
prompt: In a toll city, you wake to the softest sound: cloth on stone, breath held too carefully. Someone is in the room with you, and they did not come to talk.

outcomes.title: Fight From the Bed
outcomes.desc: Grab whatever’s close and make it count.

success.text: You drive them back with raw fury. They flee through the window, leaving blood on the sill and fear in your house.

fail.text: The blade finds you before your feet do. You survive, but the wound changes how you sleep.

outcomes.title: Call for Guards
outcomes.desc: Voice as weapon, authority as armor.

success.text: Boots thunder. The intruder is caught in torchlight.

fail.text: No one comes fast enough. The intruder escapes, and whispers begin: ‘unprotected,’ ‘declining.’.

outcomes.title: Slip into Shadow
outcomes.desc: Leave the bed, leave the obvious path. Let them hunt a ghost.

success.text: You move like you once did. You spot their mark and learn who paid for this attempt.

fail.text: You flee the wrong way and burst into the hall with a weapon in hand. A guard sees you first.

outcomes.title: Parley
outcomes.desc: Offer coin, mercy, or a bargain. Assassins have needs too.

success.text: You name a price, and they accept it. They leave with coin, and a warning you’ll remember.

fail.text: They laugh quietly. Some jobs cannot be bargained with.

name: Fate Knot I: The Press at Briarwatch
prompt: You’ve survived long enough to realize that “someday” is a lie people tell themselves. A door is opening, quietly, without ceremony, and if you don’t step through, it may never open again. At a frontier keep, the road narrows between palisade and river. A quarrel has turned into a crush: a wounded carter, a shouting sergeant, and a crowd that wants to be anywhere else. Someone looks to you, not because you’re important, but because you’re “present”. This is the first moment you feel it: a life can tilt on a single choice. This is your first true turning. The next years will grow from what you do here.

outcomes.title: Take Up the Spear
outcomes.desc: Step into the press, put your shoulder in, and make order with your hands.

success.text: You move like you were made for it. The sergeant’s anger turns into approval, and the crowd parts. When it’s done, a spare spear is offered like a question.

fail.text: You misjudge the crush. Someone falls hard, and the blame skitters toward you like spilled grain.

outcomes.title: Settle It with Ink
outcomes.desc: Ask for names, dates, and costs, then adjust the ledger so the blame lands where you want it.

success.text: You find the hinge of the dispute in three lines. The sergeant quiets when you read the figures aloud. A clerk presses a scrap of official paper into your palm, proof you can “count”. A margin note, your margin note, changes who pays.

fail.text: Your numbers don’t land. The crowd hears only arrogance, and the sergeant hears only defiance.

outcomes.title: Slip Through the Side Gate
outcomes.desc: Find the weak hinge, the unguarded latch, the moment when eyes turn away.

success.text: You’re gone before anyone decides you’re worth stopping. Later, you realize you took more than passage: a badge-seal impression on wax, and a name spoken in confidence.

fail.text: You’re caught by a watchful eye. The accusation is soft, but the memory is sharp.

outcomes.title: Speak for the Crowd
outcomes.desc: Climb a barrel, lift your hands, and steer the crowd’s anger toward a safer target.

success.text: Your voice carries. The sergeant yields without admitting it, and the crowd believes they were always orderly. A minor official offers a quiet introduction, doors crack open when people remember your name.

fail.text: You speak and the crowd answers with laughter. Authority isn’t granted; it’s taken, or refused.

outcomes.title: Bind the Wound
outcomes.desc: Kneel beside the carter, ignore the shouting, and do what needs doing.

success.text: Your hands are steady. The carter lives, and the crowd remembers mercy longer than the argument. Someone offers you a candle-token, an invitation to a place where suffering has rules.

fail.text: Your effort is real, but not enough. You rise with blood on your sleeves and judgment in the air.

name: Fate Knot I: The Green Candle Vigil
prompt: You’ve survived long enough to realize that “someday” is a lie people tell themselves. A door is opening, quietly, without ceremony, and if you don’t step through, it may never open again. At a hospice-abbey, the hospice gates never fully close. Tonight, a ward is short-handed, the kind of short-handed that turns a cough into a funeral. A sister with ink-stained fingers asks you a simple question: ““What do you want your life to be for?”” This is your first true turning. The next years will grow from what you do here.

outcomes.title: Stand Watch at the Door
outcomes.desc: Keep order, keep thieves out, keep grief from spilling into the street.

success.text: The night tries you. You do not yield. By dawn, the ward trusts you the way it trusts a locked door.

fail.text: A scuffle breaks your rhythm and the ward pays for it, if not in blood, then in trust.

outcomes.title: Copy the Candle-Lists
outcomes.desc: Help the record-keeper. Names matter. Dates matter. The dead deserve accuracy.

success.text: You learn how a city survives: by keeping track of who it has lost, and who it still owes mercy to.

fail.text: The lists blur. You make an error, and the sister’s look is colder than any rebuke.

outcomes.title: Take What the Ward Won’t Miss
outcomes.desc: A pouch of coin. A vial of tincture. A seal-stamp left unattended. The night is generous to the quick.

success.text: You leave with your pockets heavier and your conscience quieted by practiced reasons.

fail.text: A candle turns and catches you. There’s no shouting, just a door that closes to you forever.

outcomes.title: Speak to the Magistrate
outcomes.desc: The ward needs linen, salt, and guards. You go where decisions are made and make the need undeniable.

success.text: You return with writs and promises. Not enough. But more than nothing, and sometimes that’s the difference.

fail.text: The magistrate smiles and does nothing. When you return, the ward looks smaller than it did.

outcomes.title: Take the Quiet Vow
outcomes.desc: Sit with the dying until dawn. No speeches. No bargains. Just witness.

success.text: It hurts. It changes you anyway. When the sun rises, you find you can carry sorrow without dropping it.

fail.text: You stay, but you falter. You leave early, and the shame follows you into daylight.

name: Fate Knot I: Ink and the Basin
prompt: You’ve survived long enough to realize that “someday” is a lie people tell themselves. A door is opening, quietly, without ceremony, and if you don’t step through, it may never open again. In a banking city, even arguments are conducted like contracts. A broker offers you a seat near the counting tables. Across the hall, an oath is being sworn over a basin of water. Ink on one side, vows on the other. You feel the world presenting you with two doors, and daring you to pick one. This is your first true turning. The next years will grow from what you do here.

outcomes.title: Hire On as Sword-Hand
outcomes.desc: Protection work. Hard pay. Clear rules until someone breaks them.

success.text: You are measured, tested, and, after a long look, accepted. Some doors only open when you look dangerous.

fail.text: They decide you’re too green. The rejection stings worse than the empty purse.

outcomes.title: Apprentice to a Scrivener
outcomes.desc: Sit, listen, learn. Make the world legible.

success.text: You copy until your wrist aches, and in the ache; you realize you’re building a weapon no blade can match.

fail.text: Your first work is returned with a dozen marks. You feel small, but the ink still calls.

outcomes.title: Strike a Bargain in the Shadows
outcomes.desc: A minor seal-stamp, a blank slip of parchment, and a promise that no one will remember your face.

success.text: You walk away with false papers and true advantage.

fail.text: The shadow you bargain with belongs to someone else. You feel the hook sink in.

outcomes.title: Seek Patronage
outcomes.desc: Offer service for favor, and let it be understood you can keep certain things quiet.

success.text: A hand touches your shoulder, a gesture as binding as any contract. You are given a name to invoke.

fail.text: They smile politely and dismiss you. Power can’t be begged; it must be made necessary.

outcomes.title: Swear to Witness
outcomes.desc: You step to the basin and speak a vow that costs nothing, until you try to break it.

success.text: The water chills as you speak. Later, you can’t explain why. You only know the vow feels… present.

fail.text: Your voice catches. The vow comes out crooked, and the watchers notice.

name: Fate Knot I: The Thornmere Invitation
prompt: A black‑wax seal arrives on thin parchment: an invitation, too polite to refuse and too pointed to ignore. At Thornmere’s lakeside hall, the Stag Court’s lesser benches are crowded with petitioners, guards, and hungry eyes. A quarrel in the antechamber has stalled the whole procession—an insult, a stolen signet, a whispered accusation. A courtier’s gaze lands on you. “If you mean to be someone,” they murmur, “choose how.”

outcomes.title: Stand as Blade
outcomes.desc: Place yourself between steel and silk—guard a nervous young lord and keep the room from boiling over.

success.text: You take position without being asked. When tempers flare, your presence makes the difference—one hard step, one steady hand, and the worst of it dies in the throat. The lord remembers who kept him safe when everyone else watched.

fail.text: You move too late. A cup breaks, a blade flashes, and someone screams your name like an accusation. The hall settles, but you feel the stain of it on you.

outcomes.title: Write the Petition
outcomes.desc: Take the dispute to parchment—turn chaos into a request the court can accept.

success.text: You catch the facts, the names, and the order of offense. Your wording gives the court a clean path: who apologizes, who pays, who keeps face. A clerk nods once—approval you can spend later.

fail.text: You choose the wrong phrasing. The petition reads like an accusation instead of a remedy, and the offended party pounces. The court turns, briefly, against you.

outcomes.title: Carry the Whisper
outcomes.desc: Follow the rumor to its source and use it—quietly—to end the matter on your terms.

success.text: You slip behind curtains and into servant corridors where the truth is traded for scraps. By the time you return, you know whose hand moved the signet—and what they fear being known. The quarrel ends, not with justice, but with leverage.

fail.text: You are seen where you shouldn’t be. A guard’s grip closes on your arm, and suddenly you’re not a helpful nobody—you’re a suspect. The hall’s peace comes at your expense.

outcomes.title: Speak in Open Hall
outcomes.desc: Address the crowd with calm authority—offer a settlement that lets everyone live with themselves.

success.text: You raise your voice just enough to be heard and no more. You name the harm, you name the remedy, and you give both sides a dignified exit. When it’s done, a courtier approaches with a quiet question: “Who taught you to speak like that?”

fail.text: Your words land wrong—too sharp, too soft, or simply too late. The room decides you’re taking sides. The dispute ends, but you leave with fewer friends.

outcomes.title: Refuse the Knife
outcomes.desc: Decline the court’s games and choose a steadier path—honor over advancement.

success.text: You step back from the quarrel and do what’s plainly right: return what can be returned, calm who can be calmed, and leave before the hall demands a price. You gain no patron today, but you keep your hands hard to pin.

fail.text: You try to stay clean, but the hall has a way of smearing everyone nearby. Someone repeats your name in the wrong ear, and you feel the court’s attention turn colder.

name: Fate Knot I: The Quiet House Ledger
prompt: In Kestrelbank, people pretend numbers are neutral. They aren’t. A factor with ink-stained fingers slides a folded ledger toward you—not an offer, exactly, but a door left ajar. “The Quiet Houses pay for solutions,” she says. “Not speeches.” Across the countingroom, a debtor argues with a collector, and a clerk quietly locks the door.

outcomes.title: Put the Fear in Them
outcomes.desc: Handle the worst debtor personally—make sure the next payment arrives on time.

success.text: You find the debtor where the city forgets to look. A few hard words and a harder stare do what polite letters never could. Coin changes hands. So does the first taste of what power feels like when it isn’t clean.

fail.text: You push too far. The debtor’s family screams, guards appear, and suddenly you’re the villain in someone else’s story. The ledger stays closed to you after that.

outcomes.title: Find the Fraud
outcomes.desc: Audit the ledger until the lie shows itself—then decide what to do with it.

success.text: You trace ink like footprints. A pattern emerges: a missing line here, a rounded figure there. You name the thief without raising your voice. The factor smiles once—approval, and a purse to match.

fail.text: You spend the night in sums that refuse to resolve. Dawn comes with a headache and no proof. The factor deducts ‘wasted time’ from what you were promised.

outcomes.title: Plant the Clause
outcomes.desc: Slip a single sentence into a contract—one that will bind someone later.

success.text: You change nothing obvious. That’s the point. A clause about ‘late delivery’ becomes a clause about ‘failure of character.’ It will hold when you need it. The Quiet Houses don’t applaud—but they remember.

fail.text: A clerk notices the alteration before the ink dries. The contract is torn, the room goes still, and you feel the city’s law turn its face toward you.

outcomes.title: Negotiate the Settlement
outcomes.desc: Turn a default into a deal—coin now, peace later.

success.text: You name terms both sides can live with. The debtor keeps face, the collector gets paid, and the factor gains a reputation for mercy that still profits. She offers you work—real work—after this season.

fail.text: You offer too much and promise what you can’t guarantee. The debtor slips away, the collector fumes, and the missing coin lands on your shoulders.

outcomes.title: Keep Your Hands Clean
outcomes.desc: Refuse the ledger and leave before it decides who you are.

success.text: You set the ledger back on the desk. Not everyone understands that kind of refusal. Still, you walk out with your name intact—and in Kestrelbank, that’s a currency of its own.

fail.text: Your refusal draws attention. The factor’s smile fades, and the collector remembers your face. You leave, but you feel the city’s doors shut a little.

name: Fate Knot I: The Oathstone Challenge
prompt: In the Ironspine foothills, an oathstone stands where two paths meet—scarred by blades and blackened by old fires. A clan elder pounds a fist against the stone and calls witnesses. The dispute is simple and deadly: a broken hospitality oath, a missing winter store, and a name that must be answered. They look you over as if weighing iron. “Choose,” the elder says. “And be bound by it.”

outcomes.title: Fight as Champion
outcomes.desc: Take one side’s honor onto your shoulders and settle it in the circle.

success.text: You step into the ring and the mountain air turns sharp. Steel speaks plainly here. When the dust settles, your opponent yields—and the clans accept the verdict because you bled for it.

fail.text: You take a hard blow and the world tilts. The ring blurs with shouting. You lose, and worse—you lose publicly.

outcomes.title: Recite the Ring-Law
outcomes.desc: Speak the old clauses that govern hospitality, theft, and recompense.

success.text: You quote the Ring‑Law from memory, then from the marks on the stone itself. The crowd quiets as the logic clicks into place. A verdict forms without a fight, and you earn the rarest thing in the mountains: agreement.

fail.text: You misremember a clause. Someone laughs—then someone else snarls. The argument turns and you become the easiest target: the outsider who spoke wrong.

outcomes.title: Turn the Witness
outcomes.desc: Find the one person who knows the truth and make sure they say what you need.

success.text: You corner the witness behind the hall where the wind can swallow a confession. A single threat, a single promise—enough. In the circle, their testimony bends the verdict. The clans call it justice. You know better.

fail.text: The witness spits in your face and shouts what you tried to do. Hands seize you. In the mountains, a broken oath is one crime; attempted corruption is another.

outcomes.title: Broker the Wergild
outcomes.desc: Offer payment and terms that let both clans step back from blood.

success.text: You name a price for the harm and a path for repayment. It isn’t mercy; it’s math—life measured in iron and grain. The clans accept because they want winter more than vengeance.

fail.text: You promise what you can’t cover. The elder agrees—then sends collectors. Peace is bought, but the bill comes to you.

outcomes.title: Swear the Basin Oath
outcomes.desc: Kneel at the stone and take a vow to carry the truth forward—no matter the cost.

success.text: You speak the vow over cold water poured on the stone. It’s simple: witness, remember, do not lie. The crowd respects a vow they can understand. You leave with a new weight on your name—and a little help for the road.

fail.text: You swear, then hesitate when pressed for details. Doubt spreads fast among oathfolk. Your vow holds—but your credibility doesn’t.

name: Fate Knot I: The Glass Road Stall
prompt: A caravan is stalled on the Glass Road’s edge, where stone turns to grit and every shadow looks like a thief. A wheel has shattered, water casks are leaking, and the roadwardens argue over tolls while the sun climbs. The captain’s eyes flick to you. “Help us move,” she says, “and you’ll have a place in the line. Refuse—and you’ll be dust behind it.”

outcomes.title: Guard the Water
outcomes.desc: Stand watch while they mend the axle—keep hands off the casks.

success.text: You pace the wagons with weapon ready. A would‑be thief tests you once; you answer once. After that, the caravan works in peace. The captain pays you in coin and water both.

fail.text: You catch the thief—too late. The scuffle spills water into the sand and leaves you bleeding besides. The caravan moves, but your season worsens.

outcomes.title: Map the Detour
outcomes.desc: Find a safer line through gullies and shade—save time, save water.

success.text: You study the land and the wind, then mark a route that avoids loose sand and dead ends. The caravan follows, and the captain calls you ‘useful’ with genuine respect—the kind that travels ahead of you.

fail.text: Your detour leads into heat shimmer and wasted miles. The casks run lower than they should, and everyone looks at you like you took their water personally.

outcomes.title: Carry a Hidden Parcel
outcomes.desc: Take a wrapped bundle that ‘isn’t yours’ and make sure it reaches the next oasis.

success.text: You accept the parcel without asking its name. That’s how this works. At the next stop, a hooded buyer meets you in shade and pays more than the bundle could ever be worth honestly.

fail.text: A roadwarden searches the wagons and finds the parcel on you. Their hand tightens on a writ as if it’s a weapon. You escape the moment—but the law remembers.

outcomes.title: Argue the Toll
outcomes.desc: Negotiate with the roadwardens—pay less, lose less time, keep faces intact.

success.text: You speak in the language of caravan law: water, time, and honor. The roadwardens back down just enough. The captain’s profit survives, and she puts your name on her safe list.

fail.text: You press too hard. The roadwardens make an example of you—extra fees, public scolding, and a reminder that power here belongs to those who write the rules.

outcomes.title: Share Shade and Bread
outcomes.desc: Spend your own food and calm the line—keep panic from turning into violence.

success.text: You pass water and bread with no sermon attached. People breathe easier. The captain sees the effect and nods. When the wagons roll again, you ride with a caravan that trusts you.

fail.text: You try to soothe a crowd that doesn’t want soothing. A shove becomes a brawl, and your kindness is trampled under boots. You still help—but it costs you.

name: Fate Knot I: The Keybearer’s Tea
prompt: In Gloambridge, a quiet scholar buys you tea you didn’t ask for and asks questions you can’t unhear. When the tavern empties, they set a small iron key on the table. “Greyvault is missing a page,” they say. “Not lost—taken. We retrieve what the world tries to forget. You can help… or you can pretend you never saw this.”

outcomes.title: Take the Retrieval
outcomes.desc: Accept the job the blunt way—go where it was taken and bring it back by force if needed.

success.text: You don’t ask for names. You ask for directions. The Keybearer gives them, and when you rise, you feel the path lock into place—dangerous, quiet work with long shadows.

fail.text: You step into a place you shouldn’t have and meet steel you weren’t expecting. You get out—but not clean, and not unmarked by the kind of work you’ve just chosen.

outcomes.title: Learn the Cipher
outcomes.desc: Ask for training instead—learn how the Collegium hides truth in plain sight.

success.text: You spend the night learning a new alphabet: marks that mean places, names that mean lies. The Keybearer nods at your progress. “Good,” they say. “Now you can read what others can’t.”

fail.text: The cipher refuses to sit in your head. Hours pass, ink smears, and you leave with more frustration than knowledge.

outcomes.title: Steal the Page
outcomes.desc: Skip retrieval. If the page exists, take it first and decide later who deserves it.

success.text: You smile, you nod, you walk out—and you do not come back empty-handed. Whether you return the page to Greyvault or sell it is a question for another season. For now, you have it, and that is power.

fail.text: You reach for the page and touch a trap instead—bells, shouts, boots on stairs. You escape with nothing but a new urgency behind your name.

outcomes.title: Petition for Access
outcomes.desc: Seek lawful entry—ask Greyvault for permission to work in its shadow.

success.text: You request a writ, not a favor. The Keybearer considers you like a locked door considers a key. At last, they offer an introduction—thin, cautious, but real. The Collegium doesn’t trust easily. You’ve begun anyway.

fail.text: Your request sounds like curiosity, and curiosity is the easiest thing to dismiss. The Keybearer’s smile is polite, which is to say: final.

outcomes.title: Leave It Buried
outcomes.desc: Refuse the key. Some truths aren’t worth the cost of knowing them.

success.text: You slide the key back. You won’t be owned by secrets you didn’t choose. The Keybearer doesn’t argue—only watches you go, as if committing your face to memory.

fail.text: You refuse, and the room feels colder for it. Later, you notice the same stranger twice on two different streets. It might be coincidence. It might be a mark.

name: Fate Knot I: The Night Market Token
prompt: On a street that isn’t there in daylight, lanterns burn low and voices stay lower. The Night Market measures people the way merchants measure cloth. A masked broker offers you a small bone token stamped with a veiled sigil. “One favor,” they say. “One door. One price—later.” You can feel the hook in the offer, and the lure.

outcomes.title: Enforce the Exchange
outcomes.desc: Take work as muscle—make sure a deal is honored without witnesses.

success.text: You escort a trembling buyer through alleys and ensure the seller doesn’t change terms mid‑stride. Coin lands in your palm. The broker nods like you’ve been weighed and found useful.

fail.text: The ‘simple exchange’ turns into a chase. Someone shouts for guards, and the Night Market evaporates behind you. You keep your skin, but the law keeps your description.

outcomes.title: Read the Fine Ink
outcomes.desc: Study the token’s contract language and refuse the trap you can see.

success.text: You ask for the terms in writing. The broker hesitates—then provides them. You spot the hook: a clause that would bind your heirs. You strike it, and the broker laughs softly. “You’ll do,” they admit.

fail.text: The terms are written in turns of phrase that mean one thing in daylight and another in shadow. You miss the shift. The broker’s smile says you’ve agreed to more than you intended.

outcomes.title: Take the Token
outcomes.desc: Accept the favor. Whatever it costs, you’ll pay it later—when you’re stronger.

success.text: You take the token and feel the moment click into place like a lock. The broker presses two fingers to their mask in salute. “Now you have a door,” they whisper. “Use it well.”

fail.text: The broker’s token is colder than it should be. Later, you notice people giving you space—not fear, not respect. Recognition. Whatever you accepted, it shows.

outcomes.title: Buy Protection
outcomes.desc: Trade coin and charm for a Night Market ‘safety’—a promise that cuts both ways.

success.text: You negotiate the price down and the obligations clearer. The broker agrees, then names the true cost: a future favor called in at a time of their choosing. Your name gains shadow‑weight in the city.

fail.text: You pay too much for too little. The broker smiles, pockets your coin, and offers a promise made of mist. When you realize it, you’re already short.

outcomes.title: Walk Away
outcomes.desc: Refuse the Night Market’s hook and leave before it learns your name.

success.text: You step back and shake your head. Some doors are traps that pretend to be opportunities. You leave with no favor and no leash—and that restraint earns you a quiet respect from the one person watching for it.

fail.text: You turn to go and a hand catches your sleeve—just long enough for the broker to see your face clearly. You leave, but you feel the market remember you anyway.

name: Fate Knot II: The Muster Offer
prompt: By now, your choices have consequences that arrive before you do. Friends have become obligations, rivals have become patterns, and a single decision can turn a nuisance into an enemy. At the capital, the muster grounds are muddy with practice and nerves. A captain you once impressed now offers you a place “above” the line. It’s the kind of offer that turns friends into rivals and rivals into knives. Your earlier choices have brought you to this crossroads. What you do now hardens into habit, and into enemies.

outcomes.title: Take Command
outcomes.desc: Step forward and accept the burden in public.

success.text: You take the captain’s clasp. The line steadies when you raise your hand, because they’ve seen you bleed before.

fail.text: You bark an order at the wrong moment. The line breaks, and so does the captain’s faith.

outcomes.title: Win Them in the Yard
outcomes.desc: Challenge the loudest skeptic. Let skill answer where words fail.

success.text: The bout ends with you standing and the doubter laughing through blood. Respect spreads faster than rumor.

fail.text: You lose on a slick patch of mud. The laughter is worse than the bruise.

outcomes.title: Refuse the Ladder
outcomes.desc: Decline without insult—choose peace over rank.

success.text: You refuse cleanly and offer a smaller help instead: training, supplies, an honest word. The captain nods. Others notice you didn’t scramble for the chair.

fail.text: You refuse, but it lands wrong—like cowardice, not principle. The offer turns into a story told at your expense.

outcomes.title: Take a Quiet Contract
outcomes.desc: There’s coin in fighting without banners. You accept the work that won’t be sung.

success.text: You are handed a route, a name, and a purse. The job is small… until it isn’t.

fail.text: The ‘quiet’ job is a trap. You escape, but the wrong people learn your face.

name: Fate Knot II: The Torch-Duel
prompt: By now, your choices have consequences that arrive before you do. Friends have become obligations, rivals have become patterns, and a single decision can turn a nuisance into an enemy. In a lakeside city, torches hiss over lake-fog. A sealed challenge arrives with no crest, just a time, a place, and a promise: “win, and the doors open; lose, and the rumors do.” You can feel the trap, and also the opportunity. Your earlier choices have brought you to this crossroads. What you do now hardens into habit, and into enemies.

outcomes.title: Meet Them Blade-to-Blade
outcomes.desc: If it’s a trap, you’ll spring it with steel.

success.text: The duel is brutal and fast. You leave a mark, and you take one. Later, a messenger finds you with an offer.

fail.text: You’re outplayed. Not beaten, “outplayed”. The point was never the blade; it was the witness.

outcomes.title: Rig the Ground
outcomes.desc: Stack the odds—one loose board, one dimmed torch, one friend in shadow.

success.text: A boot slips where it shouldn’t. Your opponent goes down hard, and you’re already moving before anyone can argue. You win—yet the win smells wrong.

fail.text: Your trick is spotted mid-bout. The crowd turns, the watch moves, and you run with the sound of 'cheat' at your back.

outcomes.title: Buy the Witness
outcomes.desc: Slip coin to the right tongues and make the story turn your way.

success.text: You buy a witness, then buy a second to confirm the first. By dawn the duel is 'settled' on paper, and the torches are only smoke.

fail.text: You pay for silence, but the coins are traced. The clerk laughs, and by noon you’re the name people spit when they say 'corrupt.'

outcomes.title: Walk Away
outcomes.desc: Refuse the game. Leave them their torches and their hunger.

success.text: You don’t show. The duel becomes someone else’s spectacle, and the trap snaps shut on empty air. You keep your skin and your name.

fail.text: You turn away, but they make it look like fear. The rumor runs faster than you do, and it costs you respect.

name: Fate Knot II: The Charred Page
prompt: By now, your choices have consequences that arrive before you do. Friends have become obligations, rivals have become patterns, and a single decision can turn a nuisance into an enemy. In a scholar's town, a courier brings you a bundle wrapped in oilcloth: a charred page, ink still faintly legible. The words could ruin a house, or save one. Either way, someone will bleed for them. Your earlier choices have brought you to this crossroads. What you do now hardens into habit, and into enemies.

outcomes.title: Preserve It Quietly
outcomes.desc: Seal the page away and copy it with care.

success.text: You make three copies: one for truth, one for advantage, one to vanish. It is not paranoia if it works.

fail.text: The ink smears; the meaning blurs. You keep the page, but lose what it could have been worth.

outcomes.title: Read It Aloud
outcomes.desc: Bring it to a public hall and let the words stand on their own.

success.text: The room changes shape as you speak. Some faces go pale; others go sharp. You have made enemies, and made yourself necessary.

fail.text: You are shouted down, called a forger, a schemer. Truth without backing is a story, nothing more.

outcomes.title: Trade It for Safety
outcomes.desc: You choose survival. A buyer will protect you, for a price.

success.text: A purse arrives. So does a warning: never speak of the page again. You nod. You lie.

fail.text: You hand it over—and realize too late you’ve sold to the people who wanted it buried. The 'protection' is a leash.

outcomes.title: Burn It Yourself
outcomes.desc: Destroy the evidence and keep only what you can remember.

success.text: You feed the page to the flame until it’s ash and nothing more. The truth survives only in your head—and that makes it yours.

fail.text: The fire draws eyes. Someone sees the ink as it curls and cries out. You leave fast, but not unseen.

name: Fate Knot II: The Forged Genealogy
prompt: By now, your choices have consequences that arrive before you do. Friends have become obligations, rivals have become patterns, and a single decision can turn a nuisance into an enemy. At a toll city, a broker offers you a commission: a genealogy that proves what someone wants proven. The ink will be beautiful. The consequences will be ugly. Your earlier choices have brought you to this crossroads. What you do now hardens into habit, and into enemies.

outcomes.title: Forge the Lineage
outcomes.desc: Write a bloodline that never was and make it look old as stone.

success.text: Your ink lies with perfect confidence. Seals are matched, dates are plausible, and the forged line slides into the record like it belongs.

fail.text: A real archivist reads the strokes and smiles. The forgery is exposed—and so are you.

outcomes.title: Blackmail the Broker
outcomes.desc: Corner the broker who ordered the forgery and name your price.

success.text: You don’t need the paper; you need the fear. The broker pays in favors and silence, and you walk away holding both.

fail.text: The broker is protected. Your threat becomes a confession, and the net tightens.

outcomes.title: Expose the Attempt
outcomes.desc: Turn the commission into a scandal.

success.text: You present the forgery as a threat to the city’s peace, not a clever trick. The broker flees. The court thanks you for “protecting the record,” and a magistrate owes you a quiet favor.

fail.text: Your accusation boomerangs. Suddenly you’re the one being asked for proof.

outcomes.title: Refuse and Leave
outcomes.desc: Refuse the game entirely and leave the hall before you’re implicated.

success.text: You close the folder without reading the last name. Whatever they’re building, you won’t be the brick. You leave with your hands clean.

fail.text: Someone notices you noticed. You leave, but a quiet mark follows you out of the room.

name: Fate Knot II: The Chalk Mark
prompt: By now, your choices have consequences that arrive before you do. Friends have become obligations, rivals have become patterns, and a single decision can turn a nuisance into an enemy. In a banking city, a night courier leaves a chalk mark on your door: three strokes, one circle. It means an account has been ‘opened’ in your name, one that can be paid only with secrets. Your earlier choices have brought you to this crossroads. What you do now hardens into habit, and into enemies.

outcomes.title: Steal the Ledger-Leaf
outcomes.desc: Break in, take the page, and erase your name from the account.

success.text: You find the ledger-leaf and tear it free. Names flake off the page as if they never existed—yours among them.

fail.text: You’re halfway out a window when the watch lantern hits your face. Someone shouts your name. Someone else writes it down.

outcomes.title: Pay in Names
outcomes.desc: Pay the debt the old way—by giving them someone else.

success.text: You trade names like coin. The chalk circle on your door is wiped away by morning—but you can’t forget who you sold.

fail.text: Your names aren’t enough. They want “more”, and they know you can get it.

outcomes.title: Turn the Trap
outcomes.desc: Set a counter-ambush: if someone wants to own you, you’ll own them first.

success.text: The alley fight is short and ugly. You take a ring and a seal from the wrong hand, and now you have options.

fail.text: They were ready. You wake up with bruises and a message carved into the wall: “Next time, die.”.

outcomes.title: Disappear
outcomes.desc: Leave nothing behind but an empty room and a cold hearth.

success.text: You vanish before the collectors arrive. New clothes, new road, new story. The account stays open—but it can’t find you tonight.

fail.text: You flee, but the mark was already shared. A door closes ahead of you, and the chase begins.

name: Fate Knot II: The Fisherman’s Plea
prompt: By now, your choices have consequences that arrive before you do. Friends have become obligations, rivals have become patterns, and a single decision can turn a nuisance into an enemy. On the storm coast, a fisherman begs you to find his child, taken, he says, by ‘respectable’ men. You can treat it as coin work… or as something else. Your earlier choices have brought you to this crossroads. What you do now hardens into habit, and into enemies.

outcomes.title: Find the Child
outcomes.desc: Track quietly. Pay attention. Hurt only the guilty.

success.text: You bring the child back alive. The grateful tears feel like a debt you’ll never be able to spend.

fail.text: You’re too late. You learn the truth anyway, and the truth is heavier than any body.

outcomes.title: Sell the Lead
outcomes.desc: You have a name and a place. Someone will pay for that.

success.text: You sell the information and tell yourself the buyer is ‘better suited’ to act.

fail.text: The buyer turns out to be part of the problem. You’ve sold a child twice.

outcomes.title: Burn the Trail
outcomes.desc: Destroy clues and witnesses so no one can follow—especially not you.

success.text: You salt the footprints, burn the scrap of cloth, and pay a dockhand to forget the boat. The trail dies—and with it, the chance of the truth.

fail.text: Fire draws attention. Someone sees you tampering, and they assume the worst. The watch comes asking.

outcomes.title: Take Them Yourself
outcomes.desc: Turn hunter into captor—take the child for leverage.

success.text: You grab the child before the 'respectable' men return and vanish into the alleys. Leverage is leverage. The fisherman’s eyes haunt you as you count the coins.

fail.text: You reach for the child and find steel instead. The men were waiting. You escape wounded, with blood in your mouth and witnesses behind you.

name: Fate Knot II: The Petition Chamber
prompt: By now, your choices have consequences that arrive before you do. Friends have become obligations, rivals have become patterns, and a single decision can turn a nuisance into an enemy. In the capital, you’re finally allowed into the waiting chamber where decisions are made in whispers. A rival smiles at you like a knife. A clerk slides forward a petition with your name already written on it. Your earlier choices have brought you to this crossroads. What you do now hardens into habit, and into enemies.

outcomes.title: Argue the Petition
outcomes.desc: Make your case so well it becomes the court’s case.

success.text: You speak plainly. The room shifts. People who expected you to beg find you negotiating instead.

fail.text: Your rival interrupts at the perfect moment. Your argument collapses in laughter.

outcomes.title: Offer a Compromise
outcomes.desc: Give them a deal they can accept without losing face.

success.text: A compromise is signed. You win less than you wanted, but more than you had.

fail.text: They agree in the room and undo it in the hallway. You learn the difference between words and power.

outcomes.title: Call for a Public Hearing
outcomes.desc: If whispers are poison, you’ll force daylight.

success.text: The public loves clarity. You make the issue simple and the rival looks complicated, and guilty.

fail.text: The crowd turns on you. Public halls are honest only about what they enjoy.

outcomes.title: Withdraw Gracefully
outcomes.desc: Step away before the chamber turns you into a tool.

success.text: You bow, withdraw, and refuse to be bait. You lose the day’s victory, but you keep your leverage—and your breath.

fail.text: You try to withdraw, but they read it as defeat. A rival claims the moment, and the room follows them.

name: Fate Knot II: The Misplaced File
prompt: By now, your choices have consequences that arrive before you do. Friends have become obligations, rivals have become patterns, and a single decision can turn a nuisance into an enemy. In a banking city, a contract court clerk ‘misplaces’ a file on your desk. Inside are signatures, debts, and the kind of small scandal that ruins people who can’t afford it. You can close the file… or you can use it. Your earlier choices have brought you to this crossroads. What you do now hardens into habit, and into enemies.

outcomes.title: Advantage the Debts
outcomes.desc: Use the scandal like a crowbar—pry favors loose while you can.

success.text: You squeeze the right debtor and the right creditor. Favors change hands. So do grudges.

fail.text: You push too hard. The file vanishes, and the wrong people decide you’ve been reading it.

outcomes.title: Sell the File
outcomes.desc: Sell the scandal to someone who will pay—and never admit it.

success.text: A messenger takes the file and leaves a heavy purse. You don’t ask where it’s going. You already know.

fail.text: Your buyer is a trap. The purse is light, the witnesses are many, and your name is added to someone’s list.

outcomes.title: Bury It
outcomes.desc: Destroy the evidence and take the gratitude of those you saved.

success.text: You burn the file. Later, someone you spared offers you a favor that feels like a seed in good soil.

fail.text: You try to destroy it, but the clerk has copies. Your mercy becomes their weapon.

outcomes.title: Blame the Clerk
outcomes.desc: Put the sin on the clerk and walk away as the offended party.

success.text: You make it public, loud, and righteous. The clerk is crushed—yet the room remembers how easily you pointed the finger.

fail.text: The clerk has friends. Your accusation rebounds, and you’re the one who looks guilty.

name: Fate Knot II: The Quarantine Gate
prompt: By now, your choices have consequences that arrive before you do. Friends have become obligations, rivals have become patterns, and a single decision can turn a nuisance into an enemy. A quarantine cordon rises outside a hospice-abbey. The sick beg to pass. The healthy beg you to keep the gate shut. You are asked to decide, and no answer is clean. Your earlier choices have brought you to this crossroads. What you do now hardens into habit, and into enemies.

outcomes.title: Hold the Line
outcomes.desc: Keep the cordon firm. Mercy can be containment.

success.text: You withstand pleading, threats, and grief. The disease slows. The hatred does not.

fail.text: The crowd surges. The line breaks. The cordon becomes a brawl, and the sickness spreads anyway.

outcomes.title: Open a Mercy Gate
outcomes.desc: Let the worst cases in, with rules and watchers.

success.text: You create order out of panic: lists, beds, and strict hands. Some lives are saved because you made room.

fail.text: You open the gate and lose control. The ward fills beyond capacity; the dead begin to stack.

outcomes.title: Smuggle a Family Through
