fail.text: The shortcut in Black Mantle Offices snaps shut behind you. Attention follows—quiet at first, then official.

name: The Wolf Court—Act II
prompt: You keep to the edges and let the court’s gaze slide past you. In High Valewyr, absence is read as a statement.

outcomes.title: Keep to Old Quays
outcomes.desc: Take the official route: petitions, etiquette, and the proper fees. It’s slower, but defensible.

success.text: You keep your footing in Old Quays. In Crown, rules are a weapon when you grip them first.

fail.text: You reach for the rules in Old Quays, but someone else wrote them. The room notes the strain.

outcomes.title: Lean on Old Quays
outcomes.desc: Use back channels: bribes, favors, forged access, or whispered threats. It’s faster, but it leaves a trail.

success.text: You take the short path through Old Quays and come out ahead—at the price of a few new eyes on you.

fail.text: The shortcut in Old Quays snaps shut behind you. Attention follows—quiet at first, then official.

name: The Wolf Court—Act III
prompt: In High Valewyr, one wrong word can turn a friend into a rival. Your approach has carried you this far. Now comes the decisive move: win cleanly inside court custom, or win dirty and accept the scandal.

outcomes.title: Win by protocol
outcomes.desc: Use etiquette, seating, and lawful pressure. If you win, the court has to acknowledge it.

success.text: You keep it clean and make it hard to dispute. You come away with more renown and more influence. The Crown looks on you more favorably.

fail.text: You try to win cleanly, but the institution stalls you and demands more than you can pay.

outcomes.title: Weaponize whispers
outcomes.desc: Leak what hurts, press what shames, and make resistance too costly.

success.text: You win, but it leaves scorch marks. You come away with more secrets. The Crown looks on you more favorably.

fail.text: You reach for leverage and it snaps back. The people you tried to hurt learn your name. You leave Wounded, blood soaking your clothes.

fail.text: Your attempt at leverage backfires. Someone decides you’re the kind of person who can’t be trusted with promises.

outcomes.title: Refuse the Stone

success.text: You take the warning seriously and prepare for consequences. Even if the oath comes due, you won’t be surprised.

fail.text: You prepare in the wrong direction. When the knock finally comes, you’re ready for the wrong threat.

name: Pilgrimage of Ash — The Ash-Bearers
prompt: A Synod procession comes down the road: masked Hospitallers, Vigilants at the flank, and Candlekeepers carrying a ledger of the dead. In the center, a shallow basin holds grey ash—burnt linens from the last plague. They’re bound for the quarantine wall, and they need hands they can trust, even for a single night.

outcomes.title: Walk With Them
outcomes.desc: Join the procession and carry ash through the gate.

success.text: You take your place in the line. The basin is light, but the stares are heavy; beyond the quarantine wall, every step is witnessed.

fail.text: A Vigilant bars your way—too many strangers, too few masks. You’re turned back with sharp words and sharper eyes.

outcomes.title: Keep Your Distance
outcomes.desc: Watch from the edge; learn before you commit.

success.text: You keep to the outskirts, listening to prayers and arguments alike. You learn which names make the Candlekeepers flinch.

fail.text: You linger too long. Someone mistakes you for a looter or a spy, and you’re chased off before you can learn more.

outcomes.title: Take Their Map
outcomes.desc: Acquire the smudged route-map of gates and alleys.

success.text: A runner slips you a map with wax marks and coded knocks. It’s not mercy, but it is a way in—and a way out.

fail.text: Your fingers brush the map and a hand clamps down hard. ‘Thief,’ someone hisses, loud enough to carry.

outcomes.title: Carry the Ledger
outcomes.desc: Help a Candlekeeper copy the dead list by lantern light.

success.text: You steady the ledger while names are read through cloth masks. Ink becomes a kind of prayer: imperfect, but necessary.

fail.text: Your pen blots and a line goes crooked. The Candlekeeper snatches the book back—no room for mistakes when names decide inheritances.

name: Pilgrimage of Ash — Act II: The Temptation to Leave
prompt: Before dawn, you consider taking the road and letting Larkhallow’s grief fade behind you. A Hospitaller stops you at the gate. “Leaving? Then carry ash to the next marker. Staying? Then help us keep the wall from breaking.”

outcomes.title: Take the Assigned Road
outcomes.desc: Take the official route: petitions, etiquette, and the proper fees. It’s slower, but defensible.

success.text: You do the solemn work: marked doors, brief prayers, grey smears left like witness. It isn’t glorious, but it’s clear.

fail.text: A guard questions you, your papers don’t satisfy, and the delay makes the Hospitallers stare at you like a liability.

outcomes.title: Slip Out Before Dawn
outcomes.desc: Use back channels: bribes, favors, forged access, or whispered threats. It’s faster, but it leaves a trail.

success.text: You slip away into the dark and keep your own counsel. Later, you hear what happened at the wall and realize how close you were to being part of it.

fail.text: You’re seen at the wrong moment. Someone assumes you’re abandoning duty, and the word spreads faster than you can outrun it.

name: Pilgrimage of Ash — Act II: The Quarantine Gate
prompt: At the outer wall of Verdemont Abbey, Hospitallers hold the line while Vigilants enforce it. Families plead to enter. Families plead to leave. The air tastes of fear and smoke.

outcomes.title: Hold the Line
outcomes.desc: Take the official route: petitions, etiquette, and the proper fees. It’s slower, but defensible.

success.text: You repeat the rules until they sound like scripture. The line holds, the ward stays calmer, and the Vigilants mark you as steady.

fail.text: A desperate shove turns into a crush. You stop it—barely—but the crowd remembers the fear more than the order.

outcomes.title: Slip Inside
outcomes.desc: Use back channels: bribes, favors, forged access, or whispered threats. It’s faster, but it leaves a trail.

success.text: You find a postern gate and a novice willing to look away. Inside, you see what the rules are hiding—and what they’re failing to stop.

fail.text: A Vigilant catches your movement and the accusation is instant: “Smuggler.” Even if it’s untrue, it sticks.

name: Pilgrimage of Ash — Act II: The Smudged Map
prompt: A runner offers you a stolen quarantine map—gates, alley knocks, which guards drink, which ones pray. “If you want in without being seen, this is how.”

outcomes.title: Refuse the Shortcut
outcomes.desc: Take the official route: petitions, etiquette, and the proper fees. It’s slower, but defensible.

success.text: You hand the map to a Hospitaller and take the lawful route. Trust is slow to earn in plague times—and quick to spend.

fail.text: The runner vanishes. Later, someone asks why you were speaking with them at all, and you have no answer that sounds innocent.

outcomes.title: Use the Back Ways
outcomes.desc: Use back channels: bribes, favors, forged access, or whispered threats. It’s faster, but it leaves a trail.

success.text: You move like a rumor, slipping past the gate. The map is dirty, but it works—and now it’s yours.

fail.text: A coded knock is answered by the wrong person. A lantern swings toward you, and you run with breath burning in your throat.

name: Pilgrimage of Ash — Act II: The Ledger
prompt: At Candlekeeper Hall, a weary scribe pushes a fresh page toward you. “Copy these names before dawn. The gate captain won’t wait, and the dead deserve to be counted.”

outcomes.title: Copy the Names Cleanly
outcomes.desc: Take the official route: petitions, etiquette, and the proper fees. It’s slower, but defensible.

success.text: You copy name after name until your wrist aches. When the page is finished, the Candlekeeper seals it with a tired nod.

fail.text: Your hand cramps, the lines blur, and a name slips out of place. The Candlekeeper crosses it out grimly—someone will notice.

outcomes.title: Alter a Line Quietly
outcomes.desc: Use back channels: bribes, favors, forged access, or whispered threats. It’s faster, but it leaves a trail.

success.text: You change a single line and the page looks innocent. In plague years, ink can save a family…or ruin one.

fail.text: Wax smears under your thumb and the alteration shows. The Candlekeeper’s eyes go flat, and you leave with fear in your throat.

name: Pilgrimage of Ash — Act III: The Refusal
prompt: On the road to Quarantine Wall, mercy and survival keep trading places. You’re at the turning point. Now choose: carry the pilgrimage in the open, or twist it into leverage.

outcomes.title: Carry it as mercy
outcomes.desc: Follow the Synod’s rites and keep your hands clean. Let mercy be your argument.

success.text: You keep it clean and make it hard to dispute. You come away with more renown. The Verdant Synod looks on you more favorably.

fail.text: You try to win cleanly, but the institution stalls you and demands more than you can pay.

outcomes.title: Exploit the pilgrimage
outcomes.desc: Use the road’s suffering as leverage. Win by turning pity into pressure.

success.text: You win, but it leaves scorch marks. You come away with more secrets. The Verdant Synod takes note—and not kindly.

fail.text: You reach for leverage and it snaps back. The people you tried to hurt learn your name. You leave Disgraced, and people remember your misstep.

name: Courtship — First Impressions
prompt: You meet someone who makes the room feel sharper—like choices matter more when they’re watching. The first conversation is small, but it leaves a mark. Courtship begins like that: a glance, a laugh, and the sudden risk of hoping.

outcomes.title: Make a gentle introduction
outcomes.desc: Be sincere. Let your reputation do the heavy lifting.

success.text: You introduce yourself with steady confidence. The first impression feels like a door opening—not wide, but enough.

fail.text: You come on too strong or too awkward. The moment doesn’t break, but it bends the wrong way.

outcomes.title: Win them with wit
outcomes.desc: Turn the moment into a shared joke they’ll want to remember.

success.text: You keep it light and let curiosity do the work. It’s easier to invite someone closer than to drag them there.

fail.text: You play it too safe. The conversation ends politely, and you realize you didn’t actually connect.

outcomes.title: Be boldly direct
outcomes.desc: Name your interest plainly and accept the risk of rejection.

success.text: You find a shared thread—humor, duty, a familiar story. They look at you like you might be worth a second talk.

fail.text: You reach for common ground and grab the wrong thing. The misread lingers like a sour note.

outcomes.title: Let mystery lead
outcomes.desc: Keep details close; invite curiosity instead of comfort.

success.text: You listen more than you speak, and you remember details others miss. That kind of attention feels rare—and valuable.

fail.text: You listen, but your focus shows. It reads less like interest and more like appraisal.

name: Courtship—Act II
prompt: You choose patience over spectacle. In Widow’s Market, even softness can be a kind of steel—if you know when to show it.

outcomes.title: Chaperoned Meeting
outcomes.desc: Take the official route: petitions, etiquette, and the proper fees. It’s slower, but defensible.

success.text: The meeting is small, proper, and unexpectedly warm. You leave with a promise that feels like it can last.

fail.text: Too many eyes, too many rules. The warmth cools into courtesy, and courtesy into distance. The match slips away.

outcomes.title: Quiet Letters
outcomes.desc: Use back channels: bribes, favors, forged access, or whispered threats. It’s faster, but it leaves a trail.

success.text: Your letters find their mark. The words are plain—but the risk makes them feel truer.

fail.text: A private note becomes public in the worst way. The prospect withdraws, and you are left holding your own handwriting.

name: Courtship—Act II
prompt: You court through timing and laughter. In High Valewyr, every joke is a test: of wit, of taste, of who gets to laugh.

outcomes.title: Public Banter
outcomes.desc: Take the official route: petitions, etiquette, and the proper fees. It’s slower, but defensible.

success.text: You make them laugh without making them small. In the afterglow, agreement comes easier than expected.

fail.text: The laughter turns sideways. Someone repeats your words without the charm. What felt light becomes a stain.

outcomes.title: Barbed Joke
outcomes.desc: Use back channels: bribes, favors, forged access, or whispered threats. It’s faster, but it leaves a trail.

success.text: The joke lands like a dagger in velvet. Rivals flinch; your prospect doesn’t look away.

fail.text: The line you walk snaps. The joke becomes cruelty in someone else’s mouth, and the match collapses under the noise.

name: Courtship—Act II
prompt: You make your intent unmistakable. In the Stag Court, certainty draws eyes—and invites someone to challenge it.

outcomes.title: Declare Intent
outcomes.desc: Take the official route: petitions, etiquette, and the proper fees. It’s slower, but defensible.

success.text: You speak your intent and hold the gaze. The witnesses remember who did not blink.

fail.text: Certainty reads as arrogance to the wrong person. The room chooses to interpret you unkindly—and the door closes.

outcomes.title: Prove Worth
outcomes.desc: Use back channels: bribes, favors, forged access, or whispered threats. It’s faster, but it leaves a trail.

success.text: You win a small victory in public view. It is not gentle… but it is convincing.

fail.text: Your deed draws the wrong sort of attention. Instead of admiration, you earn alarm—and a clean refusal.

name: Courtship—Act II
prompt: You let rumor do half the work. In Thornmere, absence can be bait… but the wrong kind of attention still bites.

outcomes.title: Measured Distance
outcomes.desc: Take the official route: petitions, etiquette, and the proper fees. It’s slower, but defensible.

success.text: You give just enough to invite pursuit, not enough to invite certainty. Curiosity turns into commitment.

fail.text: You wait for them to come closer, but they decide the distance is safer. Rumor stops being invitation and becomes warning.

outcomes.title: Vanishing Act
outcomes.desc: Use back channels: bribes, favors, forged access, or whispered threats. It’s faster, but it leaves a trail.

success.text: You vanish at the perfect moment. By the time they find you again, the chase has become the story.

fail.text: Your disappearance reads as deceit, not allure. The chase ends in resentment, and the house quietly turns away.

name: Courtship—Act III
prompt: In High Valewyr, courtship stops being flirtation the moment other people start counting dowries and seats. You’re at the moment of commitment. Now choose: make it honorable and public, or force the outcome with leverage and risk.

outcomes.title: Speak vows before witnesses
outcomes.desc: Make the commitment public and defensible—no whispered rival can undo it easily.

success.text: You keep it clean and make it hard to dispute. You come away with more influence. The Crown looks on you more favorably.

fail.text: You try to win cleanly, but the institution stalls you and demands more than you can pay.

outcomes.title: Force the match
outcomes.desc: Use leverage—secrets, favors, or pressure—to secure the outcome quickly.

success.text: You win, but it leaves scorch marks. You come away with more secrets. The Crown takes note—and not kindly.

fail.text: You reach for leverage and it snaps back. The people you tried to hurt learn your name. You leave Disgraced, and people remember your misstep.

name: First Quarrel, First Reputation
prompt: A shouting match in a yard turns into fists. Someone calls your name like it’s a challenge and a promise.

outcomes.title: Step In
outcomes.desc: End it fast—one clean strike and a hard stare.

success.text: You plant your feet, drive in, and the brawl breaks around you. People remember who stopped it—and how.

fail.text: You misjudge the swing and take a hit you’ll feel tomorrow. The crowd cheers anyway—cruelly.

outcomes.title: Call Witness
outcomes.desc: Invoke the rules—public shame is a leash.

success.text: You name names, point to onlookers, and make it a matter of honor. The loudest mouths go quiet.

fail.text: You try to play judge and the yard decides you’re prey. Laughter follows you out.

outcomes.title: Slip Away
outcomes.desc: Leave before it’s your problem—and your bruise.

success.text: You melt into doorways and alley shade. You learn who started it, and why.

fail.text: You’re seen ducking out with a grin that looks guilty. Someone later swears you threw the first punch.

name: An Unasked Errand
prompt: A minor patron corners you with a smile too practiced for kindness. “A message. A parcel. Nothing dangerous.”

outcomes.title: Do It Clean
outcomes.desc: Carry the parcel openly and keep your story straight.

success.text: You deliver it without theatrics. The patron’s smile sharpens—approval, or ownership.

fail.text: The stops take longer than promised. By nightfall you’re worn thin and still watched.

outcomes.title: Peek Inside
outcomes.desc: Learn what you’re really carrying before you’re blamed for it.

success.text: It’s not poison or gold—it’s words. Names. Debts. You close it again, knowing more than you should.

fail.text: A seal cracks. A letter tears. When it arrives, it looks tampered—and so do you.

outcomes.title: Make It Costly
outcomes.desc: Negotiate payment or protection up front.

success.text: You name your price calmly. The patron pays—tight-lipped—and you leave with coin and leverage.

fail.text: They don’t pay. They threaten. And now the errand feels like a test you failed in public.

name: Caravan Season
prompt: A caravan master needs bodies—guards, clerks, even someone to keep the cooking pot from walking off.

outcomes.title: Sign On as Guard
outcomes.desc: Take the spear and the long miles.

success.text: You walk point, sleep light, and earn your pay the hard way. The master counts you as reliable.

fail.text: A road scuffle leaves you bleeding and angry. You still get paid—less than promised.

outcomes.title: Work the Ledger
outcomes.desc: Keep tallies, watch hands, and catch the quiet thefts.

success.text: Your numbers are clean. The master likes clean numbers, and offers you a letter of reference.

fail.text: A missing crate lands on your page. Whether it’s your fault or not, it stains your name.

outcomes.title: Ride as Shadow
outcomes.desc: Travel unofficially—use the caravan as cover.

success.text: You keep to the edges and learn routes, tolls, and who can be bribed. Knowledge worth more than wages.

fail.text: Someone spots you where you shouldn’t be. The master’s men start asking questions with hands on hilts.

name: A Reckless Wager
prompt: A dice circle forms in lantern light. The pot is small, but the attention is not.

outcomes.title: Play Straight
outcomes.desc: Win or lose without tricks—let luck do its work.

success.text: Luck favors you just enough. You scoop coin and a few impressed looks.

fail.text: Luck turns. You pay what you owe and feel the hook of obligation.

outcomes.title: Cheat Quietly
outcomes.desc: Palm a die, mark a face—nothing flashy.

success.text: You win twice: coin in hand, and a new secret about who’s watching the table.

fail.text: A hand clamps your wrist mid-flick. The circle goes cold. Someone whispers ‘thief.’.

outcomes.title: Flip the Crowd
outcomes.desc: Turn the game into a performance and walk away richer.

success.text: You make them laugh, then you make them bet on you. When you leave, you leave admired.

fail.text: Your brag lands wrong. The crowd decides you’re more mouth than worth, and the insult sticks.

name: An Apprentice’s Misstep
prompt: A mentor’s book goes missing for a breath—long enough for someone to notice. Eyes turn to you, then away, then back again.

outcomes.title: Find the Book
outcomes.desc: Track it down before blame hardens into fact.

success.text: You follow smudged ink and nervous glances to a hidden shelf. You return the book without theatrics.

fail.text: You search too openly. The mentor’s patience thins, and your usefulness is questioned aloud.

outcomes.title: Take the Blame
outcomes.desc: Cover for someone else—because you owe them, or because it’s safer.

success.text: You accept the scolding and keep the peace. Someone remembers the mercy, quietly.

fail.text: You wear the fault too well. The mentor begins to expect it from you.

outcomes.title: Plant a Trail
outcomes.desc: Make it look like someone else’s theft without saying it aloud.

success.text: A scrap of cloth, a smear of wax—enough to redirect suspicion. You learn how easy ‘truth’ is to arrange.

fail.text: Your planted clue is too neat. A sharper mind notices the hand behind it.

name: Tryouts at the Lists
prompt: A local lord’s men drill in the dirt by the lists. A sergeant points at you. “You. Show me what you’ve got.”

outcomes.title: Show Steel
outcomes.desc: Give them strength and clean form.

success.text: Your strikes ring true. The sergeant grunts approval and marks your name for future work.

fail.text: A bad parry jars your arm and draws blood. The sergeant’s smile says, ‘Not yet.’.

outcomes.title: Show Discipline
outcomes.desc: Outlast everyone. No flourish—only grit.

success.text: You keep moving long after others flag. Someone tosses you a ration and a nod.

fail.text: You push too far. Your legs wobble, and the world narrows to breath and pride.

outcomes.title: Talk Your Way In
outcomes.desc: Convince them you’re worth training even if your form isn’t.

success.text: You speak with humility and promise. The sergeant likes recruits who know their place and their hunger.

fail.text: Your words come out wrong—too eager, too proud. Laughter becomes a barrier.

name: A Moonlit Promise
prompt: A flirtation turns serious under lantern light. Someone asks for a promise you’re not sure you can keep.

outcomes.title: Promise Publicly
outcomes.desc: Make it real by letting others hear it.

success.text: You speak clearly. A few smiles turn approving, and a few turn calculating. That’s court, even in a tavern.

fail.text: Your words stumble. The promise sounds like a joke, and the sting lasts.

outcomes.title: Promise Quietly
outcomes.desc: Keep it between two people—no witnesses, no leverage.

success.text: The moment stays private. It feels safer—until you realize private promises can still bind.

fail.text: You hesitate too long. The other person reads it as rejection and turns away.

outcomes.title: Deflect with Wit
outcomes.desc: Turn the tension into laughter and keep your options.

success.text: You charm your way out without cruelty. The room likes you, even if one person doesn’t.

fail.text: Your joke cuts deeper than intended. Someone takes offense on another’s behalf.

name: The Bridge Dare
prompt: At night, friends dare each other to cross an old bridge where boards creak like teeth. It’s childish—until it isn’t.

outcomes.title: Cross First
outcomes.desc: Lead from the front and make fear look small.

success.text: You step light and steady. When you reach the far side, the cheering feels like a crown.

fail.text: A board breaks. You catch yourself—mostly. The bruise blooms as laughter dies.

outcomes.title: Inspect It
outcomes.desc: Look for weak boards and safe footing before you commit.

success.text: You find a safer line and guide the others across. Someone hands you a drink like thanks.

fail.text: You take too long. The night chills you through, and the group grows impatient.

outcomes.title: Stage a Scare
outcomes.desc: Make it memorable—use shadows to spook them and look brave.

success.text: You time the scare perfectly. In the chaos you learn who clings to whom—and who lies when frightened.

fail.text: Someone slips because of you. The group’s anger is colder than the river below.

name: Upkeep Comes Due
prompt: A steward lays out accounts: tools worn out, favors owed, mouths fed. Adulthood is often a bill with your name on it.

outcomes.title: Pay in Coin
outcomes.desc: Settle the balance and keep your dignity intact.

success.text: You pay the costs and buy yourself quiet—at least for now.

fail.text: You pay and still feel the bite. It leaves you short and resentful.

outcomes.title: Negotiate Terms
outcomes.desc: Turn one harsh demand into three softer ones.

success.text: You spread the burden without looking weak. People accept what feels orderly.

fail.text: The room hears desperation behind your calm. Someone smiles like they’ve learned your price.

outcomes.title: Cook the Books
outcomes.desc: Make the numbers lie just enough to breathe.

success.text: The figures balance. You buy time—and a secret that could ruin you if spoken.

fail.text: An error, a scratch, a second set of eyes. Someone begins to ask careful questions.

name: The Collector Knocks
prompt: A debt collector waits outside your door with polite menace and a paper that claims you promised more than you remember.

outcomes.title: Settle Quietly
outcomes.desc: Pay now and deny them the spectacle.

success.text: You pay to make them vanish. The street stays calm; your purse does not.

fail.text: You pay and still get threatened. The collector leaves smiling, like it was a lesson.

outcomes.title: Challenge the Paper
outcomes.desc: Find the flaw in the claim and make it stick.

success.text: You point to the error, the wrong seal, the missing witness. The collector retreats—angry, but checked.

fail.text: Your argument is good, but not enough. The collector marks you as ‘difficult’ and raises the pressure.

outcomes.title: Turn the Threat
outcomes.desc: Give them a reason to leave you alone.

success.text: You learn who sent them and why. That knowledge is leverage, even if it’s dirty leverage.

fail.text: You push too hard. The collector’s smile drops, and the next visit won’t be polite.

name: Smoke in the Rafters
prompt: A small fire in a workshop or kitchen threatens to become a bigger one. Everyone looks to you like you’re supposed to know what to do.

outcomes.title: Stamp It Out
outcomes.desc: Get hands dirty. Save the place.

success.text: You haul water, shove burning beams aside, and force the fire to give ground. People call it bravery.

fail.text: Heat bites you. You win, but pay in skin and pain.

outcomes.title: Direct the Bucket Line
outcomes.desc: Bark orders that make sense and keep panic from spreading.

success.text: You make the chaos orderly. When it’s over, someone offers you responsibility you didn’t ask for.

fail.text: You shout and no one listens. The fire shrinks, but the embarrassment grows.

outcomes.title: Salvage the Valuable
outcomes.desc: If you can’t save it all, save what matters.

success.text: You pull the strongbox, the contracts, the good tools. Later, you can rebuild.

fail.text: Someone sees what you saved—and what you didn’t. Accusations come fast in smoke.

name: A Contract in Silk
prompt: A matchmaker or family envoy floats a proposal: marriage, partnership, or a pact dressed up as romance.

outcomes.title: Hear Them Out
outcomes.desc: Listen for the real terms behind the poetry.

success.text: You catch the hidden clauses and ask the right questions. The envoy looks impressed—and wary.

fail.text: The discussion drags into the night. You leave with a headache and no certainty.

outcomes.title: Set Your Price
outcomes.desc: Name what you want—land, title, protection, freedom.

success.text: You don’t beg. You bargain. The envoy can’t ignore you after that.

fail.text: You sound greedy. Even if you aren’t, the rumor is enough to sour talks.

outcomes.title: Play Both Sides
outcomes.desc: Use the offer to squeeze someone else quietly.

success.text: You turn whispers into leverage. Everyone wants you—no one trusts you. That’s power, in its way.

fail.text: A message goes to the wrong person. Now it looks like you’re scheming for sport.

name: A Quiet Promotion
prompt: Someone senior offers you a step up—more authority, more scrutiny, more people eager to see you fail.

outcomes.title: Accept Openly
outcomes.desc: Take the role and let the room adjust.

success.text: You accept without apology. The work is heavier, but doors open a fraction wider.

fail.text: Your first day is a parade of tests. You stumble once, and the room stores it away.

outcomes.title: Negotiate Boundaries
outcomes.desc: Agree—on your terms.

success.text: You add clauses, responsibilities, protections. It becomes harder to exploit you without paying for it.

fail.text: Your demands sound like threats. Someone decides you’re ‘difficult’ and starts keeping notes.

outcomes.title: Take It and Scheme
outcomes.desc: Smile, nod, and immediately start shoring up your flank.

success.text: You map rivalries before they map you. When the knives come out, yours are already sharp.

fail.text: You sleep light, speak carefully, and wear yourself thin trying to see every angle.

name: A Missing Shipment
prompt: Goods vanish between two towns. Everyone swears they never touched it. Someone asks you to make the loss ‘make sense.’

outcomes.title: Track the Route
outcomes.desc: Follow the road and find the weak point.

success.text: You find the ambush spot, the broken wheel ruts, the discarded rope. The culprit isn’t clever—just bold.

fail.text: You push into brush and take a cut for it. The trail goes cold with your blood on it.

outcomes.title: Lean on Witnesses
outcomes.desc: Get stories, compare lies, find the seam.

success.text: You ask the right questions. Two people tell the same lie, and that’s as good as confession.

fail.text: You accuse too early. Now they hate you and shut their mouths.

outcomes.title: Cut a Deal with Thieves
outcomes.desc: Recover what you can by paying the people who took it.

success.text: You get half the goods back and a name to hold over someone later. Dirty work, useful results.

fail.text: The thieves take your coin and leave you with nothing but suspicion clinging to you.

name: The Public Feast
prompt: A feast is thrown for someone else’s victory, but there’s always room for you to gain—or lose—standing.

outcomes.title: Toast the Host
outcomes.desc: Say the right words and let others repeat them.

success.text: Your toast lands clean. You leave the table with your name spoken warmly.

fail.text: Your toast sounds like flattery, or threat. Either way, it turns sour.

outcomes.title: Read the Room
outcomes.desc: Learn who hates who before you pick a side.

success.text: You catch glances, pauses, and the hush before a name is said. A feast is a map if you know how to read it.

fail.text: You watch too hard and miss the moment to act. By night’s end you feel drained and behind.

outcomes.title: Start a Rumor
outcomes.desc: Use music and wine to loosen tongues and steer them.

success.text: A rumor takes, like a spark in dry straw. Tomorrow someone will swear they heard it from someone else.

fail.text: The rumor circles back to you too fast. Someone decides you’re dangerous.

name: Rain Through the Roof
prompt: A storm chews through shingles and canvas alike. If you don’t act, you’ll lose supplies—or worse, someone’s trust.

outcomes.title: Fix It Yourself
outcomes.desc: Climb up, hammer down, get it done.

success.text: You patch the worst of it. By morning the bedding is damp, not ruined.

fail.text: A slip and a scrape. You still finish the job, bleeding into the rain.

outcomes.title: Organize Repairs
outcomes.desc: Find hands, assign tasks, keep panic from turning into loss.

success.text: You turn complaints into labor. The storm passes with fewer losses than expected.

fail.text: People drag their feet. Water wins. You lose more than you can replace quickly.

outcomes.title: Secure the Essentials
outcomes.desc: Save what matters most and accept the rest.

success.text: You hide the important items where water can’t reach. Later, you look prepared—maybe too prepared.

fail.text: Someone notices you saving the ‘right’ things first. The look they give you is not friendly.

name: An Old Face, New Trouble
prompt: Someone you knew in youth returns with a different title and a familiar grin. They remember favors you hoped time would bury.

outcomes.title: Pay the Favor
outcomes.desc: Settle the old debt and keep peace.

success.text: You do what’s asked. It costs, but it closes a door that could’ve stayed open in the worst way.

fail.text: You try to settle it cheaply. The old friend doesn’t accept cheap closure.

outcomes.title: Renegotiate
outcomes.desc: Turn nostalgia into new terms.

success.text: You smile, you bargain, you reset the balance. They leave impressed—still dangerous.

fail.text: They hear insult in your terms. The friendship is now a weapon pointed at you.

outcomes.title: Find Leverage
outcomes.desc: Learn what they want before you agree to anything.

success.text: You discover the true ask beneath the small talk. Information steadies you.

fail.text: You dig too openly. The old friend notices, and the pleasant mask slips.

name: A Protégé’s Question
prompt: A younger soul asks you what to do when their oath conflicts with their hunger. They’re looking for a map; you have scars instead.

outcomes.title: Teach Honestly
outcomes.desc: Give them the truth, even if it isn’t pretty.

success.text: You speak plainly. They listen like it matters. Later, your words come back to you as reputation.

fail.text: Your honesty lands like cruelty. They leave offended, and the story twists in retelling.

outcomes.title: Teach Tactics
outcomes.desc: Give them tools, not morals.

success.text: You teach how systems work. The protégé learns fast—and owes you for it.

fail.text: You teach too much. They walk away with knowledge that makes them dangerous to you.

outcomes.title: Teach the Knife
outcomes.desc: Show them how to survive when ideals fail.

success.text: You show the back door, the hidden clause, the quiet bribe. They survive—and you gain a loyal shadow.

fail.text: Someone hears you counseling bad behavior. The wrong ears treat it like confession.

name: Muster Duty
prompt: A summons arrives: drill, muster, show your readiness. The realm’s problems are never only someone else’s.

outcomes.title: Lead the Line
outcomes.desc: Put yourself where people can see you.

success.text: You keep the line steady and the men calmer than they have a right to be. Officers note it.

fail.text: A training bout turns sharp. You take a cut, and the officers pretend it’s normal.

outcomes.title: Train Smart
outcomes.desc: Spot weaknesses and fix them before they get people killed.

success.text: You correct stances, adjust rotations, and make the unit better in measurable ways.

fail.text: You push too hard. The unit resents you, and you end the day wrung out.

outcomes.title: Avoid Notice
outcomes.desc: Do your duty, but don’t become a symbol.

success.text: You blend into competence. You learn who is incompetent—and who is pretending.

fail.text: Someone marks you as ‘shirking.’ It’s unfair. It still sticks.

name: A Sudden Weakness
prompt: A chill settles in your bones after a wet day on the road. It’s nothing—until it lingers.

outcomes.title: Rest Properly
outcomes.desc: Lose time now to keep strength later.

success.text: You rest, eat warm food, and keep your body from tipping into real illness.

fail.text: Even with rest, your body protests. You rise slower than you used to.

outcomes.title: Push Through
outcomes.desc: Ignore the warning and keep moving.

success.text: You force the miles and arrive on time. People admire it—if they notice the shaking hands.

fail.text: You push too hard. The chill becomes fever, and the world tastes like metal.

outcomes.title: Find a Healer
outcomes.desc: Pay coin or favors for a proper look.

success.text: You get treated before it turns ugly. The healer expects a favor later—and you accept.

fail.text: The healer dismisses you, or overcharges you. Either way, you leave poorer and still tired.

name: A Rival’s Challenge
prompt: A rival in your trade or station raises a complaint that sounds reasonable until you hear the malice under it.

outcomes.title: Answer Formally
outcomes.desc: Use procedure like armor.

success.text: You produce records, witnesses, and calm. The complaint weakens in the light.

fail.text: A detail is missing. Your rival seizes it like proof.

outcomes.title: Answer Publicly
outcomes.desc: Turn the crowd against them.

success.text: You speak with heat and control it. The crowd likes a confident winner.

fail.text: You push too hard and it looks like bullying. Now the rival has sympathy.

outcomes.title: Answer Quietly
outcomes.desc: Find their weakness and apply pressure where it won’t be seen.

success.text: A private threat, a revealed debt, a revealed affair. The complaint disappears overnight.

fail.text: They anticipate you and set a trap. Your quiet pressure leaves fingerprints.

name: A Cousin’s Inheritance
prompt: A distant relative dies, and suddenly everyone cares about bloodlines, signatures, and who was ‘promised’ what.

outcomes.title: Mediate
outcomes.desc: Keep the dispute from becoming a feud.

success.text: You keep voices low and knives sheathed. Both sides grudgingly accept the settlement.

fail.text: You spend your day absorbing other people’s anger. By night you feel hollow.

outcomes.title: Lawyer Up
outcomes.desc: Find the decisive clause or precedent.

success.text: You cite the right passage. The matter settles, and someone quietly pays you for it.

fail.text: You misread a clause. The wrong person wins, and blame seeks a face.

outcomes.title: Forge a Solution
outcomes.desc: Make the paperwork say what the world needs it to say.

success.text: A new signature appears where it must. The crisis ends. The lie begins.

fail.text: Ink doesn’t fool everyone. A keen eye calls it out, and now the charge is serious.

name: The Road Calls Again
prompt: You’ve built routines, obligations, and careful habits. Then a letter arrives that smells like old roads and unfinished business.

outcomes.title: Go
outcomes.desc: Leave the routine behind for a season.

success.text: You travel with purpose and return with stories that make you feel younger—and sharper.

fail.text: The road takes more than it gives. You come back tired and behind on everything.

outcomes.title: Investigate First
outcomes.desc: Make sure the letter isn’t bait.

success.text: You learn who sent it and why. The choice becomes yours again.

fail.text: Your inquiry costs coin and earns irritation. Someone decides you’re prying.

outcomes.title: Send Someone Else
outcomes.desc: Delegate—because you can.

success.text: Your agent reports back. You keep your life intact and still move pieces on the board.

fail.text: The agent fails. The mess remains, and now it’s your fault for not going.

name: A Plague Ledger Rumor
prompt: Someone claims the dead list is wrong—that names were added, or removed, for money. In plague years, records decide inheritances.

outcomes.title: Verify the Names
outcomes.desc: Check handwriting, dates, witnesses.

success.text: You find the inconsistency. Whether it’s fraud or error, it’s leverage in your hands.

fail.text: The work is grim. By the end you’re staring at ink like it’s a grave.

outcomes.title: Expose the Fraud
outcomes.desc: Bring it to the right authority and force action.

success.text: You name the culprit and force a reckoning. People call it courage. Enemies call it interference.

fail.text: You accuse without proof. Someone powerful makes you regret it.

outcomes.title: Profit Quietly
outcomes.desc: Sell the rumor to someone who needs it.

success.text: You trade information for coin and a favor. Mercy is expensive; you act accordingly.

fail.text: The buyer turns on you to keep their hands clean.

name: A Seat at the Table
prompt: You’re offered a place in a small council—official or not. It’s influence, but it’s also responsibility for ugly choices.

outcomes.title: Accept and Lead
outcomes.desc: Take the seat and steer the room.

success.text: You speak last, and the room shifts around you. People begin to treat your opinion like law.

fail.text: You accept and immediately inherit someone else’s enemies.

outcomes.title: Accept and Listen
outcomes.desc: Gather facts before you swing authority.

success.text: You learn what the council really fears. Knowing that changes everything.

fail.text: You listen too long and miss the moment to shape the vote. You leave tired and behind.

outcomes.title: Decline Carefully
outcomes.desc: Refuse without insulting the offer.

success.text: You bow out with grace. They can’t call it cowardice without sounding petty.

fail.text: Someone hears rejection as judgment. The rumor becomes, ‘They feared the work.’.

name: The Body Remembers
prompt: An old injury wakes up in the cold. You can still do what you’ve always done—maybe. The question is what it costs now.

outcomes.title: Push Through
outcomes.desc: Ignore pain and keep moving.

success.text: You grit your teeth and make it work. People see strength, not the shaking hands.

fail.text: Pain spikes hard and wrong. You’ve turned an ache into damage.

outcomes.title: Work Around It
outcomes.desc: Change your approach—tools, help, better pacing.

success.text: You adapt. You lose speed, not dignity, and you end the day intact.

fail.text: Adaptation takes effort. You finish, but you’re wrung out.

outcomes.title: Hire Help
outcomes.desc: Pay someone to carry what you shouldn’t.

success.text: You pay for assistance and keep your strength for the choices that matter.

fail.text: Help is expensive, and the hireling is mediocre. You still pay.

name: Questions of Succession
prompt: Someone young asks, too casually, who will inherit what you’ve built. It’s a normal question. It doesn’t feel normal.

outcomes.title: State It Clearly
outcomes.desc: Name an heir and make the future visible.

success.text: Clarity quiets a room. It also creates a target—because now everyone knows who matters.

fail.text: You speak and someone takes offense. The politics begin immediately.

outcomes.title: Draft a Will
outcomes.desc: Put it in ink where lies have to work harder.

success.text: You write it carefully, with witnesses. The paper becomes a shield—until someone tries to burn it.

fail.text: A witness balks. A clause is questioned. Your authority looks shaky for a moment too long.

outcomes.title: Keep Them Guessing
outcomes.desc: Use uncertainty as protection.

success.text: Ambiguity keeps enemies from choosing a single target. It also keeps allies nervous.

fail.text: You juggle too long. Someone decides to ‘solve’ the uncertainty for you.

name: An Old Scandal Returns
prompt: A rumor you thought drowned resurfaces with a new witness. The story is uglier than you remember, and it points at you.

outcomes.title: Face It
outcomes.desc: Answer it openly and take control of the narrative.

success.text: You acknowledge what must be acknowledged and deny what must be denied. Some believe you—enough.

fail.text: The room smells blood. Your words don’t land, and the shame becomes public.

outcomes.title: Disprove It
outcomes.desc: Hunt the contradiction and break the witness.

success.text: You find the seam in the story and pull. The witness recants, and someone else becomes the villain.

fail.text: Your investigation makes you look guilty. The rumor grows teeth.

outcomes.title: Bury It
outcomes.desc: Pay, threaten, or blackmail the rumor into silence.

success.text: The rumor dies—quietly, suddenly. The price is that you now owe the people who can do that.

fail.text: You push too hard. Now the scandal is paired with a new crime.

name: Order the Repairs
prompt: Roads, walls, wells—someone must decide what gets fixed first. Every choice creates gratitude and resentment in equal measure.

outcomes.title: Fix the Road
outcomes.desc: Trade and travel first—keep the lifeblood moving.

success.text: Merchants praise you. Farmers grumble. The road still matters.

fail.text: You misjudge costs. The repair drags, and people blame you for every delay.

outcomes.title: Fix the Well
outcomes.desc: Put survival before commerce.

success.text: People remember mercy. They also remember who paid for it.

fail.text: The work costs more than promised. You pay anyway or look cruel.

outcomes.title: Fix the Wall
outcomes.desc: Security first—make threats expensive.

success.text: The border looks firmer. So do you. It wins you respect in hard places.

fail.text: The work is endless. You spend weeks chasing stone and labor and sleep poorly.

name: A Protégé Turns
prompt: A younger ally starts playing politics without you—using lessons you taught them. You can be proud, or you can be cautious.

outcomes.title: Confront Them
outcomes.desc: Call them in and demand the truth.

success.text: They confess enough to calm you. You set new terms, and they accept—this time.

fail.text: They deny, convincingly. Now you look paranoid, and they look innocent.

outcomes.title: Outplay Them
outcomes.desc: Beat them quietly before they learn what winning feels like.

success.text: You move first, and their scheme collapses. They don’t know it was you—only that the world is sharp.

fail.text: Your counterplay is noticed. People whisper that you can’t trust your own circle.

outcomes.title: Embrace It
outcomes.desc: Make their ambition part of your plan.

success.text: You let them run, and you guide the result. Together you look formidable.

fail.text: You give them room and they take more than you meant to offer.

name: A Trial of Honor
prompt: A dispute that should’ve ended in words turns into a formal challenge. Someone demands satisfaction in front of witnesses.

outcomes.title: Take the Field
outcomes.desc: Win clean, or at least win.

success.text: You fight with economy and finish it fast. The witnesses call it decisive.

fail.text: You lose the exchange and pay in blood. The crowd’s silence is louder than cheers.

outcomes.title: Negotiate Terms
outcomes.desc: Turn the trial into a settlement without looking weak.

success.text: You frame compromise as victory. Both sides accept because it’s easier than dying.

fail.text: Your opponent calls you coward. The insult sticks in a few mouths.

outcomes.title: Settle It in Shadow
outcomes.desc: Win without the field—use leverage instead.

success.text: The challenger withdraws before dawn. No one knows why, and that mystery protects you.

fail.text: Your leverage is discovered. Now you’re not only challenged—you’re accused.

name: A Quarantine Notice
prompt: A town posts a quarantine notice after a fever death. Memories of the last plague make people cruel and scared in the same breath.

outcomes.title: Support the Sick
outcomes.desc: Help the healers and keep the fearful from turning violent.

success.text: You bring water, blankets, calm words. Mercy buys you respect.

fail.text: You catch the sickness—or at least the fear of it. Either way, your body protests.

outcomes.title: Investigate the Death
outcomes.desc: Find out if this is plague—or politics.

success.text: You uncover a lie in the story. That doesn’t stop panic, but it gives you a handle on it.

fail.text: You spend nights digging and days placating. By the end you’re spent.

outcomes.title: Exploit the Panic
outcomes.desc: Use fear to push a decision through.

success.text: People accept harsh measures when they’re afraid. You gain power—along with a few enemies.

fail.text: Someone calls your bluff publicly. Now the crowd’s anger has your name on it.

name: The Weight of Paper
prompt: Wills, deeds, oaths, contracts—your life has become a stack of documents someone will fight over when you’re gone.

outcomes.title: Set It in Ink
outcomes.desc: Write it clearly, with witnesses.

success.text: You make the future harder to dispute. That alone feels like mercy.

fail.text: The work is draining. By night your head throbs with names and clauses.

outcomes.title: Set It in Oath
outcomes.desc: Bind your heirs with promises, not paper.

success.text: You speak the vow before witnesses. People respect it—until someone decides to test it.

fail.text: One witness scoffs. The doubt spreads like rot in fruit.

outcomes.title: Hide the Truth
outcomes.desc: Keep some things off the page.

success.text: You omit what would invite war. The secret stays yours a little longer.

fail.text: A clerk notices the gap. They don’t know what it means, but they know it exists.

name: Winter’s Accounting
prompt: A hard winter tightens the world. Supplies vanish faster, tempers shorten, and every mile feels like a negotiation with your body.

outcomes.title: Ration Strictly
outcomes.desc: Cut now to survive later.

success.text: You measure food like coin. It keeps you alive, but it isn’t kind.

fail.text: You cut too deep. Hunger makes people reckless—and angry.

outcomes.title: Find New Stores
outcomes.desc: Hunt, bargain, and scavenge.

success.text: You find a cache and pay the right price. For a while, the winter loosens its grip.

fail.text: You spend a cold day searching. You return empty-handed and worn raw.

outcomes.title: Take What You Need
outcomes.desc: Let desperation pick your morals.

success.text: You ‘borrow’ from those with more than they admit. It feeds you. It also creates enemies.

fail.text: You’re caught. In winter, mercy is scarce and law is eager.

name: A Last Pilgrimage
prompt: A place calls to you—an oathstone, a grave, a chapel, a ruin. It’s not duty. It’s closure, if such a thing exists.

outcomes.title: Go With Witness
outcomes.desc: Bring someone who will remember it correctly.

success.text: You arrive with ceremony, however small. The act becomes a story others can carry when you can’t.

fail.text: The travel drains you. You get there, but the return is heavier than expected.

outcomes.title: Go Alone
outcomes.desc: Make the journey privately, without witnesses or ceremony. You want peace, not politics.

success.text: You speak what you need to speak. No one interrupts. No one uses it against you.

fail.text: Cold and wet find your lungs. You leave with a cough and an uneasy fear.

outcomes.title: Send an Offering
outcomes.desc: Let the ritual happen without your body paying the cost.

success.text: You choose the right offering and the right messenger. It counts—enough.

fail.text: The messenger bungles it, or pockets the offering. The insult circles back to you.

name: A Patron’s Final Ask
prompt: A powerful figure who once backed you wants one last favor. The request is small. The implications are not.

outcomes.title: Grant the Favor
outcomes.desc: Pay the cost and secure the patron’s goodwill.

success.text: You do it and keep your face calm. The patron’s gratitude is real—and so is their expectation.

fail.text: The favor offends someone else. The backlash arrives with your name attached.

outcomes.title: Redraft the Ask
outcomes.desc: Turn their request into something you can live with.

success.text: You rewrite the favor into a lawful shape. The patron accepts, grudging but impressed.

fail.text: The patron hears ‘no’ in your edits. The smile stays, but it doesn’t warm.

outcomes.title: Refuse and Vanish
outcomes.desc: Decline—and make it hard to punish you.

success.text: You step out of the patron’s reach before consequences can gather. It’s not victory—just survival.

fail.text: You try to vanish and fail. Now the patron is offended and focused.

name: Advice for the Next
prompt: Your heir—or someone who will outlive you—asks what matters most. It’s a simple question with a lifetime of answers.

outcomes.title: Teach Mercy
outcomes.desc: Tell them to protect people first, even when it’s costly.

success.text: They listen like it’s scripture. Whether they follow it is another matter, but the lesson lands.

fail.text: You speak too plainly about old sins. The truth leaks in ways you didn’t intend.

outcomes.title: Teach Power
outcomes.desc: Tell them to control what can be controlled.

success.text: They learn to read rooms, not faces. It will serve them—and worry kinder people.

fail.text: Your counsel sounds like threat to the wrong listener. Someone decides the line must end with you.

outcomes.title: Teach Survival
outcomes.desc: Give them the quiet tricks you used to stay alive.

success.text: You pass on methods, not ideals. They will survive. They might be hated for it.

fail.text: The advice is overheard and interpreted as confession. The story makes you look worse than you are.

name: A Chance to Step Back
prompt: Someone offers you a quieter role: less risk, fewer eyes, more time. It feels like mercy. It also feels like surrender.

outcomes.title: Take the Quiet
outcomes.desc: Accept the slower life.

success.text: Your days become steadier. You heal in ways you didn’t know you needed.

fail.text: You try to step back and find you don’t fit. The quiet makes you restless and sharp-edged.

outcomes.title: Refuse Kindly
outcomes.desc: Stay in the game without insulting the offer.

success.text: You refuse with grace. People respect it. Some also take it as a warning.

fail.text: The refusal reads as pride. Someone decides to humble you.

outcomes.title: Take It and Spy
outcomes.desc: Use the quieter role to listen without being noticed.

success.text: You become furniture in important rooms. Furniture hears everything.

fail.text: A sharper person notices you noticing. They smile like they’ve found a hobby.

name: The Healer’s Knife
prompt: A healer offers a risky treatment for an old problem—herbs, cautery, cutting. Relief is possible. So is worse.

outcomes.title: Accept Treatment
outcomes.desc: Trust the healer and endure.

success.text: The pain is bright and immediate, then fading. For the first time in years, you breathe easier.

fail.text: The treatment goes wrong. Fever follows, and the healer’s face tightens with fear.

outcomes.title: Research First
outcomes.desc: Make sure this isn’t quackery.

success.text: You confirm the method and choose the right moment. Knowledge steadies your hand.

fail.text: The research leaves you drained, and you still have to decide.

outcomes.title: Refuse
outcomes.desc: Keep your pain; keep your certainty.

success.text: You walk away. Some pains become familiar companions.

fail.text: You refuse and your body punishes you for it that night.

name: A Feast for the Young
prompt: A celebration for the young becomes a mirror for the old. People watch how you bless the next generation—and what you demand in return.

outcomes.title: Give Freely
outcomes.desc: Offer gifts without hooks.

success.text: You give with open hands. People call it generosity, and the story sticks.

fail.text: You give and feel the cost immediately. It stings more than you expected.

outcomes.title: Give Strategically
outcomes.desc: Make gifts that create obligations.

success.text: Your gifts bind quietly. In a year, you’ll see the benefit.

fail.text: Someone calls it manipulation. The accusation is unfair—and useful to your enemies.

outcomes.title: Withhold
outcomes.desc: Let them learn scarcity.

success.text: You keep your resources. You also learn who resents you for it.

fail.text: The room sees coldness, not lesson. The judgment spreads faster than you like.

name: The Tilt-Yard Remembers
prompt: A manor you once served keeps a small tilt-yard. The master-at-arms recognizes your stance and grins. "Show the youngsters how you keep your feet."

outcomes.title: Take the Bout
outcomes.desc: Step into the sand and let your old training speak.

success.text: You trade blows until breath and pride run thin. When you finally disarm your opponent, the watching squires cheer like you’ve given them permission to believe.

fail.text: Your foot slips in the churned sand. A blunted point still finds bone, and the yard goes quiet as you stagger back.

outcomes.title: Teach the Young
outcomes.desc: Correct grips, set rules, and turn the moment into discipline instead of ego.

success.text: You make it a lesson: how to bow, where not to overreach, when to yield. The household remembers restraint as much as victory.

fail.text: Your correction lands wrong—too sharp, too public. A parent bristles, and the whisper becomes: "Proud."

outcomes.title: Decline with Courtesy
outcomes.desc: Refuse the bout without looking afraid.

success.text: You smile, offer a small bow, and step aside. Later, someone quietly tells you who in this household bets on which grudges.

fail.text: You try to fade out, but it reads as snub. The master-at-arms says nothing—yet the room feels colder.

name: A Sealed Errand
prompt: A rider catches you on the road and presses a wax-sealed note into your hand. "You can sit a saddle. Deliver this—today."

outcomes.title: Ride Hard
outcomes.desc: Push the pace and get it there before anyone changes their mind.

success.text: You arrive sweat-soaked but on time. The recipient breaks the seal, nods once, and you’re waved into an antechamber instead of left outside.

fail.text: You make the distance—barely. Your hands shake when you dismount, and the day’s effort sits in your bones like wet stone.

outcomes.title: Read Before You Deliver
outcomes.desc: Break the wax and learn what you’re carrying.

success.text: The words are leverage—names, dates, a promise someone doesn’t want remembered. You reseal it as best you can and keep the knowledge for yourself.

fail.text: The wax doesn’t go back the same. When you hand it over, the recipient’s eyes narrow. Later, a guard asks your name—twice.

outcomes.title: Demand a Receipt
outcomes.desc: Ask for coin, terms, or written acknowledgment before you move.

success.text: You get a signed scrap and a small purse. Practical, defensible, and hard to deny later.

fail.text: The rider laughs. "You’ve forgotten your place." Word travels faster than you do.

name: The Banner Line
prompt: In a crowded hall, a herald points to you. "You. Stand with the banner." Eyes track every fold of cloth—because banners mean blood.

outcomes.title: Mind the Colors
outcomes.desc: Set the banner correctly and keep the ceremony clean.

success.text: You catch the subtle details: which knot faces outward, which sigil must not crease. The herald gives you a rare nod.

fail.text: You miss a detail that matters to someone who can afford to be offended. The correction is quiet, but the smirk is not.

outcomes.title: Keep It Upright, Whatever It Takes
outcomes.desc: Hold the line even as elbows and wine and politics press in.

success.text: You plant your feet and become part of the furniture. The crowd flows around you, and the banner never dips.

fail.text: A shove turns into a fall. The pole bites your shoulder, and pain flashes white as the banner wavers.

outcomes.title: Trade Places Quietly
outcomes.desc: Find a lesser soul to hold the cloth and vanish before anyone cares.

success.text: A cousin’s servant owes you a favor. The swap happens under a laugh and a toast. You step back into the shadows with a better view of who watches whom.

fail.text: Someone notices the change and decides you did it for a reason. You’re not accused—just treated like you might be guilty.

name: A Strap Gives Way
prompt: A saddle strap snaps with a sharp crack. Without it you’ll limp to the next town—or lose the horse entirely.

outcomes.title: Mend It Properly
outcomes.desc: Cut, stitch, and knot until it will hold.

success.text: You make a repair that looks ugly but works. The horse settles, and the road stops trying to kill you for simple neglect.

fail.text: Your fix slips after the first mile. You stop, fix it again, and lose daylight and patience in equal measure.

outcomes.title: Pay the Smith
outcomes.desc: Find a roadside forge and buy a clean fix.

success.text: Coin buys competence. The smith tests the tack, tightens the cinch, and sends you out like someone who plans to arrive alive.

fail.text: You overpay because you have to. The smith smiles like they’ve done this a hundred times.

outcomes.title: Borrow and Move
outcomes.desc: Talk, trick, or steal a strap to keep going.

success.text: You leave with what you need and no one with enough certainty to swear it was you.

fail.text: A shout follows you down the lane. A dog barks. A man with a spear points and says your description too loudly.

name: Oath and Spur
prompt: At a roadside stone scratched with old vows, you remember the first oath you ever heard spoken aloud. The words still feel heavier than iron.

outcomes.title: Renew the Oath
outcomes.desc: Speak the vow again—out loud, where it can witness you.

success.text: You keep it simple and honest. The road doesn’t answer, but you do feel the line inside you straighten.

fail.text: You stumble on the words. It’s nothing—yet the doubt sticks, like a burr under cloth.

outcomes.title: Carve a New Mark
outcomes.desc: Add your own mark to the stone—small, but claiming a place among the witnesses.

success.text: You leave a sign only the attentive will read. Someday, someone will stand here and know you stood here too.

fail.text: A traveler sees you defacing a vow-stone and assumes the worst. The look they give you is the kind that travels.

outcomes.title: Let the Past Stay Quiet
outcomes.desc: Walk on without re-opening old promises.

success.text: You don’t need a stone to remember who you were. You keep moving.

fail.text: You keep moving—but you think about it for miles.

name: An Audit Notice
prompt: A runner in clean boots hands you a sealed notice. The Marcher League wants your books—now, not later.

outcomes.title: Open the Books
outcomes.desc: Lay out everything you can prove, and prove it calmly.

success.text: You answer questions before they’re asked. The auditor’s pen slows. When they leave, it’s with fewer hooks in their smile.

fail.text: You can’t cover a gap you didn’t know existed. The auditor circles a line, then another. "We’ll speak again."

outcomes.title: Bury the Gap
outcomes.desc: Move ink until the missing coin stops existing on paper.

success.text: You salt the totals, re-date a receipt, and tuck the lie inside three true lines. It’s good work—if you don’t think about what it costs.

fail.text: They catch the seam. Once an auditor smells fraud, they never stop smelling it.

outcomes.title: Buy Time
outcomes.desc: Turn the audit into a conversation instead of an inspection.

success.text: You offer tea, context, and the right words. They agree to return after the next season—annoyed, but delayed.

fail.text: Your charm reads as obstruction. The runner returns with a second notice, less polite than the first.

name: The Missing Receipt
prompt: A payment is questioned. Without a receipt, it becomes theft in the eyes of anyone who wants it to.

outcomes.title: Find the Stub
outcomes.desc: Reconstruct the trail: date, witness, ink, and hand.

success.text: You find it in the wrong ledger, filed under a name that no longer exists. Proof is a strange kind of relief.

fail.text: You search until the page numbers blur. The stub is gone, and now you’re the easiest explanation.

outcomes.title: Forge the Paper
outcomes.desc: Make a receipt that looks like it was always there.

success.text: You match the hand, the ink, and the dust. Anyone who doubts it will have to work to prove it.

fail.text: The forgery is good—too good. A clerk who knows the old ink calls it out with a raised brow.

outcomes.title: Pay It Back Quietly
outcomes.desc: Eat the loss before it becomes a spectacle.

success.text: You pay and keep the peace. Someone notes your discretion—and your willingness to carry burdens.

fail.text: You pay more than you can afford, and the problem stops being the receipt and becomes your empty purse.

name: Counterfeit Scrip
prompt: A neat bundle of League scrip changes hands in a back room. The paper is right. The seal is almost right.

outcomes.title: Expose It
outcomes.desc: Call it out, loudly enough that the room can’t pretend.

success.text: You name the flaw and the room shifts. The counterfeiters slip out, but the clerk-captain remembers who protected the ledger’s honor.

fail.text: The wrong person hears you. A smile, a nod… and later you feel eyes on your back in the street.

outcomes.title: Spend It
outcomes.desc: If it buys bread, it’s real enough—for now.

success.text: You pass it where no one checks too closely. Coin is coin until it isn’t.

fail.text: A shopkeeper holds the note up to the light and frowns. The accusation is quiet, but it sticks.

outcomes.title: Walk Away
outcomes.desc: Refuse the bundle and refuse the trouble.

success.text: You leave with clean hands and a clear memory of who was in the room.

fail.text: You leave, but not unseen.

name: An Oath in Ink
prompt: A contract is set before you with a space for your name. "Sign," says the broker. "And be bound."

outcomes.title: Sign Cleanly
outcomes.desc: Take the deal and accept the obligation.

success.text: You sign, and the room relaxes. Doors open because your word is now enforceable by strangers with swords.

fail.text: The terms bite harder than you expected. You’re bound—and paying for it—before you’re fully out the door.

outcomes.title: Negotiate a Clause
outcomes.desc: Make the deal safer, even if it makes you unpopular.

success.text: You find the poison line and strike it out. The broker’s smile thins, but the contract stops being a trap.

fail.text: They treat your questions as insult. The deal remains, but the room remembers that you made it difficult.

outcomes.title: Slip Away
outcomes.desc: Leave before the ink dries on your life.

success.text: You distract, misdirect, and vanish into the crowd. Later you hear who truly needed your signature—and why.

fail.text: A hand closes on your wrist. "Not so fast." Now you’re not just refusing—you’re fleeing.

name: Ledger Smoke
prompt: A storeroom fills with smoke. Someone shouts about fire—and about ledgers that cannot be replaced.

outcomes.title: Save the Ledgers
outcomes.desc: Grab the books and get them out, even if your lungs hate you.

success.text: You carry armfuls of ink and consequence into clean air. When the smoke clears, the broker speaks your name with genuine gratitude.

fail.text: You get the books out, but the cough doesn’t leave. Night brings fever, and your breath feels borrowed.

outcomes.title: Save the Strongbox
outcomes.desc: Protect coin and seals—the things that pay for tomorrow.

success.text: You drag the heavy chest free before the beams give way. Someone spits soot and calls you practical—a compliment in League circles.

fail.text: A beam drops where your hand was a moment ago. Pain snaps through your forearm, and you drop the weight with a curse.

outcomes.title: Let It Burn, Remember Who Lit It
outcomes.desc: Focus on the cause, not the salvage.

success.text: You watch hands, not flames. Later you can name who arrived too quickly, who left too calmly, and who smiled into the smoke.

fail.text: A shouted accusation lands near you. Even if it isn’t true, suspicion likes a convenient face.

name: An Old Alley Name
prompt: A voice calls you by a childhood nickname you haven’t heard in years. In the narrow lane stands someone who remembers exactly what you used to do to eat.

outcomes.title: Take the Job
outcomes.desc: Agree to a quick score. Quick scores always have teeth.

success.text: The job is dirty but cleanly done. You leave with coin in your pocket and one more secret that belongs to someone else.

fail.text: A window breaks louder than it should. A lantern swings. Boots turn toward you at the same time.

outcomes.title: Refuse, Kindly
outcomes.desc: Say no without making an enemy.

success.text: You offer a small kindness instead of a yes. They don’t smile, but they don’t spit either.

fail.text: They take your refusal as judgment. Word spreads that you’ve gotten "too good" for the alley.

outcomes.title: Turn Them In
outcomes.desc: Trade an old name for new favor.

success.text: The watch captain listens because you speak like you know the streets. The arrest is quick; the gratitude is colder.

fail.text: Someone follows you home. The lesson is delivered with a fist and a knife’s flat edge.

name: Rooftop Run
prompt: You spot a familiar gait—a watchman who used to shake you down. He spots you too, and the chase begins before either of you decides it should.

outcomes.title: Leap the Gap
outcomes.desc: Trust your legs and the old roofline map in your head.

success.text: You clear the gap and land hard, laughing once despite yourself. The watchman stops at the edge, swearing at the sky.

fail.text: Your foot slips. You catch the ledge, but stone tears skin and pride alike before you haul yourself up.

outcomes.title: Lose Them in the Crowd
outcomes.desc: Drop off the roofs and vanish among carts and cloaks.

success.text: Two turns, one borrowed cloak, and a change of pace—suddenly you are just another face. You even pick up a useful rumor in the press.

fail.text: Someone points. Someone shouts. Once a chase becomes a story, it grows legs of its own.

outcomes.title: Bribe the Problem Away
outcomes.desc: Pay for mercy the way the streets always have.

success.text: Coin changes hands. The watchman’s anger turns practical, and the chase ends as if it never started.

fail.text: He takes the coin and keeps the anger. You pay twice—once in money, once in fear.

name: A Market Lift
prompt: The market is a sea of sleeves and purses. Your hands remember the work even if your conscience argues.

outcomes.title: Lift a Purse
outcomes.desc: Take one cleanly and disappear.

success.text: You take the weight from someone else’s belt and it becomes yours. The move is so smooth you almost believe it’s harmless.

fail.text: A wrist is caught mid-lift. The shout is immediate: "Thief!"

outcomes.title: Work the Crowd
outcomes.desc: Listen, watch, and harvest rumors instead of coin.

success.text: You leave with three small truths: who is desperate, who is lying, and who is buying influence by the bowlful.

fail.text: You stay too long. The noise becomes a headache that follows you home.

outcomes.title: Buy Bread for a Small Debt
outcomes.desc: Spend your own coin to keep someone else from stealing.

success.text: The child eats. The mother remembers your face. That kind of memory becomes help later, when you need it most.

fail.text: You give what you can, but it isn’t enough. The gratitude turns into shame on both sides.

name: A Shelter’s Debt
prompt: A matron from the old shelter finds you. "You slept under my roof when you were nothing," she says. "Now the roof needs coin."

outcomes.title: Pay What You Owe
outcomes.desc: Give coin without speeches.

success.text: You pay. The matron’s shoulders loosen, and for once you feel like your past is something you can close gently.

fail.text: You pay, and it hurts more than you admit. The road ahead feels narrower when your purse is light.

outcomes.title: Offer a Favor Instead
outcomes.desc: Trade labor or leverage for time.

success.text: You promise a quiet service—delivered cleanly. The matron doesn’t ask details, and you don’t offer them.

fail.text: Your favor touches the wrong person. The shelter stays safe, but you gain a shadow at your back.

outcomes.title: Ask the Matron to Petition the Rich
outcomes.desc: Turn the need into a public appeal—make mercy fashionable.

success.text: You write the words, she speaks them, and a few purses open. It isn’t enough forever, but it buys another season.

fail.text: A donor takes offense at being asked. The shelter’s need becomes gossip, and gossip rarely comes with coin.

name: The Watchman’s Whistle
prompt: A watchman’s whistle shrieks. Someone points your direction—not sure of the charge, only sure of the excitement.

outcomes.title: Talk It Down
outcomes.desc: Make the watchman feel foolish for making a scene.

success.text: You speak like you belong here. The watchman’s certainty cracks, and he waves the crowd away with a scowl.

fail.text: He doubles down to save face. The crowd loves an arrest more than the truth.

outcomes.title: Run
outcomes.desc: Old instincts, old speed.

success.text: You vanish into alley and shadow before the watch can form a line. Breath burns, but you are free.

fail.text: A baton catches you in the ribs. You get away, but not cleanly, and now you’re running from more than embarrassment.

outcomes.title: Bribe the Problem
outcomes.desc: Pay the price of a quiet ending.

success.text: He pockets the coin and makes the whistle disappear. The crowd disperses, disappointed.

fail.text: He takes coin and still calls for backup. It’s amazing how quickly generosity becomes confession.

name: The Seating Plan
prompt: A banquet list is posted—who sits near the high table, who sits near the door, and who is being punished without a word spoken.

outcomes.title: Rearrange Quietly
outcomes.desc: Nudge names and places with subtle pressure.

success.text: A whisper, a favor, a promise—suddenly the insult becomes a misunderstanding. The right people are grateful.

fail.text: Someone notices your hand in the list. Now you’re not fixing an insult—you’re making one.

outcomes.title: Insist on Precedence
outcomes.desc: Make the argument openly. Make it official.

success.text: You speak with steel under velvet. The steward relents, and the room watches you like you’ve just declared a small war.

fail.text: The room smiles while you speak—and then sits exactly as planned. Losing in public has a taste you don’t forget.

outcomes.title: Endure the Slight
outcomes.desc: Eat it. Remember it. Choose your time later.

success.text: You swallow pride and watch the room. You learn who laughs too hard and who looks away too fast.

fail.text: You keep your face still, but the effort drains you. Courtesy is work.

name: A Ward’s Question
prompt: A young ward under your roof asks, quietly: "What do I do when everyone expects me to be someone else?"

outcomes.title: Teach Courtesy
outcomes.desc: Give them tools: how to speak, when to bow, when to hold eye contact.

success.text: You turn confusion into instruction. The ward listens like you’ve handed them a lantern.

fail.text: Your advice lands cold. The ward hears "obedience" where you meant "survival."

outcomes.title: Teach a Harder Truth
outcomes.desc: Tell them power is often taken, not granted.

success.text: You don’t soften it. You teach them how people lie with smiles. The ward leaves steadier, if less innocent.

fail.text: A servant overhears and repeats the words without context. Suddenly your roof sounds like a nest of plotting.

outcomes.title: Offer Simple Kindness
outcomes.desc: Promise them they’re not alone, even if you can’t solve it.

success.text: You sit with them until the shaking stops. Sometimes that is the whole of leadership: staying present.

fail.text: You try, but the moment slips away. The ward nods politely and retreats back into silence.

name: The Herald’s Correction
prompt: A herald stops you mid-conversation. "Your arms are incorrect," he says, loud enough for the curious to hear.

outcomes.title: Consult the Rolls
outcomes.desc: Ask for the record and prove your claim with ink.

success.text: You cite the line, the marriage, the grant. The herald’s cheeks redden as he apologizes—because he must.

fail.text: The rolls don’t favor you. Whether you’re right or not, you look wrong now, and that matters.

outcomes.title: Pay for Quiet
outcomes.desc: Offer coin to make the correction become a private matter.

success.text: He pockets the coin and lowers his voice. The crowd loses interest—most of it.

fail.text: He pockets the coin and still lets the rumor breathe. You’ve paid and you’re still bleeding.

outcomes.title: Challenge the Insult
outcomes.desc: Force the issue with steel instead of ink.

success.text: You win the exchange and the hall remembers that you don’t accept public correction lightly.

fail.text: A stumble, a bad angle, and suddenly the point is your blood, not your lineage.

name: Tithe Day
prompt: Stewards bring the estate tally. The numbers do not add up to comfort. Someone must be squeezed—tenant, trader, or pride.

outcomes.title: Collect Hard
outcomes.desc: Take what you’re owed, and let the village resent you.

success.text: Coin arrives on time. So do glares. You can buy things with coin; you cannot buy back a memory of cruelty.

fail.text: The pushback becomes a scene. The steward is shouted down, and your name is spat like a curse.

outcomes.title: Collect Fair
outcomes.desc: Take less now, keep the loyalty intact.

success.text: You set terms that keep bellies full. The purse is lighter, but your name grows heavier in the right way.

fail.text: Fairness doesn’t pay the ledger. The shortfall becomes your problem, quickly.

outcomes.title: Borrow Against the Future
outcomes.desc: Use paper and promises to bridge the season.

success.text: You secure a loan on favorable terms. For now, the estate breathes.

fail.text: The lender smiles too warmly. You sign, and the debt feels like a collar you just clasped yourself.

name: A Noble Hunt
prompt: A hunting party forms at dawn. Invitations are offered like favors, and refused like insults.

outcomes.title: Ride With Them
outcomes.desc: Join the hunt and be seen among the right saddles.

success.text: You take the first blood and the hall hears about it before you’ve even washed. Prestige loves a simple story.

fail.text: Your horse spooks at the wrong moment. The fall is hard and public.

outcomes.title: Track the Stag
outcomes.desc: Use patience and skill instead of brute chase.

success.text: You read the ground like a page. When you lead them to the quarry, even the loudest lords call it "good eyes."

fail.text: You lose the trail and lose time. By dusk, you’re hungry, sore, and behind the story.

outcomes.title: Decline Politely
outcomes.desc: Offer an excuse that doesn’t become a rival.

success.text: You refuse without spitting on the offer. The leader nods once: acceptable.

fail.text: Your refusal is interpreted as contempt. Someone decides you think you’re better than them.

name: A Roadside Shrine
prompt: A small shrine sits under a leaning oak: a bowl for offerings, a weathered symbol, and candles burned down to stubs.

outcomes.title: Leave an Offering
outcomes.desc: Give what you can and move on lighter.

success.text: You leave coin and a whispered mercy. The next traveler sees the lit candle and feels less alone.

fail.text: You give more than you should. Mercy is holy, but hunger is real.

outcomes.title: Repair the Shrine
outcomes.desc: Set stones, straighten the sign, make it stand another year.

success.text: It’s crude work, but honest. When you step back, the shrine looks like someone still cares about it.

fail.text: You work until your hands shake. By the time you finish, you’ve traded daylight for aching bone.

outcomes.title: Take the Coins
outcomes.desc: Decide that living matters more than symbols.

success.text: You pocket the offerings and feel the weight immediately—not of coin, but of what you’ve just agreed to be.

fail.text: A passerby sees the empty bowl and your guilty hands. They make the sign of witness as if it’s a curse.

name: The Shared Bowl
prompt: A roadside cookfire offers a pot of thin stew. A stranger gestures to the circle: "Sit. Eat. No questions."

outcomes.title: Share Your Supplies
outcomes.desc: Add what you have to make the bowl real food.

success.text: You add what you can. The meal becomes hearty enough to silence grief for a moment, and your name is spoken with quiet respect.
