fail.text: You share more than you should. Later your own pack feels too light for the road ahead.

outcomes.title: Tell a True Story
outcomes.desc: Pay for food with something rarer than coin.

success.text: You tell the kind of story that makes people breathe together. When you leave, someone presses a small token into your palm—"for the road."

fail.text: The story lands wrong. Someone calls it boast, or lie, and the warmth turns brittle.

outcomes.title: Keep Walking
outcomes.desc: Refuse the circle. Keep your pace. Keep your distance.

success.text: You leave unseen—and overhear a useful rumor as you pass the edge of the firelight.

fail.text: You walk too long without rest. By nightfall, your thoughts feel as thin as the stew you refused.

name: A Relic Rumor
prompt: Someone in a tavern swears they saw a candle burn green near a sickbed. It could be drink-talk—or it could be witness.

outcomes.title: Chase the Witness
outcomes.desc: Follow the rumor to its source and see what’s real.

success.text: You find the bed, the family, and the truth: a small rite that calms fear. You record details others would dismiss.

fail.text: You sit too close to the sickness while you ask questions. The fever you came to study finds you instead.

outcomes.title: Report It to the Synod
outcomes.desc: Send word to those who keep relics and ledgers.

success.text: A Candlekeeper thanks you and asks one more question than you expected. Later, a courier finds you with a sealed reply.

fail.text: Your report is treated as gossip. The official frown makes you feel smaller than you should.

outcomes.title: Sell the Rumor
outcomes.desc: Trade wonder for coin.

success.text: You find someone who pays for mystery. The coin is good. The conscience is loud.

fail.text: You sell to the wrong person—someone who uses the rumor to start a panic. When the watch looks for a source, your name rises quickly.

name: Shelter at the Abbey Wall
prompt: An abbey offers a warm wall and a thin cot—if you work. "Mercy isn’t free," says the porter. "Neither is bread."

outcomes.title: Work the Ward
outcomes.desc: Carry water, clean linens, sit with the frightened.

success.text: You do the work without flinching. The abbey feeds you, and you leave with a Candlekeeper’s blessing and a full pack.

fail.text: You do the work, but it does not leave you clean. A cough starts and refuses to stop.

outcomes.title: Pay for a Cell
outcomes.desc: Offer coin and ask for quiet.

success.text: The porter accepts your coin and gives you a lockable door. You sleep like a person who still believes in tomorrow.

fail.text: You pay more than you should. The abbey remains kind; your purse does not.

outcomes.title: Slip In After Dark
outcomes.desc: Take shelter without permission.

success.text: You find an unlocked side door and a corner no one uses. You leave at dawn with bread you did not earn.

fail.text: A Vigilant catches you by lantern light. Now you’re not a traveler—you’re a trespasser.

name: Bones and Names
prompt: A ditch beside the road holds old bones and newer cloth. Someone has tried to cover the dead with brush. Someone has given up halfway.

outcomes.title: Mark the Dead
outcomes.desc: Place stones, say names if you know them, and make the place less forgotten.

success.text: You do what mercy can do: you witness. The road feels quieter afterward, as if it approves.

fail.text: You finish the rite, but your stomach turns with the smell. The next day, sickness comes like a debt collected.

outcomes.title: Search for Tokens
outcomes.desc: Look for rings, scraps, anything that can identify a body.

success.text: You find a signet and a torn page with a name. It’s not much, but it turns anonymous death into a story someone can answer.

fail.text: You dig until your hands cramp. You find nothing and leave tired, angry, and dirty.

outcomes.title: Move On
outcomes.desc: Decide you cannot carry every grief you pass.

success.text: You walk away. You tell yourself this is wisdom.

fail.text: A traveler sees you turn aside and judges you for it. Their stare follows you for miles.

name: Night in the Ward
prompt: A hospice ward smells of boiled linen and fear. A novice’s job is simple: stay awake, keep water moving, and keep panic from becoming plague.

outcomes.title: Tend the Fever
outcomes.desc: Sit the bedside and do the work, minute by minute.

success.text: You keep the patient breathing through the worst of it. A Hospitaller clasps your shoulder as if you’ve done something sacred.

fail.text: The fever breaks—for them. Later it starts for you.

outcomes.title: Boil, Measure, Record
outcomes.desc: Turn care into method: timings, symptoms, outcomes.

success.text: You leave the ward with a page of patterns. Knowledge isn’t mercy, but it helps mercy hit its mark.

fail.text: You keep writing past sense. By dawn your eyes sting and your hands won’t stop shaking.

outcomes.title: Cut Corners
outcomes.desc: Pretend to work. Save yourself. Let others carry it.

success.text: No one catches you. That almost makes it worse.

fail.text: A Candlekeeper sees the skipped water, the unwashed bowl. Their disappointment is louder than anger.

name: The Candle Ledger
prompt: You copy names into a Candlekeeper’s ledger—dead, recovered, missing. Ink turns lives into record and record into power.

outcomes.title: Copy Carefully
outcomes.desc: Do it clean, so no one can rewrite truth later.

success.text: Your hand is steady. When the Candlekeeper seals the page, they nod as if you’ve helped hold the world together.

fail.text: Your eyes cross and you miscopy a name. The error looks small until someone’s inheritance depends on it.

outcomes.title: Add a Name
outcomes.desc: Slip a name into the ledger that should not be there.

success.text: A single false line becomes leverage. In a week, someone offers you coin just to "correct" it.

fail.text: The Candlekeeper knows the hand that wrote the lie. You feel the ward’s air change around you.

outcomes.title: Refuse the Task
outcomes.desc: Step back. Say you won’t touch the record.

success.text: The Candlekeeper studies you, then assigns you to honest labor instead. You keep your hands clean, if not your reputation.

fail.text: They take your refusal as arrogance. "Then you prefer rumor."

name: At the Quarantine Gate
prompt: A town has raised quarantine ropes. A sick family begs to be let through. The gate captain begs not to be blamed later.

outcomes.title: Speak for Mercy
outcomes.desc: Argue for controlled entry and care.

success.text: You lay out a plan: isolation, clean water, watches. The captain relents, and the family is taken to a ward instead of the ditch.

fail.text: The captain refuses and you look naïve in front of armed men. Mercy without authority is just pleading.

outcomes.title: Smuggle Medicine
outcomes.desc: Get help in without making a spectacle.

success.text: You slip a bundle of herbs and boiled cloth to a healer on the inside. The family survives the night because you broke a rule quietly.

fail.text: A guard finds the bundle and follows the trail back to you. Suddenly you’re not helping—you’re violating quarantine.

outcomes.title: Wait It Out
outcomes.desc: Accept the rope. Keep yourself safe.

success.text: You camp outside the walls and keep your distance. Sometimes survival is the only mercy you can afford.

fail.text: The waiting turns into a sleepless night. Fear is contagious too.

name: The Green Vigil
prompt: A Vigilant invites you to a Green Vigil: an all-night watch with no sleep, no food, and no lies. "You’ll learn what your soul does when it’s tired."

outcomes.title: Keep the Vigil
outcomes.desc: Stay awake until dawn and let the rite do its work.

success.text: You last to dawn. The Vigilant says nothing, but later you notice doors opening without being asked.

fail.text: You break before dawn. When you blink awake on the floor, shame hits harder than fatigue.

outcomes.title: Observe and Record
outcomes.desc: Study the rite like a puzzle, not a test.

success.text: You write what you see: who falters, who lies, who prays. It’s a map of human weakness—and human strength.

fail.text: The Vigilant catches your notes and reads suspicion into them. "Not everything is for analysis."

outcomes.title: Slip Away
outcomes.desc: Leave before the rite can claim you.

success.text: You vanish into the dark and return with a believable story. You feel lighter… and a little emptier.

fail.text: Someone sees you leaving. Later the Vigilant’s gaze finds you like a hook.

name: A Vow of Silence
prompt: A Synod elder asks you to witness a confession—and then to keep it. "Say nothing," they warn, "even when it would buy you safety."

outcomes.title: Keep the Vow
outcomes.desc: Hold the secret even if it costs you.

success.text: You keep your mouth shut and your eyes steady. The elder trusts you with a second task soon after.

fail.text: Someone pressures you and reads your silence as guilt. The rumor grows legs.

outcomes.title: Trade the Secret
outcomes.desc: Use the confession as leverage.

success.text: You sell the truth and tell yourself it’s just information. The coin is real. The cost is quieter.

fail.text: The elder’s eyes meet yours across a room. Later, your candle burns strangely low, and you feel watched in empty places.

outcomes.title: Bury It in Paper
outcomes.desc: Record it privately so it can’t be twisted by rumor.

success.text: You encode the confession in a harmless ledger. If the truth is needed later, you’ll have it.

fail.text: A Keybearer (or someone like one) finds your notes. Now you’re not a witness—you’re a thief of souls.

name: A Contract Dispute
prompt: Two merchants argue over a contract in front of witnesses. Both insist the ink favors them. Both are ready to pay for your agreement.

outcomes.title: Cite the Clause
outcomes.desc: Find the line that settles it and read it out loud.

success.text: You point to the exact language and the room snaps into order. Even the angry party respects a clean reading.

fail.text: You misread a key line and the wrong merchant pounces. Now the room sees you as careless with other people’s money.

outcomes.title: Lean on the Loser
outcomes.desc: Resolve it the way the League sometimes does: pressure, threat, and quiet consequence.

success.text: You make the loser see the costs of continuing. They sign, gritting teeth, and you collect your "consulting fee."

fail.text: They refuse your pressure and make it public. Suddenly you’re the one being investigated.

outcomes.title: Split the Difference
outcomes.desc: Turn anger into compromise and save the relationship.

success.text: Both leave unhappy, which is how you know it’s fair. You earn a reputation as someone who keeps commerce moving.

fail.text: One party storms out and refuses to pay you. You’ve spent your credibility and gotten nothing back.

name: Warehouse Fire
prompt: A warehouse goes up in hungry flame. Workers shout. Barrels pop. A stamped seal on the door says the goods are yours to account for.

outcomes.title: Organize the Bucket Line
outcomes.desc: Put bodies in motion and keep panic from turning fatal.

success.text: You turn chaos into labor. Enough goods are saved that the owner thanks you instead of suing you.

fail.text: The line breaks. Someone slips. By the time order returns, you’re shaking with fatigue and blame.

outcomes.title: Save the Sealed Goods
outcomes.desc: Get the most valuable crates out first.

success.text: You haul crates through smoke and sparks. The seal remains intact, and so does your job.

fail.text: A beam falls as you drag a crate free. Pain blooms and you drop what you tried to save.

outcomes.title: Claim Insurance
outcomes.desc: Let it burn and prepare the paperwork.

success.text: You make sure the record reads "unavoidable." The payout will be slow, but real—if no one questions your timing.

fail.text: A worker sees you writing instead of helping. Their accusation turns the crowd against you in seconds.

name: A Quiet House Offer
prompt: A person with no visible weapon offers you a "retainer." "We solve problems," they say. "You look like you have many."

outcomes.title: Accept the Retainer
outcomes.desc: Take their help—and their leash.

success.text: They hand you a folded token. Doors open that shouldn’t. People hesitate that shouldn’t. You feel powerful—and uneasy.

fail.text: Their help draws attention. Someone decides you’re involved in something bigger than you are.

outcomes.title: Refuse Cleanly
outcomes.desc: Say no without making them curious.

success.text: You refuse with calm, not fear. They nod once and disappear. You suspect you passed a test you didn’t know you were taking.

fail.text: Your refusal sounds like judgment. Later, a small inconvenience turns into a big one, as if someone wants you to regret your choice.

outcomes.title: Expose Them
outcomes.desc: Bring the offer to League authorities.

success.text: A clerk-captain listens carefully and takes your report. For a time, the Quiet Houses avoid you—cautious of your reach.

fail.text: The messenger is intercepted. You feel a hard blow in an alley and realize you’ve started a war you can’t see.

name: Gate Tariffs
prompt: A toll-gate captain flips through manifests and slows your caravan on purpose. "Paperwork," he says, smiling. "Very important."

outcomes.title: Present Perfect Papers
outcomes.desc: Out-ink the obstruction.

success.text: Your manifest is immaculate. The captain’s smile fades as he waves you through.

fail.text: He finds a technicality anyway. You pay more than you should just to move.

outcomes.title: Pay the "Fee"
outcomes.desc: Buy speed the way everyone does.

success.text: Coin changes hands and the gate opens. Everyone pretends this is normal.

fail.text: He takes coin and delays you anyway, just to show he can.

outcomes.title: Find Another Way
outcomes.desc: Use side roads and quiet crossings.

success.text: You bypass the gate and learn a route the captain can’t tax. That knowledge is worth keeping.

fail.text: The side road is longer than it looks. Supplies thin, tempers thin, and hunger arrives like a verdict.

name: A Mercenary Writ
prompt: A mercenary captain offers escort—if you can produce a writ that proves they’re paid and protected. Without it, they’re just bandits with banners.

outcomes.title: Negotiate the Writ
outcomes.desc: Put terms in writing that protect you more than they protect them.

success.text: You draft terms that limit "accidents" and define payment clearly. The captain grumbles, then signs.

fail.text: Your terms offend. The captain calls you a coward with ink and walks away, loudly.

outcomes.title: Pay Up Front
outcomes.desc: Buy certainty with coin.

success.text: The captain pockets the payment and keeps their word. For once, coin does exactly what you want it to.

fail.text: You pay, and the service is half-hearted. You realize too late that “escort” can mean “watch you.”

outcomes.title: Threaten Legal Consequence
outcomes.desc: Make it clear that breaking terms will bring the League’s teeth.

success.text: The captain hears authority in your voice and chooses the safer profit. You gain a reputation for being hard to cheat.

fail.text: The captain hears insult. "You think I fear paper?" The tension turns dangerous fast.

name: Old Crew, New Trouble
prompt: You recognize the voice before you recognize the face. Someone from your old crew has found you—and they want something.

outcomes.title: Hear Them Out
outcomes.desc: Let them speak. Trouble is easier to manage when you can name it.

success.text: They offer a job, but more importantly, they offer information: who’s hunting whom, and why the roads feel tighter this season.

fail.text: The meeting is seen. A passerby remembers your face, and memory becomes accusation.

outcomes.title: Take the Job
outcomes.desc: Say yes. Take the risk for a faster payoff.

success.text: The score is clean and quick. You leave with coin and a new knot of obligation.

fail.text: It goes loud. Steel flashes, someone bleeds, and your name becomes a thing people shout.

outcomes.title: Cut Them Loose
outcomes.desc: Make it clear you’re not theirs anymore.

success.text: You refuse firmly and walk away without flinching. That takes a certain kind of courage, and people notice.

fail.text: They don’t like being refused. The lesson is delivered with a shove into a wall and a whispered threat.

name: A Fence’s Offer
prompt: A fence with clean fingernails offers to "move" whatever you can bring. "I don’t ask where it came from," they lie.

outcomes.title: Sell Stolen Goods
outcomes.desc: Turn risk into coin.

success.text: The fence pays fairly—for a thief. You leave richer and more visible.

fail.text: The fence has been watched. When the raid comes, you’re close enough to be counted.

outcomes.title: Ask About a Name
outcomes.desc: Use the meeting to learn who’s buying trouble.

success.text: You trade small talk for useful detail. The fence’s answers give you a map of the city’s hidden appetites.

fail.text: You press too hard. The fence smiles and shuts down. "Careful," they warn. "Curiosity gets priced."

outcomes.title: Walk Away Clean
outcomes.desc: Refuse the deal and refuse the stain.

success.text: You leave without touching the fence’s coin. That choice doesn’t make you pure, but it does make you steadier.

fail.text: You leave, and the fence watches you like a future problem.

name: A Black Mantle’s Question
prompt: A royal investigator in a black mantle stops you in a public place. "A few questions," they say, like it’s a courtesy.

outcomes.title: Answer Carefully
outcomes.desc: Tell the truth that doesn’t ruin you.

success.text: You give them enough to satisfy their curiosity and not enough to hand them your throat. The mantle moves on—for now.

fail.text: You miss a detail, contradict yourself, or flinch at the wrong word. The mantle’s eyes sharpen like a blade.

outcomes.title: Lie Smoothly
outcomes.desc: Build a story that holds under pressure.

success.text: Your lie is tight. The mantle frowns, not convinced, but unable to prove anything in the open.

fail.text: They catch the lie’s seam and tug. Once a mantle decides you’re hiding something, they never stop pulling.

outcomes.title: Slip Away
outcomes.desc: Use the crowd as cover and vanish.

success.text: You disappear into the press of bodies. The mantle is good, but not omniscient.

fail.text: A hand catches your sleeve. Now it’s a chase, and chases become warrants.

name: Cache in the Brush
prompt: An old marker—three stones stacked like a crooked crown—means a cache nearby. You buried it years ago, when you still trusted the road.

outcomes.title: Dig It Up
outcomes.desc: Retrieve what you hid and accept whatever it has become.

success.text: You find a wrapped bundle: a little coin, a clean blade, and dry food. Past-you did a kindness for present-you.

fail.text: The ground has shifted. A hidden nail tears your palm as you pry the bundle free.

outcomes.title: Check for a Trap
outcomes.desc: Assume someone found it first—and left a surprise.

success.text: You spot the tell: disturbed soil, too neat. You recover the cache without springing the lesson.

fail.text: You overthink it and waste the day. You leave with nothing but paranoia and a stiff back.

outcomes.title: Leave It Buried
outcomes.desc: Decide the past can stay underground.

success.text: You walk on. Some caches are safer as memories.

fail.text: You walk on, and wonder later if you were wise or afraid.

name: Blood Price
prompt: A stranger blocks your path and names a person you once wronged. "They paid me," the stranger says. "So either you pay, or you bleed."

outcomes.title: Pay the Price
outcomes.desc: Buy peace with coin.

success.text: You pay and the stranger leaves. It hurts, but it’s done.

fail.text: You pay and they ask for more. Extortion smells your fear.

outcomes.title: Fight for Your Breath
outcomes.desc: End it quickly.

success.text: You drop them hard enough that the road goes quiet again. You leave before anyone decides to ask questions.

fail.text: They land a cut that matters. You win your space, but you don’t win clean.

outcomes.title: Turn It Around
outcomes.desc: Make them regret taking the contract.

success.text: You break their confidence before you break their stance. They back away, and you leave with the knowledge of who hired them.

fail.text: The threat escalates into violence that draws attention. A witness runs for the watch.

name: A Broken Lance
prompt: Your lance splinters in practice, or in the last skirmish. A hedge knight’s tools are their livelihood—and yours just failed.

outcomes.title: Patch It
outcomes.desc: Make do: bind, brace, and trust your craft.

success.text: The repair holds. It won’t win you a tourney, but it will keep you alive.

fail.text: The patch fails at the worst moment and someone laughs. Hedge knights survive on reputation as much as steel.

outcomes.title: Buy New
outcomes.desc: Pay a smith for a proper weapon.

success.text: The new lance is straight, balanced, and honest. It feels like breathing easier.

fail.text: The price is higher than you hoped. You pay anyway.

outcomes.title: Fight Without It
outcomes.desc: Carry on. Pride is sometimes survival.

success.text: You adapt and win anyway. People remember that kind of grit.

fail.text: You go in under-armed and pay for it in blood.

name: A Village Plea
prompt: A hamlet begs for help against bandits. They can’t pay much—only food, shelter, and whatever gratitude is worth.

outcomes.title: Defend Them
outcomes.desc: Stand watch and meet violence when it comes.

success.text: You drive the bandits off with bruises and steel. The villagers speak your name like it’s a prayer.

fail.text: You are outnumbered. You survive, but not cleanly, and the village learns the cost of asking.

outcomes.title: Train Their Militia
outcomes.desc: Turn fear into competence.

success.text: You teach them how to stand, how to shout, how to hold. It isn’t perfect, but it’s enough.

fail.text: They don’t listen. When the bandits come, the village blames you for false confidence.

outcomes.title: Decline and Move On
outcomes.desc: You are not a lord. You are not their shield. Keep traveling.

success.text: You give them directions to safer roads and leave a little coin. It isn’t heroism, but it’s not nothing.

fail.text: You leave with nothing offered. The look on their faces follows you longer than it should.

name: A Patron’s Offer
prompt: A minor lord offers you a badge and a purse. "Serve me," they say, "and you’ll never sleep hungry again." The smile suggests a second clause.

outcomes.title: Accept the Badge
outcomes.desc: Take the patronage and the obligations that come with it.

success.text: You accept. The purse is real. So is the expectation that you will do unpleasant work when asked.

fail.text: You accept and immediately feel the leash tighten. The lord speaks your first task softly, like a confession.

outcomes.title: Negotiate Terms
outcomes.desc: Demand clarity: pay, limits, and what "service" actually means.

success.text: You get the terms in writing. The lord is offended, but you’ve bought yourself a spine made of ink.

fail.text: The lord decides you’re difficult and withdraws the offer. Worse: they make it sound like you begged.

outcomes.title: Refuse
outcomes.desc: Walk away before you become someone else’s weapon.

success.text: You refuse without insult. You keep your freedom, even if it tastes like hunger sometimes.

fail.text: The lord’s pride is stung. You leave, but you feel the weight of being remembered.

name: Challenge at the Ford
prompt: A mailed rider blocks a ford and declares it "their" crossing. They want coin, or they want a fight—mostly they want to be seen winning.

outcomes.title: Cross Blades
outcomes.desc: Give them the show they want and take the ford by force.

success.text: You beat them cleanly enough that the crowd can’t argue. The ford becomes yours by right of victory.

fail.text: They land a lucky hit. The crowd cheers anyway, and you bleed while they bow.

outcomes.title: Out-Talk Them
outcomes.desc: Make the rider look ridiculous without drawing steel.

success.text: You question their claim until it collapses. The crowd laughs, and laughter is a sharper weapon than most admit.

fail.text: They take your words as insult and escalate. Now it’s a fight anyway—and you look like the one who started it.

outcomes.title: Pay and Pass
outcomes.desc: Lose a little coin to avoid a bigger price.

success.text: You pay and move on. Pride heals slower than wounds, but you keep your skin intact.

fail.text: You pay and they demand more. Extortion is a hungry animal.

name: Campfire Vows
prompt: At a shared camp, soldiers and travelers trade stories. Someone asks, half-mocking: "What do you actually stand for, hedge knight?"

outcomes.title: Speak Your Vow
outcomes.desc: Answer plainly and let the vow be judged.

success.text: You speak your vow without flourish. The camp grows quiet for a moment, as if even cynics want something to believe in.

fail.text: Someone laughs at the vow and you feel foolish for caring. The laughter travels easier than the truth.

outcomes.title: Spin a Better Story
outcomes.desc: Make them admire you, whether it’s true or not.

success.text: You turn your life into a legend. People offer you space by the fire as if it means something.

fail.text: Your story contradicts something a veteran knows. The look they give you is worse than a shout.

outcomes.title: Keep Silent
outcomes.desc: Let them fill the silence with their assumptions.

success.text: You listen instead of speak, and learn who hates whom, who’s hungry, and who’s lying about being brave.

fail.text: You listen. You learn. And you say nothing.

name: Waymarkers Moved
prompt: Someone has moved the stone waymarkers—just a handspan, but enough to send a caravan into bad ground. Either it’s malice, or a mistake that kills.

outcomes.title: Read the Ground
outcomes.desc: Use wind, slope, and hard-won instinct to find the true path.

success.text: You spot the subtle tells and correct course. The caravan keeps its water, and so do you.

fail.text: You choose wrong. The detour eats time and water until hunger starts bargaining with your pride.

outcomes.title: Follow the Saboteur
outcomes.desc: Assume it was done on purpose and hunt the hand that did it.

success.text: You find bootprints and a cut rope. The saboteur flees when you corner them, leaving behind a token that names their patron.

fail.text: You catch them—but they catch you back. A knife slips, and blood stains the sand.

outcomes.title: Reset the Stones and Move
outcomes.desc: Fix it fast and keep the caravan calm.

success.text: You heave stones into place until your shoulders burn. The road becomes legible again.

fail.text: You rush and leave one stone wrong. You don’t notice until the sun is lower than it should be.

name: Teeth of the Sandstorm
prompt: A sandstorm rises like a wall. You have minutes to choose: push through, shelter, or cut weight and run.

outcomes.title: Push Through
outcomes.desc: Keep moving and trust your strength to beat the storm.

success.text: You drag yourself and your gear through grit and howl. When the storm passes, you’re still on the right side of it.

fail.text: The storm wins. Sand scours your skin raw, and you crawl out with less water than you had going in.

outcomes.title: Find Shelter
outcomes.desc: Use your eyes: lee side, rock, hollow—anything.

success.text: You find a break in the land and wait it out. You lose time, not lives.

fail.text: Your shelter is shallow. The storm still reaches you, and you spend the night coughing sand.

outcomes.title: Cut Weight
outcomes.desc: Drop cargo, keep water, save the people.

success.text: You order what to throw and what to keep. The caravan survives. The merchants remember what you sacrificed.

fail.text: A merchant refuses and fights you. The delay costs you more than the cargo ever would have.

name: The Water Ledger
prompt: At a well, a steward reads from a water ledger: who may draw, how much, and what price. The numbers don’t match the crowd’s thirst.

outcomes.title: Argue the Law
outcomes.desc: Cite treaty and precedent until the steward must listen.

success.text: You speak in the language of wells: rights, seasons, and debt. The steward relents enough to keep tempers from turning violent.

fail.text: The steward dismisses you publicly. The crowd’s anger turns sideways—toward you.

outcomes.title: Forge a Tally Mark
outcomes.desc: Make the ledger say what people need it to say.

success.text: A small mark becomes water in real hands. You feel clever and guilty at the same time.

fail.text: A ledger-keeper catches the altered line. Now it’s not mercy—it’s fraud.

outcomes.title: Pay for Extra Draw
outcomes.desc: Buy water the way the powerful do: with coin.

success.text: The steward counts your coin and opens the rope. Water fills skins. Problems stay asleep for another day.

fail.text: The price is higher than you expected. You pay anyway.

name: A Rival Caravan
prompt: A rival caravan travels the same route. Their scout watches you with a smile that says they’d love to see you lost.

outcomes.title: Race Them
outcomes.desc: Take the lead and keep it through grit and heat.

success.text: You push the pace and outread the terrain. Their wagon line fades behind you like a bad omen.

fail.text: You push too hard. By night, your legs cramp and your temper frays.

outcomes.title: Sabotage Quietly
outcomes.desc: Make their route choices worse without letting them know you did it.

success.text: A shifted marker, a false rumor, a cut strap. They lose daylight and you gain distance.

fail.text: They catch you at the act. Now the rivalry becomes a feud, and feuds attract knives.

outcomes.title: Offer an Alliance
outcomes.desc: Share hazard knowledge and split costs for safety.

success.text: You propose terms that benefit both. The rival scout agrees, and the desert feels a little less hungry for a day.

fail.text: They laugh at you in front of their crew. The insult stings more than the heat.

name: Mirage Well
prompt: A guide swears there’s a well beyond the dune. Another guide swears it’s a mirage that kills fools. Both swear with confidence.

outcomes.title: Test the Claim
outcomes.desc: Use signs: birds, tracks, salt, and wind.

success.text: You read the land correctly and find water where others would find only death. The relief is almost holy.

fail.text: You follow signs that lie. The well isn’t there, and your water runs low fast.

outcomes.title: Trust the Guide
outcomes.desc: Choose one voice and commit.

success.text: You pick a guide and stick to it. Your certainty keeps the group moving when hesitation would stall you.

fail.text: Your certainty proves misplaced. The group’s anger looks for a target, and you’re convenient.

outcomes.title: Pay for Certainty
outcomes.desc: Hire both guides and make them argue in front of you until the truth emerges.

success.text: The dispute reveals a detail neither mentioned openly: the well exists, but it’s watched by raiders. Now you can prepare.

fail.text: You pay and still get half-truths. Guides lie best when paid to sound confident.

name: Fate Knot II: The Border Duel
prompt: At thirty-five, you’re no longer a promising blade—you’re a known quantity. Word reaches you at Briarwatch: two houses argue over a strip of riverland, and the quarrel is about to become a feud. The Black Mantles want it ended before it spills into open raids. A messenger offers you a choice dressed as an honor: stand as champion, or find another way to stop the blood.

outcomes.title: Stand for the Law
outcomes.desc: Accept the mantle’s writ and fight as the realm’s hand, not your own.

success.text: You win clean and loud. The feud bends around you like water around stone. The Mantles mark your name as ‘useful’—a dangerous kind of praise.

fail.text: You fight well, but not well enough. The loss becomes a story people retell, and stories pick sides without asking.

outcomes.title: Broker Terms at Swordpoint
outcomes.desc: Hold the duel in check and force both houses into a binding settlement.

success.text: You turn rage into signatures. Neither side likes you for it, but both obey. For now.

fail.text: They call you a coward wearing a judge’s mask. The feud continues—and your name becomes part of it.

outcomes.title: Pay for Peace
outcomes.desc: Buy the wergild yourself and end the feud with coin, not corpses.

success.text: You spend heavily, and the riverland stays quiet. You’ve bought peace—along with the expectation that you’ll buy it again.

fail.text: You pay, and still they spit on the offer. Coin can’t purchase honor that’s already been sold.

outcomes.title: Take the Hidden Offer
outcomes.desc: Accept a private bribe to ‘lose’ at the right moment and let the stronger house seize the land.

success.text: You fall exactly when you mean to. The bribe is heavy, and the lie is heavier. Someone saw too much.

fail.text: You’re caught before the first blade rings. The Mantles don’t accuse; they simply remember.

name: Fate Knot II: The Black Pike Offer
prompt: You’ve built a reputation with your hands and your nerve. At Marrowgate, a mercenary captain offers you a place at the table—real pay, real men, and a job that will stain you permanently. The target is ‘a problem’ for a patron. The captain doesn’t ask if you can do it. He asks how you want to be paid.

outcomes.title: Take the Job as Offered
outcomes.desc: Lead the strike and let the captain handle the ethics—if any exist.

success.text: You hit hard and leave nothing that can testify. The purse is heavy. The city feels narrower afterward.

fail.text: The target lives long enough to name you. The captain vanishes. The law does not.

outcomes.title: Turn the Knife Sideways
outcomes.desc: Threaten the patron into paying you to walk away—and keep the secret.

success.text: You sell restraint like it’s mercy. The patron pays, furious and afraid. You keep the proof.

fail.text: They call your bluff. Suddenly you’re the one being negotiated.

outcomes.title: Refuse the Blood
outcomes.desc: Walk away—loudly enough that people know you drew a line.

success.text: You leave the table and the room goes cold. Later, someone you’ve helped before remembers you. That memory is worth more than coin—sometimes.

fail.text: The captain takes your refusal as insult. ‘Accidents’ happen in Marrowgate.

outcomes.title: Bring It to the Mantles
outcomes.desc: Trade the captain’s contract for protection and leverage.

success.text: You hand the Mantles what they crave: a clean chain of blame. They give you a nod that means you’re now part of their world.

fail.text: Your evidence ‘misplaces itself.’ The captain smiles as if you’ve told him a joke.

name: Fate Knot II: The Contract Audit
prompt: At thirty-five, you can smell a lie in ink. In Kestrelbank, a contract court summons you as ‘an interested party’—a polite phrase that means someone is about to be ruined. The ledger is wrong, but wrong in a way that looks deliberate. A quiet-house broker offers you a shortcut. The clerk offers you time. The crowd offers you a villain.

outcomes.title: Publish the True Ledger
outcomes.desc: Lay out the numbers in open court and let the truth do what it does.

success.text: You read the proof aloud and the room shifts. The judge cannot ignore it. People who trade in certainty begin trading in you.

fail.text: You miss one step in the chain. That’s all they need. The court laughs and calls it ‘ambition.’

outcomes.title: Offer Mercy in Private
outcomes.desc: Use the evidence to force repayment without a public hanging.

success.text: You close the door and speak softly. The debtor agrees, trembling. You’ve saved a life—and gained a lever.

fail.text: They hear only threat. They run. Now it’s public, and you are blamed for the chase.

outcomes.title: Alter the Entry
outcomes.desc: Change one line so the blame lands elsewhere.

success.text: One line becomes a knife. Someone else bleeds. You are paid for ‘helping.’

fail.text: The clerk catches the movement of your hand. Their face goes flat—worse than anger.

outcomes.title: Sell the Findings
outcomes.desc: Auction the evidence to the highest bidder and walk away richer.

success.text: You name a price and they pay it. The court’s outcome changes, and no one asks why—because everyone knows.

fail.text: Two bidders decide you’re the easiest thing to remove from the room.

name: Fate Knot II: The Missing Seal
prompt: A courier brings you a sealed packet—and then admits the seal is missing. In the Collegium’s shadow, that means the document is either worthless or priceless. A Keybearer offers you a choice: restore the seal with a convincing forgery, or deliver the packet as evidence of sabotage. Either way, someone will be named a traitor.

outcomes.title: Forge a Perfect Seal
outcomes.desc: Make the lie so clean it feels like truth.

success.text: Your hand is steady. The seal ‘returns.’ The packet moves, the plot advances, and you are paid for being the kind of person who can fix reality.

fail.text: The wax cracks wrong. A true archivist can smell it. Now you are the story.

outcomes.title: Expose the Saboteur
outcomes.desc: Bring the missing seal to light and force an investigation.

success.text: You frame it as an attack on order, not a scandal. The Collegium closes ranks—and opens a door for you.

fail.text: They call it gossip. The Keybearer withdraws their offer. You are left holding nothing but suspicion.

outcomes.title: Sell the Packet
outcomes.desc: Trade it to a rival archive for a fortune and a new name.

success.text: You vanish the packet from history. Someone else pays you to write a new one.

fail.text: A Keybearer steps out of the dark like they’ve been there the whole time.

outcomes.title: Refuse and Walk
outcomes.desc: Let the Collegium eat itself. Keep your hands clean—this time.

success.text: You leave the packet on the table and step away. You’ve refused power, and that refusal is its own kind of power.

fail.text: They decide refusal is an admission. Rumor does the rest.

name: Fate Knot II: The Watcher’s Oath
prompt: Thornmere’s lake fog hides a hundred small crimes. A Black Mantle offers you a watcher’s badge: not a title, but a permission to move unseen. ‘We need someone who can go where law cannot,’ they say. The badge is a ladder. It is also a leash.

outcomes.title: Take the Badge
outcomes.desc: Accept the Mantle’s authority and work in the seams of the law.

success.text: You take the badge and feel the city open like a lock. People lie to you with new respect.

fail.text: A rival watcher spots you and decides to test your worth. The badge doesn’t protect you from other knives.

outcomes.title: Steal Back the Evidence
outcomes.desc: Recover what was taken without leaving bodies behind.

success.text: You return the proof to the right hands and no one can say how. In a city of noise, silence becomes your signature.

fail.text: You’re seen. Not caught—worse. Seen. Now someone knows your face belongs to trouble.

outcomes.title: Plant a Decoy
outcomes.desc: Frame a convenient culprit and let the court feel ‘safe.’

success.text: You give them a villain and they thank you for it. The truth stays buried, and you are paid in comfort.

fail.text: The decoy breaks, and the blame flips back onto the one holding the string.

outcomes.title: Refuse the Leash
outcomes.desc: Keep your freedom, even if it costs you a seat at the table.

success.text: You hand the badge back. The Mantle’s eyes go cold, but you leave with your name intact.

fail.text: They decide you know too much to be ‘free.’

name: Fate Knot II: The Night Market Debt
prompt: The Night Market remembers every favor and every failure. A broker with lacquered nails claims you owe for a job from years ago—whether you recall it or not. The debt can be paid in coin, secrets, or a name. The crowd waits, eager for spectacle.

outcomes.title: Pay in Secrets
outcomes.desc: Hand over something true and ugly to settle the account.

success.text: You trade a truth that hurts someone else. The broker smiles, satisfied. Your debt is gone. The stain remains.

fail.text: Your ‘secret’ is already known. The broker laughs, and the Market turns its eyes on you.

outcomes.title: Pay in Coin
outcomes.desc: Buy your way out—if you can.

success.text: You pay. The Market accepts coin the way a wolf accepts meat: gratefully and without affection.

fail.text: You come up short. The broker names the remainder: ‘a person.’

outcomes.title: Pay in a Name
outcomes.desc: Offer someone else as the Market’s entertainment.

success.text: You speak a name and feel the room drink it in. The debt is paid. A new enemy is born somewhere you can’t see.

fail.text: The crowd decides your name is more interesting.

outcomes.title: Break the Broker’s Hold
outcomes.desc: Turn the Market’s rules against the broker and walk out owing nothing.

success.text: You refuse the script, and the crowd loves you for it. The broker’s smile cracks. You leave with your pride—and a few new whispers at your back.

fail.text: The Market doesn’t like people who refuse to play.

name: Fate Knot II: Widow’s Market Petition
prompt: At High Valewyr’s Widow’s Market, grief and commerce sit at the same table. A line of petitioners forms when they recognize you. A noble’s steward offers you a ‘gift’ to make the line disappear. A Candlekeeper asks you to hear one case that will anger powerful people either way.

outcomes.title: Hold a Fair Hearing
outcomes.desc: Hear the case publicly and force the court to witness it.

success.text: You make the market go quiet. People listen because you insist they do. The steward’s smile fades; the petitioners’ eyes brighten.

fail.text: Your words land wrong, and the crowd turns uncertain. The steward seizes the moment and calls you ‘unfit.’

outcomes.title: Settle It Quietly
outcomes.desc: Resolve the case in private, where mercy is possible and spectacle is not.

success.text: You trade public victory for private repair. The Candlekeeper nods. The steward counts the cost and looks away.

fail.text: Private justice becomes private rumor. The court eats rumor like bread.

outcomes.title: Take the Steward’s Gift
outcomes.desc: Accept the bribe and reshape the outcome.

success.text: You accept the ‘gift’ and the line thins. The steward smiles like you’ve joined a club you didn’t want to exist.

fail.text: Someone sees the exchange. They don’t shout. They write.

outcomes.title: Let the Market Burn
outcomes.desc: Refuse all of it and walk away before you’re used.

success.text: You leave them to their rituals. It costs you influence. It buys you sleep.

fail.text: Walking away makes enemies, too—just quieter ones.

name: Fate Knot II: The Quiet Pardon
prompt: A noble in Thornmere offers you a pardon—quiet, unofficial, effective. In exchange, you will erase a name from the record and make a rival look guilty. The parchment is already half-signed. All that remains is your hand.

outcomes.title: Erase the Name
outcomes.desc: Finish the parchment and make the past disappear for the right price.

success.text: You strike the name and feel the world shift as if it never existed. The noble pays you and calls it ‘service.’

fail.text: The ink blots. The clerk notices. Now the pardon looks like a crime with your fingerprints.

outcomes.title: Force It Into the Open
outcomes.desc: Turn the offer into a public scandal and make the noble defend it.

success.text: You bring witnesses. The noble backs down, furious. The court likes you less. The city likes you more.

fail.text: The noble’s men decide you won’t be a problem much longer.

outcomes.title: Take the Pardon and Run
outcomes.desc: Accept, vanish, and let the court argue with smoke.

success.text: You take the parchment and disappear. The noble is satisfied—until they aren’t.

fail.text: You’re stopped at the door. The pardon becomes evidence against you.

outcomes.title: Refuse the Offer
outcomes.desc: Say no and dare them to punish you for it.

success.text: You refuse. The noble’s smile dies. You leave alive, which is more than many get.

fail.text: They punish you the way nobles do: with quiet doors closing.

name: Fate Knot II: The Basin Oath
prompt: At Larkhallow, the hospice is full and the candle-rite never ends. A Prior asks you to take the Basin Oath—to become a public witness for mercy in a season when mercy is unpopular. A merchant offers to fund the wards if you’ll ‘reclassify’ a few deaths. Everyone calls it survival. Someone calls it rot.

outcomes.title: Take the Basin Oath
outcomes.desc: Swear publicly and bind yourself to the Synod’s witness.

success.text: You swear. The wards breathe easier. The city grumbles, but it obeys.

fail.text: You swear and the city spits on the vow. Mercy becomes a target.

outcomes.title: Keep the Ledger Clean
outcomes.desc: Refuse the merchant and record the deaths as they are.

success.text: The truth goes into the book, and the book survives you. People who care about truth begin to look for you.

fail.text: The merchant calls you ‘difficult’—and difficult people get moved to the worst wards.

outcomes.title: Take the Funding
outcomes.desc: Accept the deal. Save the living. Lie for the dead.

success.text: The wards fill with supplies. The ledger fills with lies. At night, the candles burn strangely.

fail.text: Your lie is caught, and the funding becomes accusation.

outcomes.title: Step Away
outcomes.desc: Refuse the oath, refuse the merchant, and leave before it ruins you.

success.text: You leave with your conscience and your life. You’re not sure you can keep both forever.

fail.text: The Synod calls it abandonment. Some doors close behind you.

name: Fate Knot II: The Miracle for Sale
prompt: A relic at Verdemont ‘works’—people say it does. The Thorn Choir wants it carried into the towns to heal and convert. A factor from the League wants it insured, appraised, and toured. The Prior wants it locked away. In the candlelight, the relic hums like a held breath.

outcomes.title: Tour the Relic
outcomes.desc: Turn faith into profit and profit into protection.

success.text: The crowds come. The coin comes. The stories grow teeth. The relic doesn’t feel pleased.

fail.text: A ‘miracle’ fails in public. The crowd’s hope turns into rage.

outcomes.title: Lock It Away
outcomes.desc: Refuse the spectacle and keep the relic from becoming a weapon.

success.text: You seal the reliquary and dare anyone to break it. The Choir hates you. The quiet sick thank you.

fail.text: Someone steals it anyway, and you are blamed for being ‘too cautious.’

outcomes.title: Sell a Slice of Hope
outcomes.desc: Trade access to the relic for secrets and favors.

success.text: People will confess anything if they think it will save them. You listen, and you keep the useful parts.

fail.text: A confession becomes an accusation. Now the Choir has your name in their mouths.

outcomes.title: Follow the Choir
outcomes.desc: Carry it yourself and be the witness—whatever it costs.

success.text: You carry the reliquary through cold streets and hotter fear. People believe because you don’t look away.

fail.text: You collapse under the weight, and the relic’s ‘witness’ becomes rumor.

name: Fate Knot III: The Oathstone Victory
prompt: At Skarnhold, the oathstone plaza fills with ringclans and rivals. They want the old proof: a final contest, a final showing that you deserve the respect you’ve collected. You can take the duel, take the bargain, or take your leave. Whatever you choose, it will be remembered as the shape of your ending.

outcomes.title: Win the Final Duel
outcomes.desc: Take the challenge and end the arguments with a clean victory.

success.text: You win, and the crowd roars like a living thing. The ringclans treat your name as a fact, not a claim.

fail.text: You lose in a way that still earns respect—until the pain reminds you what respect costs.

outcomes.title: Bind the Clans to Your Heir
outcomes.desc: Turn your earned status into protection for the next ruler.

success.text: You speak names, terms, and promises. The oaths land. Your heir inherits more than blood—they inherit witnesses.

fail.text: They argue, loudly. Your authority cracks at the worst moment.

outcomes.title: Spend for Peace
outcomes.desc: Pay the wergilds, stock the pass, and buy a quieter legacy.

success.text: You spend coin like a promise. The mountain accepts it, for now.

fail.text: You spend and still fall short. Winter collects what coin cannot cover.

outcomes.title: Walk Away While You Can
outcomes.desc: Leave before pride turns your last chapter into a grave.

success.text: You leave alive. Some call it cowardice. The people who love you call it wisdom.

fail.text: They take your withdrawal as insult. The last chapter becomes a fight anyway.

name: Fate Knot III: The Blood-Price
prompt: The border remembers what you’ve done. A family you wronged—or a clan you betrayed—arrives with a simple demand: blood-price. They don’t want coin; they want a public payment. You can meet it, dodge it, or make it worse. Either way, this is the kind of story that outlives everyone involved.

outcomes.title: Pay the Blood-Price
outcomes.desc: Give coin and apology in front of witnesses, and accept the shame.

success.text: You pay. You bow. The crowd doesn’t forgive, but it moves on. Moving on is a rare gift.

fail.text: They reject the payment. The crowd smells weakness.

outcomes.title: Fight the Claim
outcomes.desc: Refuse the price and try to win your way out of it.

success.text: You win the clash, but the victory is poison. The family leaves broken. The law takes note.

fail.text: You’re wounded and dragged from the mud. The family names you in front of everyone who matters.

outcomes.title: Disappear into the Pass
outcomes.desc: Vanishing is a kind of ending. Make it yours.

success.text: You vanish before dawn. The family gets no closure. The border gets a ghost story.

fail.text: They were waiting. Someone always is.

outcomes.title: Buy Their Silence
outcomes.desc: Pay twice: once in coin, once in secrets.

success.text: You pay them enough to stop talking, and you pay yourself by burying the record. It works—until someone digs.

fail.text: They take your coin and keep talking anyway.

name: Fate Knot III: The Final Chronicle
prompt: In Greyvault, an Archivist offers you a last commission: write the official chronicle of a decade, the version future courts will cite as ‘what happened.’ You can write it clean, write it kind, or write it sharp enough to wound. You can also refuse—and let someone else write you into their story.

outcomes.title: Write the True Record
outcomes.desc: Set down what happened with names, dates, and receipts.

success.text: The chronicle lands like a hammer. Powerful people hate it. The archive respects it. Respect is a rarer currency.

fail.text: You miss a thread. The Revisionists seize the gap and replace your truth with something useful.

outcomes.title: Write Mercy Into History
outcomes.desc: Protect the innocent by softening the sharp edges—without lying.

success.text: You write with restraint. The guilty remain guilty, but the vulnerable are not sacrificed for clarity.

fail.text: They call it cowardice. The archive shelves it in the wrong place, where no one will find it.

outcomes.title: Weaponize the Chronicle
outcomes.desc: Turn your writing into a blade and aim it.

success.text: You plant a truth that will detonate later. Someone will fall. You won’t be there when it happens.

fail.text: The Archivist sees the twist and closes the book in your face.

outcomes.title: Refuse the Commission
outcomes.desc: Keep your hands out of history’s machinery.

success.text: You refuse. The Archivist nods once, as if you’ve passed a test you didn’t know you were taking.

fail.text: Refusal is interpreted as guilt. Rumor writes you anyway.

name: Fate Knot III: The Forged Testament
prompt: A dying broker in Marrowgate offers you a final job: forge a testament that will move an estate, rewrite obligations, and shuffle heirs like cards. It will make you rich. It will also make you a ghost in every ledger that matters. This is the kind of work that becomes a curse even if it succeeds.

outcomes.title: Write the Forgery
outcomes.desc: Put your whole craft into the lie and make it sing.

success.text: The testament passes inspection. An heir loses everything in a single afternoon. You are paid before the ink dries.

fail.text: A clerk catches the inconsistency. The broker dies. You’re left holding the blame.

outcomes.title: Sell the Pattern
outcomes.desc: Don’t forge it yourself—sell the method to someone hungrier.

success.text: You sell the template and keep your hands clean enough to deny it. Denial is thin armor, but it’s armor.

fail.text: The buyer decides the easiest witness to remove is you.

outcomes.title: Confess to Save a Life
outcomes.desc: Trade the broker’s scheme for a reduced sentence and a cleaner legacy.

success.text: You confess before the ledger can. The court punishes you, but it cannot pretend you didn’t do the right thing at the end.

fail.text: They call it ‘strategy’ and punish you anyway. The confession buys nothing.

outcomes.title: Burn the Papers
outcomes.desc: Destroy everything and walk away poorer but harder to trace.

success.text: You burn the proof. The broker’s scheme dies with him. The emptiness in your purse is real, but so is the silence.

fail.text: Someone interrupts the fire. Now you’re a thief as well as a liar.

name: Fate Knot III: The Clean Exit
prompt: You’ve lived in the cracks between truth and convenience. Now the crack widens into a door: a chance to retire clean. A Mantle offers a quiet appointment if you surrender certain names. A rival offers coin if you keep them. Your heir watches you with the careful attention of someone learning what ‘legacy’ really means.

outcomes.title: Turn Over the Names
outcomes.desc: Trade your darkest list for a clean life for your heir.

success.text: You hand over the list and feel lighter, like you’ve set down a pack you forgot you were carrying.

fail.text: The Mantle decides your list is incomplete. They want more than you can safely give.

outcomes.title: Leave a Final Warning
outcomes.desc: Use one secret to prevent a future disaster, then walk away.

success.text: You spend a secret like a coin and save people who will never know your name.

fail.text: Your warning is dismissed. The future grinds forward anyway.

outcomes.title: Bind the Network to Your Heir
outcomes.desc: Pass your contacts forward, not your sins.

success.text: You make introductions that will matter after you’re gone. The network shifts, but it holds.

fail.text: A contact refuses, loudly. The network hears the refusal.

outcomes.title: Burn It All
outcomes.desc: Erase your trails completely, even if it costs you everything.

success.text: You cut every thread you can reach. It hurts. It works.

fail.text: You burn the wrong thread and the whole web snaps back at you.

name: Fate Knot III: The Names You Sold
prompt: The Night Market throws you a feast you didn’t ask for. A broker toasts your ‘service’—the names you sold, the doors you opened, the lives you rearranged. The toast is a threat disguised as gratitude. You can lean into the myth, try to undo it, or try to disappear. The Market will remember whichever version you choose.

outcomes.title: Take the Crown of Rumor
outcomes.desc: Accept the Market’s praise and become what they say you are.

success.text: You accept the toast and the room becomes yours. Power like this always comes with a bill.

fail.text: A rival challenges you in public. The Market loves blood in the gutters.

outcomes.title: Undo One Betrayal
outcomes.desc: Spend your last leverage to save someone you sold.

success.text: You pull one person out of the jaws. It doesn’t erase your ledger, but it adds a new line to it.

fail.text: You reach for mercy and find only knives.

outcomes.title: Buy Your Exit
outcomes.desc: Pay the Market to forget you—temporarily.

success.text: You pay, and the Market agrees to forget. Forgetting is never permanent here.

fail.text: You pay and they laugh. The Market doesn’t respect desperation.

outcomes.title: Disappear Into a New Name
outcomes.desc: Leave the Market behind and become a story with no ending.

success.text: You vanish. Someone else wears your old face in rumor, and you let them.

fail.text: A broker steps into your path like they’ve been waiting years.

name: Fate Knot III: The Last Audience
prompt: The Stag Court grants you one final audience. It’s ceremonial, which means it’s dangerous. You can secure your heir’s position, extract a promise, or speak a truth that will ruin you and cleanse the air. The hall is full of people who want you to say the wrong thing.

outcomes.title: Secure the Succession
outcomes.desc: Bind the court to your heir with vows and witnesses.

success.text: You speak with a steadiness that makes dissent feel childish. The court bows—not out of love, but because it must.

fail.text: A rival interrupts at the perfect moment. The room tilts and the audience becomes a trial.

outcomes.title: Extract a Charter
outcomes.desc: Get the Crown to sign a promise your bloodline can cash later.

success.text: The ink sets. The promise becomes paper, and paper becomes a weapon your heirs can wield.

fail.text: The clerk delays ‘for review’ until the moment is gone.

outcomes.title: Speak the Truth
outcomes.desc: Say what no one says in that room, and accept the consequences.

success.text: You speak plainly. The hall goes quiet. Some look away. Some remember you forever for it.

fail.text: They turn your truth into treason with a single sentence.

outcomes.title: Trade Favors for Safety
outcomes.desc: Spend influence now so your heir doesn’t bleed later.

success.text: You cash in favors and move enemies like pieces. It’s not noble. It’s effective.

fail.text: A favor turns sour. The court smiles and sharpens its knives.

name: Fate Knot III: The Broken Writ
prompt: You hold a writ that should have protected you. It didn’t. Now, at Marrowgate’s contract steps, someone offers you a replacement—for a price that will damn your heir or save them. The crowd wants a spectacle. The clerk wants an excuse. The law wants its due.

outcomes.title: Buy the Replacement Writ
outcomes.desc: Pay the clerk and secure a legal shield for your heir.

success.text: The clerk takes your coin and gives you paper that matters. Your heir will inherit the protection—and the debt behind it.

fail.text: The clerk pockets your coin and delays anyway. The crowd laughs. The shield never arrives.

outcomes.title: Forge Your Own
outcomes.desc: Make a writ so convincing that no one dares question it.

success.text: You forge it perfectly. The law bends, briefly, around your craft.

fail.text: The forgery is spotted. The clerk’s smile is a knife.

outcomes.title: Burn the System
outcomes.desc: Expose the corruption and force the city to watch itself.

success.text: You make them look at it. They hate you for it. Some thank you later, quietly.

fail.text: They make you the example: ‘This is what happens to troublemakers.’

outcomes.title: Disappear
outcomes.desc: Leave the courts behind and become uncollectable.

success.text: You vanish into the alleys and the paperwork can’t follow. Your heir inherits freedom and uncertainty.

fail.text: A patrol stops you at the gate.

name: Fate Knot III: The Candle Rite
prompt: At Larkhallow, they ask you to lead the Candle Rite for a season of the dead. It’s an honor and a burden. Your name will be spoken alongside the names of those who didn’t make it. You can turn the rite into public mercy, private healing, or political leverage. All of it will echo in your heir’s life.

outcomes.title: Lead the Rite Publicly
outcomes.desc: Name the dead, name the failures, and demand the living do better.

success.text: Your voice doesn’t break. The city does. And then, slowly, it mends.

fail.text: Your strength falters mid-rite, and people interpret it as doubt.

outcomes.title: Heal in Quiet
outcomes.desc: Use the rite to mend your household and remove what you can carry no longer.

success.text: You keep the rite small. It works. The pain loosens its grip, a little.

fail.text: Quiet healing doesn’t make good politics, and the city ignores it. The hurt stays.

outcomes.title: Turn Confessions into Reform
outcomes.desc: Use what people confess to change the system that made them confess.

success.text: You write reforms with bloodless ink. Some resist. Many obey, because the evidence is undeniable.

fail.text: A powerful family calls you a liar and dares the city to agree.

outcomes.title: Sell the Witness
outcomes.desc: Let the rich buy absolution and fund the wards with their guilt.

success.text: The wards fill. The guilt doesn’t leave—it just changes hands.

fail.text: The scheme is exposed. Now you’re not a witness—you’re a merchant of sin.

name: Fate Knot III: The Last Confession
prompt: They bring you a dying man who keeps saying your name. The abbey wants a confession for the record. The Choir wants a miracle. The League wants the man’s ledger. You know, suddenly and clearly, that your legacy might be decided by what you do with one last breath that isn’t yours.

outcomes.title: Grant Mercy
outcomes.desc: Take the confession, protect the living, and let the dead keep some dignity.

success.text: You hold the dying man’s hand and do what mercy demands. The Choir hates you. The wards remember you kindly.

fail.text: Someone overhears the wrong line and turns it into an accusation against you.

outcomes.title: Take the Ledger
outcomes.desc: Claim the ledger for yourself—truth is leverage.

success.text: You take the ledger and feel the abbey’s air change. Some truths don’t want to be owned.

fail.text: The ledger slips away to another hand. That hand points at you.

outcomes.title: Stage a Miracle
outcomes.desc: Give the Choir what they want and profit from belief.

success.text: The crowd believes. Coin changes hands. The air tastes wrong afterward.

fail.text: The trick fails in the worst possible way: in front of the dying and the desperate.

outcomes.title: Let the Choir Take It
outcomes.desc: Step away and let others decide your legacy for you.

success.text: You step out. The abbey closes its door behind you. You are alive, and you are not sure that’s a victory.

fail.text: They call your withdrawal ‘cowardice’ and write it down as fact.

name: Leaving the Hearth
prompt: The last light of home clings to the doorway as if it can hold you in place. A pack, a few coins, a blessing half-spoken. The road waits like a verdict.

outcomes.title: Leave with a Plan
outcomes.desc: Pick a destination, a trade, and a route that minimizes surprises.

success.text: You choose a road that makes sense and a goal that fits your hands. The first miles are still hard, but they are yours.

fail.text: Your plan turns out to be a story you told yourself. You buy the wrong map, follow the wrong landmark, and pay in small humiliations.

outcomes.title: Walk Out Quietly
outcomes.desc: Avoid goodbyes. Avoid arguments. Just go.

success.text: You slip away before anyone can turn leaving into a fight. In the hush you learn what the village truly feared for you: the names of roads people avoid.

fail.text: Someone sees you leaving and decides to narrate it. By noon the story has teeth, and your name wears them.

outcomes.title: Take the Hard Work
outcomes.desc: Sign onto a cart or crew for food and a place to sleep.

success.text: You lift, haul, and keep your mouth shut when your arms start complaining. The foreman pays you like someone who finished the day.

fail.text: You push too hard to prove you belong. Something in you pulls the wrong way, and the day ends with you shaking from fatigue.

outcomes.title: Borrow What You Need
outcomes.desc: Take a little from home—just enough to start.

success.text: You take from a loose board and replace it carefully. It feels like theft and inheritance at the same time.

fail.text: A hand catches you in the act. No shout, no scene—just a look that says this will be remembered by the wrong person.

name: The Apprentice’s Knot
prompt: In the city’s apprentice quarter, masters glance at your hands the way judges look at evidence. A cord is tied around your wrist—symbolic, temporary, and still a kind of chain.

outcomes.title: Prove Yourself
outcomes.desc: Work clean, fast, and without complaint.

success.text: You do the dull work until the dull work becomes skill. A master nods once, and the nod matters.

fail.text: The hours grind you down. You miss a step, spill a batch, and earn the kind of attention you don’t want.

outcomes.title: Talk Your Way In
outcomes.desc: Sell the story of who you could become.

success.text: You speak like you’ve already survived worse than this. The master laughs, then says, "Fine. Try."

fail.text: Your confidence reads as arrogance. The master’s smile tightens, and the door closes politely.

outcomes.title: Cut a Side Deal
outcomes.desc: Offer a favor, a secret, or a quiet compromise.

success.text: You learn the private want beneath the public rules. The apprenticeship opens—but it opens like a trap door.

fail.text: Your offer is taken, and then expanded. What began as a shortcut becomes a leash.

outcomes.title: Walk Away Proud
outcomes.desc: Refuse the knot and find your own work.

success.text: You refuse to be owned and find day work anyway. People notice a spine that doesn’t bend easily.

fail.text: Pride doesn’t buy bread. By nightfall you’ve spent your last coin just to keep your stomach quiet.

name: Yard Drill
prompt: A sergeant with a voice like gravel lines you up with other young bodies and older fears. "Hold the shield," they say, as if holding is simple.

outcomes.title: Hold the Line
outcomes.desc: Do what you’re told: stance, breath, discipline.

success.text: You take the hit, then the next, and you don’t fold. The sergeant’s approval is a grunt, but it lands like a medal.

fail.text: Your guard drops at the wrong moment. The practice blade still bites, and shame bites harder.

outcomes.title: Study the Veteran
outcomes.desc: Watch feet, timing, and tells between swings.

success.text: You learn the little rules nobody says out loud. Where the weight shifts. When the shoulder lies. The lesson sticks.

fail.text: You overthink while the drill continues. By the end your arms are jelly and your mind is loud.

outcomes.title: Show Off
outcomes.desc: Make it look easy, make them remember you.

success.text: You take a risk at the right time and turn practice into spectacle. A few older eyes follow you afterward.

fail.text: Your flourish becomes a mistake, and the sergeant makes an example of you in front of everyone.

outcomes.title: Slip Out Early
outcomes.desc: Avoid the bruises. Keep your body for something else.

success.text: You vanish between rotations and nobody catches the exact moment you stopped being present.

fail.text: Someone notices your absence the moment orders are called. A petty warrant is easy to write.

name: Market Errand
prompt: A basket in your hands, a list of goods, and too many eyes. In markets like this, you learn quickly who counts coins and who counts teeth.

outcomes.title: Bargain Hard
outcomes.desc: Turn a few coins into more than they should buy.

success.text: You haggle like you mean it. The merchant relents with a sigh that sounds like defeat.

fail.text: You push too far and get called out as a cheat. The crowd laughs, and the laughter lingers.

outcomes.title: Lift What You Need
outcomes.desc: A quick hand, a quick exit.

success.text: You take from a stall that can afford to lose it. Your bag is heavier and your conscience is quieter than expected.

fail.text: A vendor’s shout pins you in place. Guards love simple stories.

outcomes.title: Watch for Trouble
outcomes.desc: Spot the pickpockets and cutters before they spot you.

success.text: You notice the pattern: bump, apology, vanish. You keep your coin and learn who’s working the crowd.

fail.text: You get distracted by the noise and lose a coin you needed.

outcomes.title: Carry It All Alone
outcomes.desc: Refuse help, refuse weakness, refuse the easy way.

success.text: You muscle through the press and bring everything back intact. Someone older nods, approving without words.

fail.text: The load shifts, the strap bites, and you arrive late and trembling from the effort.

name: A Debt at the Door
prompt: A collector arrives with paper too clean for the road and a smile too practiced for mercy. "Your household owes," they say, as if owing is a choice.

outcomes.title: Pay What You Can
outcomes.desc: Offer coin now to buy time later.

success.text: You pay a little and the collector agrees to return later. Later is still coming, but it isn’t today.

fail.text: You pay and it isn’t enough. The paper gains a new line and your name sits beneath it.

outcomes.title: Argue the Paper
outcomes.desc: Make them prove the claim, line by line.

success.text: You find the seam: the wrong seal, the wrong date, the wrong witness. The collector’s confidence wobbles.

fail.text: They smile through your argument and treat your words like noise. The neighbors hear you 'resisting' and judge you for it.

outcomes.title: Threaten Them Off
outcomes.desc: Make the cost of collecting feel higher than the coin.

success.text: You step close enough that the collector reconsiders their courage. They leave with the promise of 'returning.'

fail.text: The collector backs away and calls for guards. You’re not arrested today, but you’re noted.

outcomes.title: Make a Quiet Deal
outcomes.desc: Offer information or service instead of coin.

success.text: You trade something that costs you less than coin—now. The collector leaves satisfied.

fail.text: The deal shifts under your feet. You agree to more than you meant, and now someone expects you to deliver.

name: First Night Watch
prompt: They hand you a lantern and a spear that feels too long for your arms. The dark beyond the palisade listens.

outcomes.title: Stay Sharp
outcomes.desc: Fight sleep and keep scanning the treeline.

success.text: You notice the small things: a distant cough, a misplaced stone, the way fear changes the sound of grass.

fail.text: Your eyes close for a heartbeat too long. When you open them, something is wrong, and you can’t prove what.

outcomes.title: Make Conversation
outcomes.desc: Keep the older guard talking; stories keep you awake.

success.text: You earn a little respect and a name you can use later.

fail.text: You say the wrong thing to the wrong person. The night grows colder with their silence.

outcomes.title: Sneak a Nap
outcomes.desc: Find a corner and trust luck to cover you.

success.text: You sleep in fragments and wake before you’re caught. It feels like stealing time.

fail.text: A captain finds you slumped and furious. Discipline becomes paperwork.

outcomes.title: Chase a Shadow
outcomes.desc: If something moves, you move first.

success.text: You catch a prowler—human, hungry, and more scared than you. You drive them off and keep the post intact.

fail.text: It wasn’t one shadow. Something catches you in the dark and you feel the sting of a fast blade.

name: Harvest Help
prompt: Fields don’t care how young you are. They only care whether you show up. The harvest is thin this year and everyone knows it.

outcomes.title: Work Until Dark
outcomes.desc: Do more than your share, quietly.

success.text: You earn a sack of grain and a quiet kind of gratitude.

fail.text: You push through pain until pain wins. The foreman sends you away with a look that says 'weak.'

outcomes.title: Organize the Line
outcomes.desc: Make the work efficient so nobody wastes energy.

success.text: You turn chaos into rhythm and the harvest comes in cleaner than anyone expected.

fail.text: People resent being managed by someone young. They ignore you, and the day becomes a mess.

outcomes.title: Skim a Little
outcomes.desc: A handful here, a handful there. No one will miss it.

success.text: You pocket enough to matter and keep your face calm.

fail.text: A neighbor sees your hand move. Hunger makes informants out of friends.

outcomes.title: Refuse the Work
outcomes.desc: You’re not a mule. Let someone else break their back.

success.text: You find other work before the day ends. The field still hates you, but your hands don’t blister today.

fail.text: People remember who didn’t show up. When hunger comes, they remember it loudly.

name: Letters by Candle
prompt: A tired scribe offers to teach you letters after hours, if you bring your own candle and don’t waste his patience. Ink smells like power when you’ve never had any.

outcomes.title: Practice Until It Sticks
outcomes.desc: Copy the same line until your hand stops trembling.

success.text: Your letters stop looking like scratches and start looking like meaning. It’s a small door opening.

fail.text: Your eyes blur and your mind slips. The lesson ends with you more frustrated than wiser.

outcomes.title: Charm the Teacher
outcomes.desc: Make him like you enough to teach you the shortcuts.

success.text: You earn patience you didn’t deserve. He teaches you which words matter in contracts and which words are decoration.

fail.text: You misjudge the tone and sound like you’re trying to buy knowledge with flattery. He shuts the book.

outcomes.title: Steal a Primer
outcomes.desc: If you can’t be taught, you’ll teach yourself.

success.text: You take a slim primer and hide it under your shirt. The first lesson is that books are lighter than they look.

fail.text: A clerk catches you with ink-stained fingers near the shelf. Suspicion is as loud as a bell in a quiet hall.

outcomes.title: Earn the Candle Coin
outcomes.desc: Work for the lesson instead of begging for it.

success.text: You haul crates, run messages, and come back with the coin for a candle and the pride of not owing anyone.

fail.text: A hurried run ends in a fall on bad stairs. The bruise is minor; the embarrassment isn’t.

name: Festival Trial
prompt: The festival’s games are meant to keep spirits up, but the prizes are real enough to fight over. Someone your age is already warming up like it’s war.

outcomes.title: Enter the Bout
outcomes.desc: A short spar in the ring, watched by people who pretend it’s harmless.

success.text: You win cleanly, breathless, and the crowd cheers as if cheering changes anything. Still—your name gets repeated.

fail.text: You misjudge an opponent’s reach. Pain flashes, and you learn how thin the line is between sport and injury.

outcomes.title: Solve the Riddle
outcomes.desc: Win with your mind while others swing sticks.

success.text: You answer and the crowd’s laughter turns respectful for half a heartbeat. You catch a hint in the riddle’s wording—someone’s in-joke, someone’s secret.

fail.text: You answer confidently and are wrong. The crowd laughs, and you feel your face burn.

outcomes.title: Fix the Game
outcomes.desc: If the prize matters, make sure you get it.

success.text: A string is cut, a sign is swapped, and the wager goes your way. You leave richer, and watched.

fail.text: The cheat breaks in the open. Accusations fly faster than stones.

outcomes.title: Cheer for Someone Else
outcomes.desc: Back a friend and share the win.

success.text: You build someone up in public and they remember it. In this world, remembered kindness is leverage.

fail.text: Your support draws you into someone else’s rivalry. You lose a coin and gain an enemy you didn’t ask for.

name: Whispers and Blushes
prompt: You catch your own name in someone else’s mouth, attached to a crush, a mistake, a dare. In a small world, nothing stays private long.

outcomes.title: Own the Story
outcomes.desc: Laugh first, so the laughter belongs to you.

success.text: You turn the rumor into a joke you control. People follow the tone you set.

fail.text: You try to make it light and it comes out strained. The rumor sharpens instead of softening.

outcomes.title: Find the Source
outcomes.desc: Track who started it and why.

success.text: You follow the chain and find the hand that pushed it. The motive is petty—and useful to know.

fail.text: You chase the whisper through too many conversations until your nerves feel scraped raw.

outcomes.title: Start a Different Rumor
outcomes.desc: Redirect the fire to a safer target.

success.text: You plant a better story, one that flatters the listeners for believing it. The original rumor loses oxygen.

fail.text: Someone notices your hand on the wheel. Now you’re not just gossip—you’re the kind of person who steers it.

outcomes.title: Say Nothing
outcomes.desc: Let it burn out without feeding it.

success.text: Without your reaction, the rumor struggles to stay entertaining. People move on.

fail.text: Silence reads as guilt to bored minds. The rumor sticks longer than it should.

name: Bullies’ Toll
prompt: A pair of older youths block the alley, casual as if violence is just another kind of weather. They want coin, or pride, or both.

outcomes.title: Hit First
outcomes.desc: End the negotiation before it begins.

success.text: You swing with all your fear behind it and drop the loudest one. The other backs off, surprised you had teeth.

fail.text: You commit and they were ready. You take a hard blow and stumble away bleeding pride and skin.

outcomes.title: Talk Them Down
outcomes.desc: Make them feel stupid for needing this.

success.text: You find the right insult disguised as a compliment. They let you pass, pretending it was their choice.

fail.text: Your words don’t land. You pay a coin just to keep your teeth.

outcomes.title: Slip Past
outcomes.desc: Use shadow and timing.

success.text: You move when they blink and vanish into crowd noise. You learn which corners they own.

fail.text: A hand catches your collar. They shout for guards—not because they want justice, but because it scares you.

outcomes.title: Endure It
outcomes.desc: Give up nothing but dignity and leave.

success.text: You keep your face blank and walk through their jeers. Later, you realize you didn’t give them what they wanted most: your fear.

fail.text: They follow you, loud, making sure the street knows you were prey today.

name: Kitchen Shift
prompt: An innkeeper offers you a pallet by the hearth if you work the kitchen: peel roots, scrub pots, and keep out of the way when tempers flare.

outcomes.title: Work Clean and Quiet
outcomes.desc: Do the job well enough to be forgotten.

success.text: You eat hot broth and sleep near warmth. Your body loosens a little.

fail.text: The steam and damp settle into your lungs. You wake with a cough that won’t take a hint.

outcomes.title: Learn the Ledger
outcomes.desc: Watch the coin box and the cheats around it.

success.text: You learn who skims, who pays, and who can’t afford to be known here. You also learn how to take a little for yourself.

fail.text: Someone notices you noticing. Their smile is friendly and sharp.

outcomes.title: Pocket the Tips
outcomes.desc: No one keeps track in a busy kitchen.

success.text: You take a few coins and no one proves it was you.

fail.text: A barked accusation turns into a hand on your shoulder. The innkeeper calls for guards to protect their reputation.

outcomes.title: Prove Your Strength
outcomes.desc: Lift the heavy barrels. Take the burn of effort like it’s nothing.

success.text: You earn respect from the staff and a larger bowl of stew. It’s not much, but it’s real.

fail.text: A barrel slips. The impact is minor, but it leaves a bruise that reminds you for days.

name: Border Questions
