prompt: At a checkpoint, a bored guard scans your face like it might become a problem. "Where are you going?" they ask, as if going is a crime.

outcomes.title: Tell the Truth
outcomes.desc: Keep it simple. Keep it clean.

success.text: They wave you through with a grunt. The road is harsh, but it’s open.

fail.text: They decide your truth is suspicious. You’re turned back with a warning that stings.

outcomes.title: Explain Precisely
outcomes.desc: Names, dates, reasons. Give them too much to dispute.

success.text: You answer before they finish asking. The guard loses interest and lets you pass.

fail.text: The questions multiply. You leave drained and a little frightened of how easily paperwork becomes a cage.

outcomes.title: Bluff Confidence
outcomes.desc: Act like you belong and force them to decide quickly.

success.text: They hesitate, then step aside. Confidence is a counterfeit seal that sometimes works.

fail.text: A second guard leans in and calls the bluff. Now your name gets written down.

outcomes.title: Slip the Line
outcomes.desc: Go around in the brush where rules don’t reach.

success.text: You bypass the checkpoint and discover why it exists: a smuggler trail worn into the undergrowth.

fail.text: A patrol dog catches your scent. Shouts rise and you run with your heart in your throat.

name: Runaway Friend
prompt: A friend you grew up with shows up at dusk with a pack and panic in their eyes. "I can’t stay," they say. "Not after what I did."

outcomes.title: Help Them Flee
outcomes.desc: Share your route and your risk.

success.text: You guide them to a safer road and keep your voice steady until their shaking stops. They will remember this.

fail.text: Someone sees you together and assumes the worst. Now you’re tied to their crime whether you wanted it or not.

outcomes.title: Demand the Truth
outcomes.desc: If you’re risking anything, you want to know what.

success.text: You get the full story: the wrong house, the wrong temper, the wrong witness. Knowing it helps you choose the right next step.

fail.text: Your questions sound like judgment. They leave in anger, and the village later blames you for not stopping them.

outcomes.title: Turn Them In
outcomes.desc: Save yourself by buying the law’s favor.

success.text: You tell a guard where they went. The village calls you responsible. Your friend will call you something else.

fail.text: The law takes your information and still looks at you like you’re the same kind of problem. You’re watched now.

outcomes.title: Fight for Them
outcomes.desc: If someone comes, you’ll stand between.

success.text: When a search party comes too close, you intercept them long enough for your friend to vanish into dark fields.

fail.text: The confrontation turns physical and you take the first hit. The pain is small. The consequences aren’t.

name: Temple Errand
prompt: A shrine-keeper asks you to carry offerings to an outlying roadside altar. "Bandits don’t rob shrines," they say. The way they say it makes you doubt that.

outcomes.title: Deliver Them Openly
outcomes.desc: Walk in daylight with the offerings visible.

success.text: You arrive with everything intact. The keeper blesses you with gratitude instead of ceremony.

fail.text: Someone tries to take the offerings anyway. You fend them off, but not without a bruise and a lesson.

outcomes.title: Hide the Pouch
outcomes.desc: Carry it like it’s nothing and watch the road.

success.text: You avoid the obvious danger and notice the real one: a patrol schedule and a blind stretch of road.

fail.text: You take the long way through damp hollows. The cold clings to you afterward.

outcomes.title: Skim an Offering
outcomes.desc: A coin for your trouble. The shrine won’t miss one.

success.text: You take one coin and the pouch still feels heavy. The guilt is lighter than hunger, so you keep walking.

fail.text: A sudden chill runs up your spine, and you swear the road goes quiet around you. Whether curse or conscience, it clings.

outcomes.title: Ask for a Guard
outcomes.desc: Bring someone with a spear and split the risk.

success.text: A local guard accompanies you and treats you like someone worth protecting. That feeling has value.

fail.text: The guard expects payment you can’t afford. You pay anyway because pride doesn’t stop knives.

name: Stolen Livestock
prompt: A neighbor’s goat is gone. In a hungry season, that’s not inconvenience—it’s survival. Everyone looks at everyone.

outcomes.title: Track the Prints
outcomes.desc: Treat it like a hunt.

success.text: You find where the goat was driven and who drove it. The answer is uglier than you hoped.

fail.text: The trail splits in muddy confusion. You lose half a day and gain nothing but fatigue.

outcomes.title: Confront the Suspect
outcomes.desc: Make them answer in public.

success.text: Your accusation lands true. The village mood shifts in your favor and the goat returns, shame-faced and alive.

fail.text: You accuse the wrong person and the village remembers it as cruelty, not vigilance.

outcomes.title: Steal It Back
outcomes.desc: If someone took it, you can take it too.

success.text: You reclaim the goat under cover of night and feel like a hero and a criminal in the same breath.

fail.text: A lantern catches you mid-act. Now the story is about you, not the goat.

outcomes.title: Offer Compensation
outcomes.desc: Give what you can to keep peace.

success.text: You share your own food and keep the feud from forming. In small places, that matters.

fail.text: You give what you can and it still isn’t enough. The season is too lean for generosity to fix.

name: A Secret Letter
prompt: A sealed letter is pressed into your palm by someone who won’t meet your eyes. "Deliver it," they say. "Don’t read it." The seal looks expensive.

outcomes.title: Deliver Without Peeking
outcomes.desc: Do the job cleanly.

success.text: You deliver it and are paid with coin and the knowledge that someone important now knows you exist.

fail.text: A watcher notices the exchange. Their attention sticks to you like soot.

outcomes.title: Read It Quickly
outcomes.desc: Knowledge is leverage, even stolen knowledge.

success.text: You glance at the key lines and learn a name you weren’t meant to see. You reseal it well enough to pass.

fail.text: The seal tears. Now the letter is evidence of your curiosity.

outcomes.title: Sell It
outcomes.desc: Someone will pay for what’s inside.

success.text: You trade it to the right buyer and walk away heavier and less safe.

fail.text: You choose the wrong buyer. The moment becomes a trap with guards on both sides.

outcomes.title: Refuse It
outcomes.desc: Hand it back and step away.

success.text: You refuse politely and keep your hands clean. Word travels that you can say no.

fail.text: They take offense. In their telling, your refusal becomes disrespect.

name: Sickhouse Choice
prompt: The sickhouse smells of vinegar and fear. A healer looks you over like a ledger line and asks what you can pay: coin, labor, or truth.

outcomes.title: Pay Coin
outcomes.desc: Buy care the clean way.

success.text: You pay and receive medicine that tastes like bile and works anyway.

fail.text: The price rises the moment you agree. You pay more than you planned just to be treated at all.

outcomes.title: Work the Ward
outcomes.desc: Earn the care by doing the unpleasant parts.

success.text: You scrub, carry, and sit with the frightened. The healer treats you with something like respect.

fail.text: You breathe too much sickness for too long. Your own illness deepens.

outcomes.title: Steal the Tonic
outcomes.desc: If care is withheld, take it.

success.text: You lift a bottle and swallow medicine in the alley like a crime. It helps.

fail.text: A nurse catches you and calls for guards. In a sickhouse, order matters more than mercy.

outcomes.title: Demand Care
outcomes.desc: Make it a scene they can’t ignore.

success.text: You force their attention and get treated, grudgingly. Sometimes being difficult is survival.

fail.text: Your anger becomes the story, not your need. They treat you, but the room decides you’re the problem.

name: Knife Lesson
prompt: A back-alley mentor offers you a simple deal: learn to hold a knife without shaking, and you’ll never be truly helpless again. The lesson costs something.

outcomes.title: Train Hard
outcomes.desc: Take bruises now to avoid wounds later.

success.text: Your grip steadies and your fear becomes something you can carry.

fail.text: The lesson turns rough. You leave with a split lip and a new understanding of your own limits.

outcomes.title: Learn the Tricks
outcomes.desc: Footwork, angles, when to run.

success.text: You learn what the mentor doesn’t brag about: how to survive without winning.

fail.text: The lesson drags and your mind slips. You leave tired and unsure you learned anything at all.

outcomes.title: Pay with a Favor
outcomes.desc: Coin is one cost. Loyalty is another.

success.text: You don’t pay today, but you will. The mentor smiles like a banker.

fail.text: The favor is named too soon and it’s uglier than you expected. You feel the hook sink in.

outcomes.title: Refuse the Lesson
outcomes.desc: Keep your hands clean, whatever it costs.

success.text: You walk away. You keep your principles and your uncertainty.

fail.text: They laugh as you leave. Later, someone repeats that laughter at your expense.

name: Caravan Offer
prompt: A caravan master sizes you up. "We need bodies," they say. "Not heroes." The road they’re taking is long and contested.

outcomes.title: Sign On
outcomes.desc: Take the honest work and the honest risk.

success.text: You earn your keep and learn the rhythm of travel: wake, haul, watch, repeat.

fail.text: You last, but barely. By the time camp is made you can’t feel your feet.

outcomes.title: Guard the Rear
outcomes.desc: Make yourself useful with steel.

success.text: You drive off a petty threat and earn the caravan’s rough respect.

fail.text: A thrown stone catches you and you limp through the next day cursing your own bravery.

outcomes.title: Skim the Cargo
outcomes.desc: If the road is dangerous, why not take your cut now?

success.text: You take a small item that won’t be missed until it’s too late. Your purse grows.

fail.text: A watchman checks bundles and finds your hands in the wrong place.

outcomes.title: Negotiate Better Terms
outcomes.desc: Make your youth sound like value, not liability.

success.text: You get a better cut and a small promise of protection.

fail.text: The caravan master laughs. You leave feeling smaller than you did a minute ago.

name: Wolf Pups
prompt: A den of wolf pups lies hidden in bracken. The mother is nowhere in sight, which means she’s close. In a harsh world, even pity has consequences.

outcomes.title: Leave Them
outcomes.desc: Nature’s business is not yours.

success.text: You step away without making it your problem. Restraint is survival too.

fail.text: You leave—but the mother sees you anyway. Her eyes track you until you’re out of sight.

outcomes.title: Take One
outcomes.desc: Sell it, raise it, use it—choose later.

success.text: You grab a pup and run before the mother arrives. The pup’s whine is loud in your arms.

fail.text: The mother returns like lightning. You escape, but not without a bite that teaches you about arrogance.

outcomes.title: Study the Tracks
outcomes.desc: Learn where the pack hunts and avoid it later.

success.text: You map the pack’s path in your head and leave with useful knowledge.

fail.text: You linger too long. The mother’s presence turns your careful study into a frantic retreat.

outcomes.title: Protect the Den
outcomes.desc: Drive off a scavenger or rival predator.

success.text: You scare off the threat and leave the den intact. It feels like doing something good in a world that resents it.

fail.text: The fight is messy and close. You win, but you bleed for it.

name: Moot of Youngbloods
prompt: The village’s older heads let the young speak this season, more as a pressure valve than respect. Still, words said in public can become real.

outcomes.title: Speak for Fairness
outcomes.desc: Argue for those who get ignored.

success.text: You speak plainly and the room listens longer than expected.

fail.text: Your speech is called naive. Laughter follows you out the door.

outcomes.title: Listen for Leverage
outcomes.desc: Let others talk themselves into revealing needs.

success.text: You learn who’s feuding and why. That knowledge is a tool you can keep.

fail.text: Someone notices you watching instead of speaking. Their attention feels like a hand on the back of your neck.

outcomes.title: Propose a Plan
outcomes.desc: Offer logistics, not ideals.

success.text: You propose storage, patrol rotations, shared labor—practical steps that keep people alive.

fail.text: Your plan becomes an argument. You spend the whole moot wrestling stubbornness and leave drained.

outcomes.title: Challenge a Rival
outcomes.desc: Turn debate into dominance.

success.text: You win a short, brutal spar and the room accepts your point because your body delivered it.

fail.text: You lose the spar and the room decides your ideas can lose too.

name: Turned Signpost
prompt: A road sign has been turned just enough to send the unwary into bad ground. You’re young, not blind. You notice it in time—barely.

outcomes.title: Fix It Now
outcomes.desc: Turn it back and warn others.

success.text: You set the sign right and save someone else from a slow death. The road feels less cruel for an hour.

fail.text: You waste time arguing with stubborn hardware. The sun drops and you pay for the delay.

outcomes.title: Track the Saboteur
outcomes.desc: Assume it was done on purpose.

success.text: You find boot prints and a cut rope. You don’t catch them, but you learn their route.

fail.text: You follow the trail into an ambush that wasn’t meant for you—until it was.

outcomes.title: Use the Lie
outcomes.desc: Turned signpost means a smuggler path. Use it.

success.text: You take the hidden track and find a dropped pouch and a quiet schedule scratched into stone.

fail.text: A patrol catches you on the wrong path. You run and hear the whistle behind you.

outcomes.title: Call for Help
outcomes.desc: Find a patrol or caravan and involve them.

success.text: You bring the right people and they take it seriously. For once, authority does something useful.

fail.text: They dismiss you as over-imaginative. You walk away feeling smaller and less safe.

name: First Real Choice
prompt: You realize, quietly, that you’re no longer practicing at life. The next decision you make will shape you whether you want it to or not.

outcomes.title: Choose Duty
outcomes.desc: Tie yourself to people who need you.

success.text: You commit to a path of responsibility. It steadies you—and it binds you.

fail.text: Your promise becomes a weight immediately. You feel the hook of expectation set.

outcomes.title: Choose Skill
outcomes.desc: Focus on mastery, even if it makes you lonely.

success.text: You invest in learning. Knowledge accumulates quietly, and then all at once.

fail.text: You try to learn too much too fast. Your mind frays and you lose sleep you needed.

outcomes.title: Choose Freedom
outcomes.desc: Refuse to be claimed, even by good offers.

success.text: You say no to an easy track. The people who understand call it courage.

fail.text: People interpret your refusal as arrogance. Your name takes a small hit.

outcomes.title: Choose the Shortcut
outcomes.desc: If the world is cruel, be cruel back—just a little.

success.text: You take an opportunity that isn’t entirely clean and gain a small advantage you can feel in your pocket.

fail.text: The shortcut leaves fingerprints. Someone notices you as the kind of person who takes shortcuts.
